review: What I don‚Äôt like about this app is when I get  a ride I select 16 minutes  and I get a driver that will be there 5 minutes not enough time for me to get ready for work. The issue that just happened that I selected 11-25 minutes and the driver was about to be here in 10 minutes it was 3 minutes left until the driver got here to me then switched it to another driver that was 16 minutes away now I have to wait long because Lyft thought this driver was close and the driver was still doing a ride already that‚Äôs not right that I have to wait again for a driver  to come when there was already one on the to get me I can understand if I cancelled but I didn‚Äôt please fix this thank you

I‚Äôm really disappointed in Lyft. And there is no way to contact Lyft other than lost items, etc. I have had drivers call me to ask if I‚Äôm going to Manhattan (I was traveling to another location on LI)‚Ä¶ the next thing, I see a notification by the driver that I had canceled the call (which I had not done). And then there were no other vehicles available in my area. Today, I received notifications that a driver will be there in 14 minutes‚Ä¶ 10 minutes later, I received a notification that another driver would pick me up in 11 minutes. This has happened repeatedly. My pick up time turns into me waiting on the street for 30-40 minutes rather than 15 minutes. Enough Lyft! Do something about this. If you want my continued business.

I have the hospital or wherever else I am fill in my ride details and I always tell them to make sure in the notes they put my phone number and tell the driver to call me instead when I come down from the ninth floor I have something coming in and I have salmon read it to me and it says the driver will  cause my phone to vibrate that does not give me size then somebody else reads a text that the drivers car color is Sachin such and he‚Äôs driving a particular model I can‚Äôt see I‚Äôm blind why don‚Äôt your drivers ever read what they‚Äôre supposed to do and call me because I would ask him to stand outside of the car for a moment and then I could get there. It‚Äôs ridiculous.

Procedure to book was very good and extremely easy. The only issue would be the communication could be better. A notification that your reservation was accepted and all details of the reservation should be able to be seen in the application. A text shows that a reservation was made but without all of the details, time, date, and cost. The only communication I received is a text message confirming that a reservation was made but with out details. It said when a driver picked up this reservation I would be notified. I did not receive any communication until 5 hours before the trip telling me the Driver‚Äôs name and when he would arrive. Up until this time I became worried that the trip was not picked up and I may miss my early morning flight.

My ride with Rob was a wonderful experience. Showed up before I could even get down stairs and he waited patiently while I went into the convenience store. I don‚Äôt need to tell you about convenient stores it takes more than 5 minutes sometimes. However, Rob dropped me off. Made a u-turn, while I was in the store, so I could be picked up at the front door. Simple things like that are why I tip to my gig workers. They don‚Äôt get much for gas. And the $3 isn‚Äôt enough. So you riders out there. I challenge you if you have $$ on you, give it. If not put it into the tips portion. This isn‚Äôt Yellow Cab anymore. Lyft and all the other delivery services need help to support them and their families. 

Thanks again Robert for the opportunity to ride with you tonight 
De Carlla

I am writing this because I think it is important to understand the nature of the situation, as I have been reluctant to have taken trips with ‚ÄúUber ‚Äú and each has been unsatisfactory I want to point out their customer service department which is extremely difficult to get ahold of.

 Every time I have had a Lyft ride the stars I add are because each driver takes the time to connect with the customer and also goes out of their way to assist them, some rides are long and some are short but Lyft never disappoints. 

‚Äú uber ‚Äú has had countless run ins with the news because their drivers are not trained on the customer satisfaction and also because ‚Äú uber ‚Äú does not protect the driver or the passenger as Lyft does. I just want to thank the team at Lyft for doing an outstanding job and looking out for the customer and the driver.

My driver was very personable and accommodating, he made sure that my ride was smooth and secure. He was an excellent driver; strong attention to detail, calm and collective and cautious.  Also, a great conversationalist and had an enthusiastic, positive attitude which made the ride most pleasant.  I have many rides with Lyft and I have had a few great drivers but he has been the best yet.  The drive was a lengthier one and he made it go by quickly with entertaining conversation and ability to pay attention to the road while interacting cautiously with me, multitasking is a skill that I am always impressed by as it is a skill needed in every asset in life.

Thank you to my driver for the wonderful service and thank you to Lyft for hiring top notch quality drivers.

I appreciate the convenience and efficiency.  Thus far 90 % if the drivers were very friendly.  As of 3 months ago because I acquired too many speeding tickets, my  many traffics .  my insurance rate  quadrupled.  It pencils out cheaper to go with you than pay that coverage. Blessings , and thank you for providing a fine way to get around.     Thanks for the Lyft! üé∂üëçüé∂

Rides in Chicago were readily available and on-time.  Seattle Lyft was a horrible experience.  Several drivers sat in the parking lot and cancelled rides after waiting 15 to 20 minutes.  Ashalew was particularly good at gaming the system.  He sat in 2 different parking lots.  When I started to cancel the ride, Lyft informed me that I would be charged to compensate the driver for his time.  I contacted the driver by text and phone to ask if he was still coming.  I received no reply and was hung-up on.  Only after attempting to give him a poor rating and complaint did he finally cancel the trip.  I‚Äôll rent a car in Seattle next time.  It‚Äôs more reliable and less expensive.  Chicago, on the other hand was great!

For some reason I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs only my address or if anyone else has been experiencing this , but when I put in my address it says destination is my correct address and it will have the driver drive to a different location , even tho it doesn‚Äôt match with my address it will still save we arrived . And it‚Äôs ALWYAS the same address (my address) and it always shows the wrong address (the same location /wrong address all the time) but when I use a different address I don‚Äôt experience this problem , not sure if it‚Äôs just my address or anyone else has this problem pleaseeeee fix this . I have a newborn and some drives have made me get out even tho it wasn‚Äôt the right location but because the gps took them there they said they have to leave me there . And I will end up walking with my newborn . Or I‚Äôll miss my ride because it took my drive to the wrong location

I scheduled a ride to the airport the day before and received a message back from Lyft that said Ride Scheduled or something to that matter. It also gave me an arrival time with a ten minute window, and said the driver would text/call me when they were on the way. After 10 minutes past from the time of what the Lyft message said the scheduled driver would arrive I decided to book another trip. At that point a trip was confirmed and the Driver was there within minutes. I got were I needed to go but would have appreciated not having to freak out because I needed to be at the airport to catch a flight. I do not use Lyft much but this issue was not enjoyable and will definitely help me make better decisions about using this service in the future.

review:
I had booked a trip from Manchester to Logan Airport. After waiting more than 20 minutes, the car arrived and when I got in the driver asked where I was going and when I said to Logan Airport, he said that he could not take me there because his shift was ending soon and that I should get out of the car, cancel the trip and ask for another car. He was not apologetic at all and was kind of blaming me for the situation.
I got out and canceled the trip and booked another one. After fifteen minutes of waiting, I was notified that this ride had been canceled for some unknown reason and my next ride would get there in another 15 minutes. In short, I had to wait for about an hour to get a ride! I have never had such an unpleasant experience. To be fair, the last driver, Matt, who picked me up was very kind and a very good driver.

I have had not one but two drivers who took me to the wrong address and expected extra money either in cash or through the app. And the first time I didn‚Äôt get any type of refund or a ride credited. Or even money off! The second time a five dollar off credit. So I have literally been scammed out of 60$. And I definitely feel like every single person who takes advantage of this opportunity to make extra income should be fired on spot !!!! I don‚Äôt go out and earn money just to give it away because someone else who works for the company doesn‚Äôt like the rates that they receive! I can‚Äôt stand at my register and tell people they have to pay me a extra fee for having to wait on them on top of my pay ! So why do they get to be legal scammers!!!!! Make that make sense!!!!!!!!!!

Lyft has always been a reliable and affordable transportation option for me. However, my recent experience with their customer service and ‚Äúsafety‚Äù team has left me quite dissatisfied. I had reported to Lyft that my driver yesterday evening had made some discriminatory/racist remarks during the ride, which made me very uncomfortable. I received a follow-up from Lyft this morning, indicating that they had ‚Äúinvestigated the incident‚Äù. This basically meant that they had told the driver what I said, which prompted him to retaliate against me by making up some inflammatory story about misconduct that I had engaged in. Despite it being completely untrue, Lyft made no attempts to verify the actual events with me. I‚Äôve learned from this experience that they don‚Äôt actually care about your safety or the truth‚Ä¶ they just want to cover their own behinds in the event that something goes awry. Truly disappointing.

Been using Lyft for years. But somehow I get charged for two 10 second rides that should take 25 minutes to complete to the airport all the while my actual driver was still on the way. Tried to dispute it in the app and their help feature is useless. It‚Äôs just an algorithm that looks and sees the driver pushed the button that they picked you up and again when they drop you off. Then it basically tells you too bad you‚Äôre not getting a refund because it‚Äôs a valid pick up. There is no way to get a real person that uses common sense. You know who does have real people you can contact‚Ä¶..UBER!

I‚Äôll be disputing it with my credit card company. Not paying $20 for something that never happened. Lyft if you read this‚Ä¶.maybe hire a couple of real people to help with issues and not depend 100% on a computer to think for you.

Before my $1000 credit card fraud, I would‚Äôve given this app 5 stars. I‚Äôm currently waiting for my bank to finish an investigation on fraud charges totaling almost $1000 on my old credit card. I only used that card once on the app, then I started getting what I thought were double charges, only to find out that the charges weren‚Äôt my rides. I almost never put anything on my credit card and I have been paying with PayPal all but that one time. My bank told me that Lyft gets hacked often by people who want to easily steal others credit cards, and that it‚Äôs common for clients to make claims about it. I‚Äôm not using this app anymore until Lyft become more secure. I‚Äôll stick with Curb and the other taxi apps for now, which are reliable but not security risks.

Unnecessarily difficult to contact customer and then they‚Äôre extremely unhelpful.
I chose a wait & save ride, a driver took it, I waited, Lyft reassigned to a closer driver, then that driver cancelled it at the last minute and I had to book a new trip at a price that was 30% higher.
Once I finally was able to get to the messaging the representative didn‚Äôt listen to me at all, responded by saying it was a temporary charge that wouldn‚Äôt go through after I specifically stated ‚Äúplease don‚Äôt respond saying it‚Äôs a temporary charge as that‚Äôs not the issue I have.‚Äù 
They then followed up with ‚Äú This is beyond my expertise and we are unable to do it here on my end. I believe I‚Äôve answered all your questions for today. If you don't have any other concerns besides this, I‚Äôll be ending this chat session now.‚Äù
To which I replied you have not answered my question, if it‚Äôs not your expertise please put me in touch with someone who has that expertise. They then just stopped responding.

I have to say I really enjoyed my first time using Lyft. Omg.. my driver was on time before I could get to the front door!üëçüèΩ Her car was so clean and smelled awesome! She had great conversation and made me feel very comfortable as she knew this was my first time using Lyft! My return trip was even more special! My driver too was on time and was in front of the movie theater without me even asking! Her car as well was extremely clean and stocked with bottled water and magazines to read if you want. She had a great knowledge of the city and had great conversation . ***** 5 stars to both of my drivers who introduced me to Lyft! I had spectacular rides and loved my experiences with my drivers. I WILL BE USING LYFT AGAINüëçüèΩ! A new Lyft rider Wilma Washington

As someone who doesn‚Äôt have a vehicle I use Lyft and Uber almost everyday and I never imagined something like this would happen to me. One day I ordered a $8 ride to work, which was about a 3 minute drive. And because I‚Äôm a female I was with my boyfriend so I wouldn't be alone. About 3 hours after I got a message from Lyft accusing me of damaging a drivers vehicle (which I did not do) and they withdrew $80 straight from my account because I didn‚Äôt have pictures of proof that I didn‚Äôt do it. There is little to no compensation for the rider when your with Lyft. They didn‚Äôt do anything on my behalf, it was absurd. All I‚Äôm saying is be careful who your riding with and please make sure your taking pictures of your drivers cars because scammers do exist. My driver knew that I wouldn‚Äôt have any pictures of the inside of his vehicle and most likely had fake photos on deck of what he pinned on me.  I was such an idiot to ride with Lyft, never again will I ever.

It‚Äôs nice you have low prices but there are times when my driver is 3 minutes away and cancels. I‚Äôve had ride where I‚Äôve been cancelled on 3+ times in a 20 minute period only to wait 4+ minutes to find me a new driver. Out of respect for your customers, drivers should provide a reason for cancellation. Also allowing the customer to rate a driver for cancelling. This way we know everything. Then we can also report a driver based on why they are cancelling and be able to write a review so other passengers can see that there is a chance they will be cancelled on. Since you have 0 customer support, I only ride with Lyft when the price is lower than Ubers ride. There needs to be something done about this absurdity of cancellations like offering credit to passengers to have this happen to ensure that you actually feel bad for the passenger for something you allow to happen.

I don‚Äôt think I have ever received such poorly customer support from a company ever. I was charged a no show fee even though I was at the shared-ride pick up point at JFK. I took screen shots of the app chat I had with the driver stating he was at departures and was going to drive around to meet me at the pick up point. Needless to say he never came and I was charged for ‚Äúmaking him wait‚Äù 5 minutes. Even though I had proof the driver was not at the pick up point, Lyft customer service kept saying the App showed him there and that it was my fault for making him wait that I got charged. I was issued a $6.03 credit on the app which I won‚Äôt be using. Uber might be a little pricier but their app is easier to navigate and their customer support is much better.

I‚Äôll give it five stars because makes you pay more when it has to and let‚Äôs you pay less most of the time. The quality control with the Staff is ‚Äúat least to me‚Äù top notch and I‚Äôve had nothing but five star interactions, good conversations, and affordable rides.. I have one con though.. about a year ago, somebody not only stole my ride but changed the destination of the ride as to which I was charged‚Ä¶ There was one time the driver has his GPS mess up and a $17 ride what‚Äôs upwards of 40 ‚Äústill a great driver, with much patience and intuitiveness‚Äù . However, in these two situations I was severely slighted. But no harm no foul lift is still by far my favorite transportation app and will remain so Until further notice. Much love and appreciation to the Dev team, driving, Staff and the America. Good day allüôèüëè

I‚Äôve been using this app ever since it came out. I‚Äôve never had any issue to the app and drivers before and I‚Äôve also been fair when it comes to tipping the drivers. It‚Äôs not only that the CUSTOMER SERVICE are no help as well. I‚Äôve tried disputing an $80 ‚ÄúDamage fee‚Äù when I‚Äôve never destroyed or dirtied someone‚Äôs car. Asked if I wanted to wait and save up to 30 minutes for a lower price which was perfect because I had to finish getting ready for work, 3 minutes after selecting this option a driver was at my house with a 5 minute timer started! I messages the driver and support and asked how to resolve this issue and they said I would be changed a no show fee and must cancel this ride and request another. Forget about Lyft they are a thing of the past and no longer relatable.

Using lyft originally was great. however i ran into a problem yesterday with a lyft driver scamming me out of 80$ because i spilled a small drink in his car no real damage was done because he had no material in his car that would've been stained or messed. Lyft used to be a really great app but at this point if you can, stick with Uber. It is also cheaper most of the time. I have been having horrible experiences with my drivers picking me up at wrong locations even though the gps clearly says it. There are also times where drivers are driving far away or simply not moving and you‚Äôve been waiting for minutes now and a bit of time and you‚Äôll probably get a cancel fee even though the drivers are making no progress at all. Lyft has also started basically doing random charges of anywhere from $1-$5. I understand that maybe things take longer sometimes or whatever but it has literally been every single time I use this app which I find odd. It starts adding up very fast and basically the price you are given at this point, more time more than not is not actually the price.

First experience with LYFT was nerve wrecking. We organized lift for 7:20. 7:10 driver says he is at the hotel; we go down; no driver, text messages and waiting and him saying he is there when not, car shows on map driving around various hotels aside from ours then suddenly he disappears and another guy takes over then 3 minutes later that guy disappears and my app says I cancelled which I did not. Then I tried to book another, mind you now we are 25 minutes later, and app won‚Äôt let me use same credit card. My third driver was wonderful, but my cc still shows the original booking as pending meaning I feel I was charged twice and there is no way to complain about the first two drivers that had lots of 5 star reviews. Clearly you cannot rate them when they don‚Äôt pick you up properly. Poor rating system.

Beware of scamming Lyft drivers. They except a ride then don‚Äôt show up after telling you. They‚Äôre four minutes away. Three minutes away. Then it updates back to 12 minutes away. Then four minutes away. Only to never show up. And I was scared to cancel thinking I was going to be charge because I was not within the time a lot a lot it to cancel. There was major traffic on the highway so a lot of rides were late, but every last person that came out, waiting for their driver left before us even those who had just walked up there within 10 minutes. This driver would not answer the phone, sent it straight to voicemail, and did not communicate through the Lyft app. Was told that there are several drivers out there that will do this hoping you were canceled so they get paid for the ride anyway. They need to be identified and take it off the Lyft driver list

The drivers should be following the routes given by Lyft. I have now had two drivers tell me that they can choose to go a different route so that they can get paid more and charge the rider more money. I should not have to tell my drivers every ride that they need to take the highway like the app says for them to do so. I will not continue using Lyft if this issue is not handled fast. I was wondering where all these small charges in my card from Lyft were coming from and now I know where. At this point I will need to start disputing them with my bank if this kind of behavior continues with your drivers.
They do not help to tell me what I did for a low star rating. Riders have to give a reason for a low star rating, why do we not get told what it was that made them give us a low rating? I am always kind to my drivers and super respectful to their vehicles. So this makes no sense to me what so ever.

My go to however (Lately) the service has been iffy in the Manhattan/Bronx area of New York City. In the previous months it‚Äôs been high cancellations, and frequent occasions of Lyft drivers not picking up at the right location (blocks away from the pickup location.) Also lately I experienced drivers using cars with issue of odors. I do use this app often because it‚Äôs connected to my Delta rewards and when I travel it‚Äôs a great & reliable app to move around the states. I think it‚Äôs time Lyft puts some mystery riders in the cabs to see what‚Äôs going on undercover.  Like a personal shopper type of experience. In my area the cabs have been questionable and 50/50 service. I‚Äôm going to leave 4/5 stars now but I‚Äôll update it soon and give an official review on other platforms in the near future.

while on vacation I took several lyft rides in florida. One of them was an $8 ride that i was charged $80 for! For 1 there was a communication barrier between us as i only speak english and his english was very minimal. I believe he spoke spanish. i could barely understand him but i do know he came up behind me a few minutes after i exited the vehicle and was headed into my destination and asked me if i had taken his charger by mistake. I only knew exactly what he said because the lady in the business i was going into told me what he was saying. I told him no i did not. He kept ranting about the charger and said he would make a police report. I then walked off to avoid any further confrontation as i knew i hadn't taken anything from his vehicle plus he was a man and i was out of town, creepy situation to say the least. So, to be charged $80 is unacceptable and very shocking! Please reimburse the funds minus the ride fee. Thanks in advance.

At first I liked that it had better prices then other apps like Uber and curb but everytime I needed a ride no matter where I was I would have at least 1-2 people cancel and me having to wait even longer time especially today I needed one I waited 8 mins for the driver to come and when he came he found out I was going to white stone not white plains and said he is not taking me there even though they are not far from each other and couldve just taken me the rest kept cancelling without even coming about 5 mins after waiting for each of them they would cancel and I just ended up having enough of it and got a Uber and these shot lyft drivers had me late for work. App really needs to pick its drivers right because it spends 2 mins searching too just for it to find drivers that don‚Äôt wanna go to the place you‚Äôre going too.

I‚Äôve had drivers leave if I‚Äôm not immediately outside as opposed to waiting the five minutes that they‚Äôre supposed to. The ride history never shows up so I have to contact Lyft via Twitter to report the drivers. I had a driver refuse my destination. I was going 20 minutes to the very next town over but he made me get out and cancel the ride. Why are you driving if you refuse to leave a certain area? So I had to stand there at night, in the cold for fifteen minutes for my next ride. I will constantly have cancellations for rides when one is supposedly coming. 
 They‚Äôve been jacking up the prices at night, I‚Äôll get rides that are in the $100s compared to the normal prices. I‚Äôve also had navigation issues. They have the address to my house on the other side of the street, for some reason I can‚Äôt set my location to Giant just the Giant pharmacy. Drivers can‚Äôt figure out my job location despite the big sign and logo.

We requested a ride from Lyft. We were given the price for a standard ride and approximate time of arrival. We accepted. We were told our driver would be identified shortly. In a few minutes we were informed that our driver was Virginia and she would be arriving in 9 minutes. The arrival time stayed at 9 minutes and then stayed at 7 minutes. Then it started down and when it reached 3 minutes the arrival time was replaced with a message. Searching for a driver. After a few minutes, we were told that Ram was our driver and he would be arriving in 7 minutes. Like Virginia, Ram also only reached the 3 minute mark and we started the process a third time. The third driver arrived, but some 20 minutes after the first driver was due. We learned from the third driver that the problem is with the Lyft driver app. He has accepted a pick up only to be dropped in route.   
Once the ride has been accepted there should be no changes.

First thing I want to say is that, on the business side of Lyft, I hate them with a passion. I used to be a driver and they fired me when I caught COVID back in 2021. And they banned me from driving for life. On the consumer side of Lyft. Only reason I started using Lyft rideshare services is because of my current job. They give all of us a Lyft pass which I didn‚Äôt know about till now. I have to admit, I‚Äôm starting to like Lyft services a bit more than Uber expect for one thing, some of the drivers. I‚Äôve had way more drivers cancel on me in the one month of using Lyft than I‚Äôve had the last 5 years using Uber. Some of the drivers only care about money and that‚Äôs very aggravating when you have to be somewhere at a certain time. Overall tho, I can see me using Lyft more often since they have better options for the service then Uber does. We‚Äôll see how this goes.

I am a new Lyft rider and very grateful for this service. As I rate this App the first thing I can say is I don‚Äôt believe it is user friendly.  I had issues with putting my credit card on file. The App continues to request me to confirm my credit card when I have done so several times. I am certain that I have put in the right info but it will not allow me to use the card to schedule a ride. I am not allowed to delete the info to start over because it wants another card to do so. I had to purchase a gift card to be able to use the service. The next issue I noticed is I can‚Äôt just go directly to schedule a ride. Sometimes the screen get stuck or won‚Äôt allow you to shift to another screen until you rate your recent ride. This is something that should be optional, maybe I don‚Äôt want to do so. Overall, I am grateful for the service at a time when I desperately needed it. Ty

I recently had the pleasure of riding with a Lyft driver who exceeded all expectations. From the moment I got into the car, their friendly and welcoming demeanor put me at ease. The driver was not only professional, but also extremely knowledgeable about the area, providing me with interesting insights and recommendations along the way.

What stood out the most about my experience was the driver's attention to detail. They ensured that the car was clean and comfortable, creating a relaxing environment for the entire journey. The driver's excellent navigation skills also made the ride smooth and efficient.

Not only did this Lyft driver provide a safe and enjoyable ride, but they also went above and beyond to make the journey memorable. Their friendly conversation and positive attitude made the experience truly delightful. I would highly recommend this driver to anyone in need of reliable transportation.

My mom has been a Lyft driver for at least 1 to 2 years. She did everything in her power to keep customer reviews up and followed all rules and regulations from Lyft. This job was easy for her due to her back pain and having to deal with many issues we had going on. That was until Lyft kicked her out closing her account. They kept on saying there was a flag on her account when she went to look there wasn‚Äôt. She tried to contact them several times but they never had any form of contact. Absolutely ridiculous if I say so. She contacted the dmv etc they said there‚Äôs nothing either. She finally got a hold of the customer service only for them to repeat the same thing over and over. THERE WAS NO PROBLEM OR SPECIFIC REASON FOR THIS! At the end they kept saying the same thing and I‚Äôm just tired of this. The amount of stress this brought my mom is unforgivable! I am extremely upset with the unavailable rides as well and everything with this company is completely terrible.

I will say the majority of rides are normal easy experiences‚Ä¶.but‚Ä¶.there have been a few too many times when drivers will either intentionally drive the wrong way when picking me up to force me to cancel, or will cancel as they get close to the pick up. 

The latest one, I was on crutches for a torn ligament in my foot that happened only the day before. I had a doctors appointment to get a second opinion on whether I needed surgery. Kind of vital to get there on time. I ordered the Lyft, the driver GOT to my location, saw me, and cancelled. I was late to my appointment. 

There has to be stricter accountability for drivers cancelling. Maybe time limits to get to pick up, the ability to leave ratings for cancelled rides, or a fee for canceling on a rider. Either way, this lack of consistency makes Lyft unreliable to the point where I won‚Äôt use it for time sensitive obligations.

Today I was picked up at a subway but when I stepped outside I didn‚Äôt see anyone. He ended up being in a wrong spot behind cars which on his end, he wasn‚Äôt visible to the eye. I got in and he gave me a lecture about how I need to get my number fixed even though my number is set up, all that because when he called it didn‚Äôt go to me. I had already seen the notifications on the app about him being there and I don‚Äôt see how much more contact he needed to give after, especially after 4 consecutive messages within the same minute. I‚Äôve experienced rude or annoyed drivers in the past on Lyft but never has someone talked down to me over a phone number. ‚Äú20 years‚Äù he‚Äôs been working for lyft is what he said, the whole ride he just kept talking about it and not letting it go. I‚Äôve never even had a bad experience on Uber, definitely not again on Lyft. You can‚Äôt even pay me all the money in the world for me to order a ride on this app again, that has drawn the line for me.

Let me start off by saying driving Lyft is amazing. Everything is great until the moment you need help from them. The fact that there isn‚Äôt a customer service number to call and get you help is completely unprofessional!! I‚Äôve been a driver with them for over two and half years and it never seems to get better. You have to jump through hoops just to try to get the help you need. Then at the end all you can do is send a email and they don‚Äôt even reply to within a few hours. I submitted a form at 5:30am this morning and it still has yet to be approved and it‚Äôs almost 12:30pm. That‚Äôs 7 hours of driving time I missed just because they aren‚Äôt doing their jobs. Like I said when it actually comes to driving and getting paid they are good. But if you need help just plan on not getting help that day because they don‚Äôt care!! Completely unprofessional and pathetic! There‚Äôs no way a million dollar business can‚Äôt help their own people. It is disrespectful and not right at all!!

Lyft is a good app that I used quite a bit, in the past. However, Lyft‚Äôs customer service recently left a sour taste in my mouth. 

I requested a ride from the airport, which I no longer needed, but I had horrible service in that area AND the wifi wasn‚Äôt working properly. So, I had trouble canceling my ride as well as getting in contact with my driver. After some pesky minutes, my message went through, but I received no response from the driver and I later discovered that I paid FULL for the ride and the Lyft app claims that I was indeed, ‚Äúdropped off‚Äù. I took screenshots of the messages I exchanged with the driver about canceling my ride and took pictures at airport, including the timestamps. But Lyft‚Äôs customer service didn‚Äôt pay a dime to the proof that I provided and received no compensation. In short, I was completely robbed that day. Don‚Äôt count on the customer service for anything.

Now, I have experienced some bad customer service but when it comes the the worse Lyft has to be top tier worse people to contact for any help. I don‚Äôt think they care at all as long as they get the money. Another thing the over charge for rides, I have legit picked a store right next to my destination and it was significantly cheaper then the first location I picked. They have also assign me with a blocked driver before. This incident I had today is just another example of how the app is bad and not in the customers favor. If you have never used Lyft I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it. Especially with the fact of if you actually need to speak to person. They refer you to the app which the only ask prompted question they have for you. If you have a situation where it doesn‚Äôt meet the prompt you might as well just accept that you loss money. It‚Äôs crazy because I have over 300 rides with Lyft and they have been doing me wrong majority of the time. This app deserves a 1 star rating in my book. Trash

I have to catch Lyft early in the mornings it‚Äôs no way your prices should be darn near $100 to go 15mins away from my house sometimes $20 like your prices jump so bad and it makes no since I wish someone else could have a car service here in Louisiana other then Lyft and Uber your prices are ridiculous for the distance that both of you are charging and everybody here isn‚Äôt rich and those perks that y‚Äôall offer don‚Äôt give much of a cushion either sometimes it‚Äôs worse with those I just wish I had my own car I wouldn‚Äôt recommend either of you guys with those prices it‚Äôs sad I live 10mins away from my destination but you wanna charge me $25 to get there and y‚Äôall barley pay the ppl who using there cars y‚Äôall are real rip offs and I hate that y‚Äôall are the only company‚Äôs that service over city someone needs to come along with wat better prices and affordable and bump both companies broke

When things go well, the app is easy to use so long as you understand that the pickup time shown before you hit "Confirm" often changes to a longer wait time once a driver is assigned.

The only routine problem is that using "My location" for pickup sometimes gets your location wrong, and fixing the pickup location doesn't always work as expected.

But when things go really wrong, you are screwed. This week, a driver canceled my ride while I was standing next to his car waiting to get in. My only option was to re-book. And, prices had gone up. Talk to customer service? There is none. You can only pick from a menu of about 6 standard complaints in the app. and then they don't try to fix the problem, they just give you a trivially small credit.  I confirmed a ride for pickup in 8 minutes. After 40 minutes and three drivers with no pickup, I finally gave up.

Hello, I live in Boston, MA. When Lyft added a feature for viewing public transport (bus or train) I was very excited for this feature because I would see if it was worth waiting for public transportation. That feature included both inbound and outbound and how far away it was or how long it would arrive. Having that feature brought me peace and security especially if you are a parent that depends on that feature. When I noticed it was gone. For a minute I thought the app itself was glitching. I came back again to see if the feature was back and it has not. I‚Äôm very sad and upset by this sudden change. I do hope in the future that Lyft does bring back this feature because it was very useful and helpful for anyone that depends on public transportation. To be straightforward, a lot of people are struggling where they can no longer afford Lyft rides unless they have the means. As a Lyft user please bring this feature back in the near future.

I was driving to pick up a pax, at the pickup they entered the car, I confirmed their name was ‚ÄúBob‚Äù and we started heading toward the drop off location. Halfway through the ride the app makes a ding sound on both our phone and then the address changes to a very different area, and I notice I‚Äôm not headed in the correct direction. I ask the rider if they changed the address, they said no and the rider says ‚Äúthe Lyft Rider app is saying that my driver is Mohammed and we‚Äôre going to a different location.‚Äù I look at my drivers app and realize the name changed to ‚Äúlarry‚Äù so I ask the pax if their name is larry or Bob, to which he replied ‚ÄúBob,‚Äù moments later the app dings again and the ride completely disappears from my screen and the riders screen. The passenger says he no longer has a driver and I no longer had a passenger, so I drove him the remaining distance to his location, while not being paid anything.

STOP allowing drivers to drop rides. Someone picks up my request, drops it, someone else picks up my request, drops it. The maximum cycle I've had of this is six times and was either late for work or late getting home. I give Lyft three hours before I have to be at work and live in a major US city. There's no reason for me to be late for work when... IT JUST HAPPENED AGAIN! Third driver dropped me and a fourth picked me up. There's no reason to be late when there are drivers available and you've given Lyft three hours to deliver you ten miles.  
~~~~~~~~~~~
Please allow riders to see driver's preferred language and allow them to subjectively rate their proficiency in secondary languages. Because of Apple Translator's exceptional standard of accurate translations, it is easy to community with many drivers despite a language barrier between rider and driver.

I think the Lyft app is user-friendly, including being screen reader accessible. However, there is no easy way to report a complaint on a driver who drops you for obvious discriminatory reasons. For example, on April 18, 2023, I requested a ride to go from 300 Stone Crest Parkway, Murfreesboro, TN back to my home located at 6:40 Meadowview Dr., Christiana, TN. Edward, who happens to be deaf or hard of hearing, was well on his way to get me. A few minutes before he arrived, I notified him that I am blind so that he would realize I could not easily recognize where he would be parked. Immediately after he received my message, even though he was about to pick me up, he declined my request. Another driver named Jose, who is very friendly, immediately picked up my request within the app, so I no longer had Edward's information. How do I complain about getting declined simply because I happened to be blind?

So I haven‚Äôt been able to use my account and neither has my mother for months. It‚Äôs a payment issue and I followed the instructions and everything but it still doesn‚Äôt allow me to use it. But no, they gaslight me as if I‚Äôm delusional and aren‚Äôt following instructions. Get better people to help those that need it and that could fix issues in the app.

The first driver Calbel showed up on time in his Jeep Cherokee . He has a full size vehicle and refused to take my sister to her destination. He pulled up and said he didn‚Äôt have room ‚Äúfor all that stuff‚Äù , put up his window and drove off ! What kind of person does that ? That is job abandonment as far as I am concerned. Thank goodness Jugens showed up in his Hyundai Elantra and much smaller sized vehicle and provided a safe ride for my sister and ALL of her stuff to her destination. UPDATE: The algorithm now makes you wait WAY longer than it says and just keeps saying it‚Äôll ‚Äúconnect you soon‚Äù unless you pay ‚âà$15/ride for a ‚Äúpriority pick-up‚Äù after you‚Äôve already been waiting. Even more of a scam than before!

This used to be really reliable, but now the algorithm is complete broken. The closest driver will consistently be 2-3x further away then the estimate, but it might be too late to cancel by the time you find out. Even worse, almost half of drivers cancel after a few minutes of driving to you, increasing the wait even more. Safety concerns also often go entirely unaddressed. Despite reaching out to Lyft multiple times about this driver for weeks, they never got back to me.

Never enough rides in the morning certain drivers need vetting. Had a driver miss my exit what s the med to be intentional kept trying to sell me life insurance after what seemed like an eternity he finally got off an exit and drove me all the way back the ride took twice as long drove 10 miles under the speed limit kept hazily steering into the other lanes stopped at a green light kept asking for my personal information and then was up set when I didn‚Äôt tip and gave 3 stars. Another instance I had a different driver that went the opposite direction of my destination and made stops to give items to people they made me late to work by 47 minutes had another driver that dropped me off at a whole different address said that‚Äôs where I need to go and left walk 4 blocks home. But it is cheaper then Uber

If you have somewhere to be and you need to take Lyft, you should make sure you‚Äôre looking for a ride days/hours before you are supposed to be there. Drivers will drop you when they‚Äôre 10 minutes away and force you to wait longer regardless of how much you pay for the ride or what the ETA is, what time of day or what day of the week. If the driver doesn‚Äôt want to get you, they won‚Äôt. Lyft also charges you whatever they want for any ride of any amount of miles; I‚Äôve needed to travel 17 miles before and they wanted me to pay 87$ for it. It‚Äôs really frustrating to think you can have a way to get a ride, only to find out that one day when you really need to be somewhere, your driver just doesn‚Äôt feel like getting you or Lyft wants to charge inflated amounts because it‚Äôs lunchtime. Lyft can be great. Lyft can be a great way to get somewhere in a pinch, but I wouldn‚Äôt rely on it too heavily lest I miss work or an appointment because I didn‚Äôt try to call my ride 3 hours in advance.

I requested a shared ride but the driver insisted that he never accepts shared rides and was very rude. But he must have known it‚Äôs shared a ride because the other passenger was already in the car and he came to my location to pick me up and called out my name when arrived. So this was what happened and it‚Äôs just so unbelievable - he drove for 5 minutes around my neighborhood and came back to the same spot where he picked me up and told me to get out because it‚Äôs what his apps is telling him to do. And I said you can‚Äôt do this, and he was just like you need to get out. I was heading to Hollywood bowl for a concert and was half an hour late because of this. I filed a complaint but Lyft‚Äôs customer service did NOTHING about it. I was told that they‚Äôll carry out an investigation but there‚Äôs no follow up and I wasn‚Äôt able to ask again about my complaint. I just simply couldn‚Äôt believe that happened. The other passenger in the car was also shocked but said he was going to make a complaint against the driver as well. PLEASE - carefully select your drivers and try to IMPROVE your customer service. It‚Äôs appalling.

Thought I was being proactive scheduling a pickup for four adults early the next morning for a drive to the airport.  Scheduling in advance I could not indicate we needed an SUV for the ride.  Our driver shows up in a Nissan Sentra and we barely fit.  He was kind of grumpy about it too.  My app didn‚Äôt communicate the airport location to him correctly either.  We all confirmed my app said Airport and had the airline correct.  For some reason the driver‚Äôs phone didn‚Äôt get that data either.  We got to the airport on time so at the end of the day it worked.  But users need to be able select XL vehicles when scheduling rides in advance‚Äîespecially for shared rides to the airport because all riders will have luggage.  Next time I‚Äôll just wait until day of to request our pickup.  Seems to work find when we do that.  

Despite these challenges though I still prefer Lyft to other services.  Will try again next trip.

I am very new to this area and my app for a certain ____ just would not work and kept not connecting and I also suffer from epilepsy so stress is a trigger for seizures, I‚Äôm stranded in middle of nowhere (to me) and I happen to meet a man who drives for food delivery and he mentions Lyft, literally in 5 min I was in the sweetest persons car , warm and on my way back to families house in visiting, like across country visiting. I went to go ride one of your scooters on 12/31 in Nashville. After I paid to unlock the scooter I ran into many issues. Don‚Äôt even waste your time looking at all the reviews. Idk how the estimate is 4.9 stars when we all know that isn‚Äôt true. After this review I‚Äôm no longer using the Lyft app. I‚Äôm switching to Uber which I‚Äôve found to be less expensive and more efficient. Lyft scams people, milks them
For their money, has terrible slow drivers who cancel on you last minute, and charges you multiple fees for canceling a ride but never charge a driver for canceling on you. How unfair is that. I canceled because the driver was 20 minutes away and I needed someone closer, but then I was charged 3$ on top of the fact that the ride was 30$ for a 15 minute drive. In some regards, the app was easy to use. In other regards, there were some frustrating situation in trying to use the app for specific inquiries. The app does not ask about number of bags that you have for getting to and from the airport, so we weren‚Äôt sure if the vehicle would accommodate our needs. When I tried to contact Lyft, or even the scheduled driver, there was no way whatsoever to contact either. I googled for ways to contact Lyft, or our assigned driver, but the two things that I did come across, neither one applied in reality. There should at least be able available a way to chat with someone to assuage any concerns. Also, anytime I receive a notification from Lyft on my lock screen, when I tapped on it, it went to cyberspace or somewhere. All that it brought me to is the fact that I had a ride scheduled, but there was nothing about any of the notices that we received. Granted, it may be that my being a first-time Lyft user puts me at a disadvantage because of lack of knowledge, but that‚Äôs where I stand at this time.

There is no way to contact lyft if there is an issue that isn‚Äôt listed in there very limited selection. Ordered an XL for the airport and a Toyota Highlander arrived, it was supposed to be able to fit 6 people and our bags‚Ä¶. Also, they were sitting far in the back of the lot and never responded to any texts and so the time was running out. 

Wouldn‚Äôt let me cancel without being charged. Similarly, there is no way to give feedback on the issues - if you order a nice car and the car that shows up is not that - there is no way to indicate that in the review questions or to change the ride without being charged.

There‚Äôs also not a way to skip the driver if they haven‚Äôt moved for a certain amount of time - for example, it showed the driver hadn‚Äôt moved from their spot since we scheduled the ride (for 5 mins) but then it said we would have to pay them a fee to cancel because the driver had been driving for three minutes. Unless their maps are drastically inaccurate, we could tell someone was lying.

Preordered two days in advance a 4:00AM pickup from home to airport. Could not add message to call me when entering my gated community. Weak point of the application. Suddenly he disappeared and application said they were looking for a driver! I was in panic. Cancelled the ride. Woke up my wife so I drove to airport. Never again! No excuse for being late when app has distance and lead time all pre-calculated for driver.

Now Here in NYC for 2 months.   Many Lyft rides.   Wish the cars had a LYFT sign on window to be sure it is correct car without reading the license plate.    Also, rates vary wildly minute-by-minute depending on availability and target location.  Generally a 90% good experience.

I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs cause it‚Äôs my first time getting scammed but Lyft needs to do a better job protecting the customers that do get scammed my partner got me a ride home from her account with my money my only home right now is just a couch which I‚Äôm still grateful but when I left my partner sent me a notification of a 80 damage fee and I told her I didn‚Äôt do anything I left the car the same way I got in it I‚Äôve reached out to Lyft and still nothing they don‚Äôt take it serious just says the evidence points to me it was a picture of ramen on his seat and on his door dry ramen I went into the car empty handed with nothing but my phone and the clothes I was wearing and Lyft told me it doesn‚Äôt matter and I can reach out to the authorities if I‚Äôm comfortable and I have screenshots of the convo which I will keep I‚Äôm not saying not to use Lyft cause I know people need it but just everytime you get a ride take a picture before you get in and when you leave or record for your own good

I want to particularly compliment Lyft‚Äôs app for being very user-friendly, well-designed, intuitive, and not afraid of adding features that are really useful to the customer. Thanks to the new dialogue that shows up on my iPhone Lock Screen, I was able to catch a routing mistake with my trip and fix it before I was 30 mins out of the way. 

My only current complaint is that in some locations (namely Mukilteo WA recently), the app sometimes automatically accepts a ride on the driver side when they are not ready to take the ride or not paying attention (I wonder if they were sleeping in at least one case). That has led to two instances of drivers just sitting in a casino parking lot not moving or responding while I waited 10-15 minutes for them to move or respond. In both cases when I did finally receive a response they simply cancelled without any apology or explanation, which left me feeling a bit put out. I‚Äôd appreciate if that mechanism could be refined a bit.

I followed the instruction to the pickup location at SFO, but I got no show by two drivers after waiting for more than an hour and ended up paying $30 more for my ride. The app didn‚Äôt show the reason, nor any history from that driver. After waiting for more than one hour, I was force to get a new ride $30 pricier and still 20 mins away.

I‚Äôm posting it here because their customer service is a scam, too. It‚Äôs very hard to find the customer service and after you find it, the agent just doesn‚Äôt reply messages.

One driver even stopped outside my house and as I was walking down the driveway with my suitcase, he must have realized and drove off.  He cancelled the ride and left me standing there.  Took 20 mins for next time driver to arrive, which is a lot when you need to get to the airport.  So Lyft, if you are reading, you should disclose that the destination is an airport so if the driver doesn‚Äôt want to go there, they don‚Äôt accept that job. I needed a ride home and was at a restaurant having just been served. Pathetic customer service!

I was having surgery this morning so I set my ride up last night for today at 10:30 am.   Several hours before I received a notice that Seth would be my driver. He was curtious and kind and understood that I was anxious because I was now late for my surgical arrival.   He drove safely yet intently and got me there only 10 minutes late.   I was very thankful for the second driver.   I pray I don‚Äôt get double charged as contacting Lyft is very difficult.   They don‚Äôt make it easy.

This was my first time using LYFT.  I can not say enough good things about the Lyft service and app! First, to show gratitude, I greatly appreciate the fact that there is a ride share app. Now the truth, drivers will be 3 minutes away and cancel, causing a rebooking that extends your arrival time. In addition, reaching out to customer service does not always help, sometimes they just relay that there is nothing they can do, lacking empathy. I just wish there were higher expectations. I‚Äôm pretty simple, don‚Äôt care too much how u drive to get me from point A to point B.. That being said, I don‚Äôt like messing with peoples money.. It‚Äôs extremely rare I‚Äôll give a negative review or a 1-2 star rating, even though it‚Äôs deserved‚Ä¶ If you want to drive for Lyft, taking care of your clients is your top priority, it‚Äôs not hard to figure out‚Ä¶

This fee is not appropriate. Often times driver‚Äôs state they are here and they are not in the pick up location. Or they pass by the pick up location confusing the ride sharer. After several problems having them charge the correct cards, charging cards long deleted from the account, denying the card I intend to use that has funds, removing cards that should not be used,  charging my bank, I want nothing to do with this application solution anymore. I ordered a lift When I came out of door 20 on level I two of MCO airport in Orlando, there was a car with a lift and Uber trade dress. He asked me if he could help me by offering me a ride. I shoot him I already had a Lyft driver coming. He insisted that lots of bad things happened at the airport and he would gladly take me if I would cancel the first left. For a while now I am using Lyft (majority of the time & Uber on a rare occasion). Now I use Lyft from time to time if I really need to. The issue I encounter with Lyft (Uber on the rare occasion too) is it takes ages to find a driver if you lucky. It takes a good 25+ minutes of searching before exiting out each time. Also it finds 5 drivers in a 4 minute window, which all are 2-3 minutes away. How is there no drivers in a big city ? Or why it switches to 5-7 different drivers in less than 5 minutes? I can kinda understand during a holiday or maybe a weekend/night but not middle of the day. At that point I have to switch ride sharing apps for it to work. What I can see as a solution to fix this issue is to have a timer for 1 minute or so and if no one accepts it within that time, the app will automatically do a 1 minute countdown and if no one accepts in the countdown then the app will accept it for the closest driver and they can‚Äôt decline it without paying a $10 fee. If the driver does those $10 fee twice in a year then they will be terminated. Doing this will help balance the system and make it a smoother process for both the driver and passengers.

This app usually works ok whenever I've needed to to use it, but for some odd reason right now tho, it keeps having me log back in whenever I get back into the app, and most frustratingly, it won't open up where the three horizontal dots are on the top left corner, and anything within that, we have no access to at this time such as support messages or anything. I've tried it from the website too, and while it opens on there, it keeps bringing me back to the app, which acts as if it's been logged back out and the whole cycle all over again! Ughh... It gets so irritating when anything technological like this happens! And on top of it all, there's really no way to reach anyone outside of that message feature, which really doesn't help either in these type of scenerios! So that is certainly something that Lyft and Uber alike can use some good amount of improvement on!! It really would be nice if you guys could add a phone support option for us all too in times like this. Hopefully this will be taken as some feedback on ways to correct these type of issues! Thanks.

This was my very first Lyft ride. I ‚Äúreserved‚Äù a Lyft ride the day before which means I paid extra money to make sure it arrived on time to get me to the airport early bc the security lines are extremely long on the morning flights. I scheduled a Lyft ride while changing planes at the airport in Vegas so I wouldn‚Äôt have to wait and order one at 3am when I landed in Nashville. I texted the driver the minute I touched down and said I was speed walking to the pickup but Lyft made him cancel because I wasn‚Äôt there in the 10min window. I added 15min onto my landing time but I have no control over the plane‚Äôs delay while I‚Äôm air and I can‚Äôt adjust my time while I‚Äôm flying! It was a good ‚Äúfare‚Äù (long drive and big tip) and given that it was 250am and I was exhausted I don‚Äôt understand why if the driver wanted to wait for me he wasn‚Äôt allowed ü§¨.  I didn‚Äôt get into a car until 330am as they then changed cars on me 3 times and didn‚Äôt get to my destination until 415am. 

Uber is more expensive but at least they ask your flight info and have a longer ‚Äúcourtesy wait time‚Äù (which should be standard when you‚Äôre pre-booking based on an airlines projected landing time!).  

The only reason I gave 3 stars was because driver was great and the fare was reasonable‚Ä¶but they need to up their game if they want to keep me as a customer.

If I could give negative stars i definitely would, but unfortunately in order to make a post I have to give at least 1 star‚Ä¶.

As a single working mom, I plan my days and times ahead; even when it comes to Uber & Lyft. I truly have no words for this company. First off, why am I having to pay $50 to go 20 min down the road? That‚Äôs so atrocious! Why am I pre scheduling a ride & still make it to work late??!! How‚Äôs that so!!? I remember when I had to call and take a taxi , definitely didn‚Äôt run into these issues & that was me having to call a number, now I have access on my phone & it make it 15-30 min late.. i have to be at work by 7am, I request an Uber an hour earlier & still end up being late. Although I have used Lyft for years I would rate them ‚Äú0‚Äù for last weekend.
On September 21st, I requested a pick up at 4 am. Due to darkness, I went outside with a flashlight even though I had received no notice that the driver was on his way. I believe he came into the development as I saw a car drive through the development, shortly thereafter I received a note at 4:09 that ride was cancelled by driver. I selected the next driver because I had a flight leaving. The fee was outlandish but the first driver made this my only choice and he responded to me and was there quickly.
On the 24th I needed a ride to the Tampa airport. I was continually getting updates about the time of his arrival. After it indicated 1-4 minutes, I received a notice that no driver was available. Since I am not from the area, I was trying to find someone to take me to the airport as once again I was taking the chance of missing my flight. My sister in law was forced to leave her ailing husband as we could find no other resource. 
I am hoping to pay the original fee not the $200
Plus fee which is totally unfair. 
Lyft was always my way of transportation if needed but never again!!!

I‚Äôve been using Lyft for nearly nine years and it‚Äôs been great, but their customer service has seriously tanked. 

One of their drivers dropped me off at the wrong location, and lyft will not refund my trip. I provided ample evidence and the customer service representative REFUSED to address my problem. Instead, I was continuously told I wasn‚Äôt overcharged and that fares increase when extra stops are added to a trip. However, no matter how many times I said the problem was that I was dropped at the wrong location, they wouldn‚Äôt even acknowledge the actual problem. 

In the end, they simply said they can‚Äôt issue a refund (no explanation despite me asking) but would offer a $5 credit. So‚Ä¶ their solution was to ‚Äúgive‚Äù me back my own money they didn‚Äôt earn, and ‚Äúreturn‚Äù it in a way that will only allow me to give my money back to them. Horrible. I‚Äôve permanently deleted my account. It was only $17, but I‚Äôve taken trips that are upwards of $100. After this, I‚Äôd be crazy to risk throwing away money by continuing to use lyft. Really sad, I‚Äôve given them tens of thousands over the years and they can‚Äôt even return $17? No thanks. At least Uber makes up for their mistakes.

I would say the refund policy for having to book another ride due to a safety issue is poor but it‚Äôs more-so inexistent! I was picked up by a guy and his car had a horrible smell (it was body odor lol). I ignored it since he probably had a long day and i didn‚Äôt complain at all about it because, i mean come on, that would probably embarrass him. But the issue was the constant nagging about me having a husband and then making non stop passes and disgusting remarks. I got so tired of it i asked him to pull over to let me out and i would rather walk the 10mi back. Bro when i tell you he did not stop and locked the doors, i had to pull my tazer out and BUZZ BUZZ click that bad boy a few times. When he saw i was not with the games i got out the vehicle and took the appropriate steps to report it. I then messaged the lyft app to see if i can get a refund and they only mentioned they wouldnt match me with that driver anymore ü´†. So heads up, if the guy is out if police custody, lyft still has him employed. And no matter what, they wont do a thing about anything. I reported it as harassment and they refused to give a refund.

I had pre scheduled Lyft XL (schedule feature) ride for my journey from my home to the airport due to 4 airport size luggage bags and some more bags. However, Lyft sent us a ride with very small car (hatchback). We tried resolving this issue but due to time constraints (we did not want to miss our flight while waiting for Lyft to send us another car) we had to somehow accommodate the bags in that same car. We cramped ourselves in the back seat for the entire journey. This was exactly the reason we had pre scheduled a XL car and not the standard one. It was not drivers fault as she did not know that we ordered XL ride and she was very nice let us ride. This is completely unacceptable that we paid premium ($49 for XL) for our safety and ordered bigger car so we should not face any issues. Or else we could have gone for standard ride (usually takes $30). We are deeply disappointed that we had to ride in such a condition. With this experience that paying premium and getting this service is not acceptable. I will not ride Lyft after this and would not recommend others as well.

I stopped using this app a year ago when I found out it can‚Äôt get my home address at all. I was in the middle of a ride and the driver was confused as to where we were going because it just had a city. When I tried to input my address, it couldn‚Äôt be found. I had been using Lyft over Uber because of the rewards from using my credit card, so it was really weird that it all of a sudden lost and couldn‚Äôt find my address or any address in my neighborhood. I had to get dropped off at a local Target and Uber home. Also, why can‚Äôt you pinpoint your pickup and drop off locations?  

I just got a free subscription to pink through my credit card. Still can‚Äôt find my address, but at least it has my street name. Before booking, the map shows multiple cars in close proximity ‚Äúwithin 1 minute‚Äù, then they all disappear and it takes 20 minutes to find a car 12 minutes away. I get messages of ‚Äúwe‚Äôre contacting drivers.‚Äù Of course, the driver doesn‚Äôt know where to go and has to circle around for another 4 minutes. With the subscription, I thought I was getting a deal with an ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù comfort ride, which ended up being a Nissan Sentra. Not at all worth the $10 saved using Lyft over Uber

Although the wait time is a ‚Äúdiscounted‚Äù price, I wait longer than the allotted time. I should get money back for waiting, even if it‚Äôs because a driver doesn‚Äôt pick up my rides. You should pay them and I pay less even if you lose money because I shouldn‚Äôt wait an hour for a ride. You made me miss my public transport in hopes that someone would pick me up. The wait time was 24minutes. I waited 50. A driver cancelled one me and lyft never gave me another driver. Of course maybe the driver doesn‚Äôt pick up the ride, but when I went to leave a review, the lyft app purposely doesn‚Äôt let you write your own statement unless it‚Äôs against the driver. This makes lyft not accountable for their own app problems. And the FAQ‚Äôs don‚Äôt help anyway. I click ‚Äúno it didn‚Äôt help‚Äù and that‚Äôs all we get. Lyft constantly never wants to admit it‚Äôs own fault. You make the excuse of ‚Äúwell the driver never picked you‚Äù and it‚Äôs automatically no one‚Äôs fault. Waiting an hour for a ride is the worst you might as well not have that option. LYFT doesn‚Äôt doesn‚Äôt count their own faults they blame all the drivers.

My experience with Lyft service so far is very good. The drivers have all been very courteous and professional, and the cars have been clean and comfortable. The app is generally very intuitive and easy to use, with one major exception: if you are scheduling a pick up in a time zone different from the one you are in when you are scheduling the pick up, Lyft will modify the pick up time according to the difference between the two time zones.
I recently traveled from mountain time to central time and selected a pick up time of 9:40 PM at my destination. Lyft adjusted the pick up time +1 hour. This left me waiting in the airport and parking garage for about an extra 40 minutes. It would have been longer, but the driver was early, thankfully.
Lyft should schedule rides according to the times the riders request in the time zone of the pickup. Obviously.
I can‚Äôt imagine what their logic is, adjusting the time zone in the way that they do. This is not consistent with travel time notation used by airlines, or any other transportation service.
You can see the modified pickup time in small print on the page where you select the type of service. Watch carefully.

I have been using Lyft for over a year now, but I will no longer be. I left an item in my Lyft ride, which is completely my fault and I saw the $20 fee I had to pay to get it back. Steep, in my opinion- but, ultimately fair because it‚Äôs my fault and the driver is going out of their way to do so. The driver calls me and states: ‚ÄúYea, I can return them to you but I don‚Äôt know how to charge you for it.‚Äù And I, realizing the lengths that this driver is going through, say: ‚ÄúOh, I‚Äôll just hand you a $20 in cash so you are paid. I want to make sure you are.‚Äù The driver says: ‚ÄúAlright, I‚Äôm on my way.‚Äù They get here and I give them the cash in EXCHANGE for my lost item, and all is well. I look at my credit card statement and see I‚Äôve also been charged through my card. I contact Lyft‚Äôs SLIM support avenues and they tell me: Sorry, we cannot refund you because your cash payment is deemed as a tip, and Lyft is based on an electronic payment system. (Essentially.) That driver SHOULD have been able to tell me that I didn‚Äôt need to pay him in cash because my card will be charged in accordance with Lyft‚Äôs policies and procedures. But they did not. I am fuming to be quite blunt. I‚Äôve never been so dissatisfied with an entity that I felt the need to write a flipping review.

Drivers have been scamming riders by causing damage to their own car AFTER the rider gets out, and then charging the rider with the damage fee. I am out $80 because of it. The only evidence the driver provided were blurry photos of a spilled beer bottle (we did not have any drinks in the car) with a time stamp long after the ride was over. I provided sufficient evidence that this driver was scamming us and had several witness statements to prove it.  Per their policy for drivers ‚Äúyou will not attempt to Lyft or riders on the Lyft platform‚Äù, but when it came to customer service, this policy was ignored. Lyft has been made aware of this scam for years yet has taken no action to correct it or to protect their riders. I contacted customer service several times, but they did not answer my questions and considered the case resolved when it was not. Their policy about ‚Äúriders agree to pay a damage fee‚Äù implies the damage fee was done by the rider. When this is not true, they do not care. They will take the side of the driver even if they know with full certainty that the rider was not at fault. No wonder there are thousands of complaints with the BBB and hundreds of media stories about this exact situation happening over and over again.

I work graveyard shifts and sometimes I need to use Uber or Lyft to get to work, the other night Oct. 19th I ordered a ride using wait and save and they gave me a driver almost immediately, usually would be a good thing so why is this a 1 star review? Well, as I was getting the ready for work the driver they gave me was 2 minutes away so I was rushed to get ready, when the driver arrived I got the be outside within 5 minutes message, I was outside within 3 minutes and my driver was no where to be found, instead she was driving the route so she could get more money rather then letting the 5 minute timer go up to be comped for her time, she never picked me up and when I go to dispute the charge Lyft won‚Äôt help, it says that the ride can‚Äôt be refunded cause nothing went wrong even though I had to wake my poor girlfriend out of a dead sleep so she can take me to work and I won‚Äôt be late cause I never got picked up. Until I get help from an actual human being that works for Lyft I will be leaving this review a 1 star and using Uber from now on

I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews but this one driver angered me to the point of needed to get it off my chest. i‚Äôm a server and totaled my car a bit ago. been using public transportation, and lyft/uber to get to and from work. decided to give lyft a shot since it was $2-3 dollars cheaper which i will gladly spend with uber after what i‚Äôve dealt with. repeatedly was asked to enter a card with the same billing address with the last. finally ran out of cards so i gave up. i bought a gift card, which on the card says is an alternative payment method. after spending $25 I STILL GET TOLD I CANT GET A RIDE AND TO PUT ANOTHER CARD ON FILE. five cards on file. venmo account on file. apple pay hooked up. $25 credit added when my ride is less than that. reached out to support and all they could tell me was to follow the prompt and i could use the app again.. üôÑ uber sent me a ride on them when i didn‚Äôt have the balance to cover it after using what i had on lyft. lyft couldn‚Äôt even bother to just cover the ride, or at least take it out of my card manually. just kissing the $25 goodbye as the moneys already loaded onto the account, and can‚Äôt be used. i‚Äôll stick with a ride that costs a little more for the comfort of knowing i won‚Äôt be stranded.

I scheduled a ride the night before. Had many vehicle issues to take care of and some appointments to be handled. Hence why I scheduled ahead. The scheduled driver never showed up. Help center never even showed driver so I couldn‚Äôt dispute the issue and charge to was put on my card from cancelling. Then the app offered to switch drivers which I selected to. I had to wait roughly 30 minutes for my next driver to show because of having to resubmit a ride request from prior issues. During that time the customer support were basic questions that didn‚Äôt address my issue or dispute and no way of contacting a person to discuss this problem that occurred. I don‚Äôt know if it was or is a glitch in the app but this reminded me why I deleted the app to being with. Too much unnecessary stress on top of being late and behind on my appointments for the busy day ahead. Customer service is supposed to be actual people that you can call for help. Not some questionnaire. Poor service for riders to handle situations.

You are at the mercy of whoever the driver may be. They can stop blocks away from you and park, trying to ride out a cancellation fee. This has happened multiple times.

I recently had a driver who was being exceptionally strange and was driving erratically. When I asked him if there was a problem and expressed that I just wanted to get home safe he made a detour from the route, stopped the car and demanded that I get out. Fearful now that this person was trying to involve the police so that they may harm me I decided to leave the car and walk home at 1:30 in the morning. The next day the driver attempted to charge me $150 due to damages to his vehicle. Strangely these damages were on the exterior of the car and also‚Ä¶ uh, not visible at all? The customer support has been the opposite of helpful, all I want from them is confirmation that they will not employ unsafe drivers, instead they gave me a $5 voucher that expires in 30 days to an app that I will absolutely never use again.

Seriously, be careful with this app

We were charged a damage fee of a moderate level that included ‚Äúfood spills and liquids‚Äù according to the website without any investigation to our ride. The driver picked us up from the airport, loaded the suitcase and reusable grocery bag himself into the trunk and took pictures of our luggage (it has our name and address on it from the airplane tags). This is an absolute violation of privacy.

Moreover, the driver could have refused an airport pickup, refused to take the ride if we had luggage. There were no before and after pictures. The driver just filed to Lyft that our ride caused damages and Lyft automatically added these charges to our card. No notice, no investigation. In my over 10 years of using Uber and Lyft (Uber also in another country), I have never seen such outrageous and fraudulent claims and charges.

My husband and I will never use Lyft from now on. We appreciate Uber‚Äôs appeal and investigation process more. This is a notice to all of you to be very careful with drivers since some might charge you for their existing damages and will also take images without your consent or posted notice in the car. Lyft doesn‚Äôt value your opinion. Also take pictures of the car before you get in so you don‚Äôt get into these situations.

Lyft seriously should think about updating their Maps on the app. In the area I live in there‚Äôs a lot of construction being done and the apartments I live in are somewhat new so whenever I schedule a Lyft I do it early enough to give a person time to get here because the drivers get lost a lot of the times. Thank you

I don‚Äôt know how Lyft is still in business. My driver (who was awful and genuinely didn‚Äôt know how to drive) got in a small accident, and then basically threatened me to not report it and i felt completely unsafe, he wouldn‚Äôt leave. I reported to lyft, they couldn‚Äôt care less and gave me a generic ‚Äúthanks for your feedback‚Äù response. Not only that, but they called me MORE THAN 24 HOURS LATER saying ‚Äúare you safe?‚Äù. Lyft, what? If this man was still next to me and I didn‚Äôt sprint away, trust me i wouldn‚Äôt be safe 24 hours later. What kind of safety check happens a whole day later.
