review: a lyft driver arrived at the gated community i reside in. when i approached his vehicle he was parked in front of the gate where residents exit. i watched a resident reverse their vehicle and exit from another gate because they couldn't get out. when i got inside the driver's car he said he couldn't drive me because i did not have a mask on hand. he was extremely rude about it with his tone. so i canceled the ride and said, you're blocking the gate and residents can't get out. he started bickering and i told him off and called him a moron. i was running late for work. this driver then proceeded to get out of his vehicle and started charging at me aggressively! i started to run away and was in fear of my life. i yelled, get away from me!  i made it back into the community and never looked back. this experience has really hindered my view on lyft. however, i'm a bit reluctant to use lyft again. in 2012, i was severely attacked in orange county, fl by gang initiation violence. what i endured with lyft triggered ptsd. i will not be using their services anymore. it's been nothing but problems. previous drivers have picked me up in vehicles that displayed maintenance required and another had the oil light on. i'm done with lyft. unacceptable.
title: No longer will be using Lyftunsafe

review:
stupidly, instead of taking the lax-flyaway bus from lax, i tried six times to get a lyft, after taking the shuttle to the pickup area.  the app repeatedly told me i'd be notified of the driver info when i would be standing in the correct location. but i was in the laxit area already, as lyft's own map showed me.  i tried walking to different areas of the lot to no avail.  and then, there is no way to register such a complaint or question via the app.  only to complain about drivers.  i couldn't get a driver.  you are the enemy now, big tech, pitting customers against freelancers (tell that to the people working such long hours), all the while staying unscathed while you put us aginsky each other.  

ride-sharing apps are at this point the straight-up enemy not only of public transportation, which has to be the standard if we are to survive as a species, but also, now that you aren't even allowed to share rides with other riders, of the quality of life in cities which now have thousands upon thousands of cars driving in circles 24h a day waiting to get hired. whatever this is, it isn't ride-sharing.
title: Crap at LAX and general thoughts

review:
when you think of getting a ride you never know or think of the other part. as you rate the driver the driver rates the customer. customers get reviews but i asked and they said it only matters if you get to many bad reviews. then you are blocked or unable to use the service. 
most of my issues are gps related as it goes to my trips. the some drivers are willing to take a request. some don't speak english at all or not enough to help. if this is how i am reviewed cause the gps took me a longer way. or i get annoyed cause we are heading a way that is slower cause of stops. yes i get annoyed with lyft. 
the common issue is waiting. i booked priority trips a few times and i waited longer. a five minute wait turns twenty minutes. i was late cause of a driver who parked for 10 minutes approximately before rejecting my order. when i tried to complain it turned out my trip and fee with tip was the same as ordering a priority run. 
i closed my account cause of the toxic environment that seems to be at lyft. i hope if you use this app beware you are being judge just as you judge the driver. i hope this helps.
title: Toxic Environment

review: i had booked a lyft ride in advance for my friends and i. i specifically noted that we may need a seat for five people if possible, but if that couldn't be adjusted, four seats would be fine. the lyft driver, said that he would keep in contact to see if he could do five. as our time to leave gets closer, i finally get a call saying that he can't do five, so i kindly told him no worries, four would be just fine as our friend would just book a ride for himself. the lyft driver then proceeded to say to just cancel the whole ride. i had no choice but to cancel the ride and pay for a cancellation fee that stated for the inconvenience of the driver's time. not to mention, my friends and i were about 45 minutes late to our concert, that we've planned for months. not to mention, i emailed lyft support and they responded with that i choose to cancel and the lyft driver was already at my location, which in fact he wasn't. i can ensure he wasn't anywhere near, because we were waiting outside for our next ride. i wrote back, and haven't gotten a response in almost a month. all i asked was a refund of the cancellation fee because, i had no choice. i'm truly, disappointed in lyft.
title: Poor service

review: be very careful when using lyft! when i booked a ride i chose a ride that was a little over $23. why was i charged $46 and some change! they charged me for a lyft lux and the vehicle wasn't luxury at all ( if you're going to charge me for a luxury vehicle let it fit the description! my trip suppose to been a 11 mile trip, why they said it was a 15 miles trip and that i was charged correctly when i question them about it. did i mention the driver also went around the world when he could had been got off the freeway. so when i reached out to customer service via chat, i not only sent a message with my concerns but i also sent screenshots of how my trip was suppose to be 11 miles and not 15 miles and that i was overcharged. the customer service rep said  please give me a moment to look over your concern after 10mins went past she never got back online. so i sent another message and said  hello? i was then hit with  i am working with other customers right now and i will be right back with you i sent her another message and said  wow and deleted my lyft app and will remain with uber from now on. lyft is a joke! i'll be disputing this charge with my bank.
title: BEWARE!!!

review:
ok, i have been taking lyft for some time now. i have a little over 100 rides with you, have spent hundreds of dollars . however, on christmas eve i had bought a 5x7 rug, (which i duly noted to the driver), and sayed gets there sits in the car and tells me it will not fit. he never even tried, just refused my ride. he told me to call the company. that is impossible, there is no way to call lyft and speak to a person. it was 40 degrees out and he just left me there. then he had the audacity to charge me 5.00, i should have charged him . this is unacceptable. so, i had to wait for the app to do it's thing and order another ride . the driver was very nice, his car was smaller and he got the rug into his trunk. also, on 2 occasions, i have booked a ride in advance ( last night for this am) and it was not on my phone this am, so had to order another. yes i confirmed and requested. 
anyway, i always hear about promos, etc. why don't you ever reward me for all the business i give you ?? that would be nice.
happy new years 
dede see
title: Sayed, and why can you never call Lyft

review: i've been a valued customer of lyft for years. i've had a few issues but my last trip was a complete disaster. i'm a business owner/entrepreneur and i requested a ride with 2 stops. the driver was very unprofessional and on the phone and didn't drop me off at the correct first address. i always double check to make sure they will wait and drop off at the 2nd drop off, this driver agreed but as soon as i turned my back and walked away they left. i paid and didn't get dropped off at either of the 2 addresses i inputted. what was more disappointing  was the response when i reached out to support. i explained the issue and they did not even listen or care that i did not get dropped off to the correct location the trip was only $7-$10 but the principal and fact that they didn't listen and refused a refund or even credit, years after using the appand being a valuable customer (using every week almost everyday) shows how greedy and unconcerned they are with the actual customer. as long as they are making money they could care less if my issue was resolved or not
title: Thieves watch your account and trips, Uber is Much Better

review: as a blind user, accessibility is a big deal to me. this app in terms of accessible components is actually quite good. my issue is this. they encourage users to upload a photo so the driver knows who you are, i can't see them being totally blind, so i don't have such an advantage. they say verify the license plate of the car, again great if you could see it. they really need to come up with a more creative solution that helps us blind users. as a side note, users should be given a language option for their driver, spanish speakers may not be able to work well with english speakers, english speakers may not do well with a spanish speaker. this is especially true if you are blind and pointing at things does you no good. try communicating with a spanish speaker or someone who cannot hear when you are blind and they can't figure out where you are going, go ahead, try it.
title: Abled Body Perspective Causes Issues

review: first of all you constants have to wait for a ride because the driver will either cancel or just take forever and sit in one spot for about 10 minutes and they constantly over charge me they wait till the day is over to add up the rides and then constitute to charge for other rides you didn't have. when i tried to see if they customer service so i could call and complain about the extra charges i saw they did not even have one the website would send me straight back to the app. they also let anyone be a driver as long as they have a car i had one driver who couldn't find my apartment even though he has the gps on the app and when i called to help him find my apartment he was arguing to me that there is no other entrance even though i have two parts to my apartment. i would say there is a benefit to this app but there is not i only have to use it once a day just so i don't get an extra charge. stupid app not worth the it don't see myself downloading it again
title: Terrible experience

review: this app is absolutely horrible. they have no customer service that are real people. my app has had issues for months now i have never been able to book a car through the app because it refuses to take any type of credit or debit card that i input into the appwhich is super frustrating considering i had gotten a bunch of gift cards from family and friends for a lyft so that i could use it during my travels and my move here to california. so now what will happen with that money??? they won't even return an email? they don't give any cared to the people who use this app.. i have $100 sitting in the application that i'm ready to use and i can't use it because they have no customer service that i can talk to about how to troubleshoot my app. it's absolutely so frustrating to have to go through this over and over again i've asked for help and nobody has reached out even one time. i spoke to someone who basically literally said to me they cannot help me and there's absolutely nothing they can do for me. they refused to give me the help that i need. if i were you i would just use uber.
title: Horrible!!! I want my money back!

review: i am not a regular lyft rider and have always had great experiences in the past.  however, my most recent experience with the lyft app at denver international airport was a far less than previous experiences and makes me question even attempting to use it again.  after, a long travel day i requested a ride while in the baggage claim area to ensure there were drivers around and began to head to the platform.   a couple of minutes after arriving at the platform i got notification that a driver had accepted my request and i could close the app when they were within 3 minutes.  after about 5 minutes of not getting a notification i checked the app and the driver was gone. and the app vaguely reported looking for another driver.  after a few more minutes a second driver popped up.  but again the driver disappeared.  meanwhile, all the other riders who were originally there and some others who had arrived later me had gotten rides and departed.  finally, about 25 minutes after my initial request a 3rd driver accepted and arrived.  the ride was great but the app incentives are flawed.
title: 3 Minute buzz, is that just for the airport.

review:
don't people! to sum it all up? my cousin is out $2000, deactivated, and told oh well. i being related to her, literally signed up, added a $25 gift card to my account, and i was immediately deactivated after that money was in my account! for violating terms of services?!! i signed in and put in my money and info, and couldn't get a ride! did my problem solving first..nothim, got on with customer service told them my issues. (started with them at about 3:30pm. by 7:30, i hear back stating that their special department was going to chat with me. only to find out by email! all they said was you violated, cant reopen! and refuse to give me money back! um yall richer than me! thieves! i swear! all basically cuz i'm related to another person that basically got her money taken too! they don't deserve a star. 
psthe cousin here..i was with lyft for more than 2 years, had a 5 star rating as a rider, obviously had some issues that happened once in a great while, but were easily fixed. but i never had any other issues from drivers. the issue is 100% the cowards that hide behind computers. 
that is all
title: WorstCustomer Service and special dept' ever

review: for the most part you guys are great but when i agree to a term you should already have calculated traffic time etc. when i see an additional $20 charge in my bank account and i do not agree to that we have a problem. again i have not many problems but being overcharged i do not appreciate. today they drive a pick me up not at the address that i was at but across the street which definitively change the entire road taking me through central square, cambridge which probably added 15 minutes to the drive because of the traffic that is not my fault if the man could not follow his gps. i have taken this route several times and all the drivers have taken a different route from this man dead which is more direct to the highway. aside from all of this you do offer a good service but when you charge someone something do not change the amount the person agreed to you're only gonna end up in a pile of trouble legally.
title: Some small issue but overall good service

review: it has become a frequent thing for them to double charge or hold money for a extra ride and doesn't give a percentage of lyft credit a option to do so or anything a lot of times they take they money i need to get home from work and they say it will be back 5-7 business days but i need to get home at that moment which is why i even got the app so if i got $30 on my card and i use $15 to get to work they'll hold the other $15 for no apparent reason so i get stranded as we speak im walking home in the rain as i type this only stopping at local establishments so i can check my belongings to make sure they don't get drenched and i shouldn't have to go through this just because they want to take money and give it back when they want really hope and wish they do something about this because i liked the app at first until this kept on happening i really would hate to have to take my money else where just so i can make sure it's safe and doesn't get taken without my consent
title: Horrible customer service

review: isn't the point of this app to help people without transportation get where they need to go? regardless of the distance of the ride? my husband and i are without a car currently and he has been needing to find ways to get to work. his job is one of our main means of financial support. two drivers canceled on us because of how short the drive to his job is from our apartment. my husband works outside in the elements u really think that he's going to want to walk for an hour or two before getting and working outside all day in the elements? the second driver actually called us and called us stupid for trying to hire lyft for such a short ride. i'm sorry do you think i wanted to pay 10 dollars for a 7 min ride but i was going to and i would've tipped as well. so after he called us stupid for trying to hire him he continued to stay on our ride instead of canceling it like the previous driver did so i had to figure out how to cancel it myself. i will probably never use lyft again and i have used lyft for 4 years with out issues for similarly distanced rides.
title: Drivers cancel

review: i forgot some things in my lyft and it took 3 full days of constant bothering of the customer service support reps to get in contact with the driver i had and they kept saying the same things that weren't available to me such as, call your driver in app by doing this thins and this. i had to explain more than once that i didn't have those options and that if i followed their directions i would be brought back to the chatroom i was talking to them in. it was such an awful experience. eventually one of the reps told me they would personally take care of my situation and that's when things finally started happening. however, it felt as if the reps really didn't care and didn't want to do their jobs and it was frustrating talking in circles with these people. yes i get that it's my fault for forgetting something in the lyft and that i should keep better track of my things but at the same time i don't think i should've had to devote 72 hours of my life to recover my belongings either.
title: Awful customer service

review:
i've been using lyft for over a year & never had a reason to contacts support until a couple days ago when i was charged for a ride that i was never picked up for. i called the driver multiple times to ask him why he was driving to my destination when he hadn't even picked me up yet. turns out that he was trying to scam me out of my money. as long as they drive to your drop off destination (regardless if you were actually picked up or not) lyft will assumes they dropped you off & you'll be  charged anyway without a right to a refund or dispute. there's not customer service number to contact for less important situations like this. you can only submit a ticket if some sort & hope that they get back to you. i've been waiting almost a week to be contacted, no luck. needless to say i'm going to dispute the charge with my bank & cancel my lyft subscription because it's unacceptable that drivers aren't held accountable for their actions unless someone is terribly hurt. 
don't waste your money. give uber a try instead.
title: No Customer Service Contact Info | Steals Money!!

review: living in san francisco, i've heard so many lyft horror stories and experienced plenty myself. i currently use it almost 2x daily for work and would use an alternative if i could. customer service is virtually nonexistent. i've been masking up religiously during the pandemic but still get drivers complaining that i don't mask or am wearing my mask incorrectly which leads to lyft threatening to suspend my account (which they did do in december) and possibly delete it entirely if complaints keep coming in. no recourse for me even though i've been riding lyft over 9 years and still have a 5-star rating. just got a finger-wagging email from lyft about how i got a low rating recently along with tips on how to have a great ride all of which are things i already do. drivers will literally abuse the rating system and lyft just takes their word for it and dumps on riders. still, i very rarely give low ratings to drivers since they're mostly getting a raw deal driving for lyft. overall, just a deeply flawed and unreliable service that doesn't value its customers.
title: How does Lyft have 4.9?

review: i experienced a unsafe situation with one of their drivers the lyft driver w the wrong driver & wrong car . yet it was the only car in the pull up lane & they identified me by name & as my lyft driver . & the app also said the driver arrived ! i also get off of work 3rd shift and i'm a woman and with everything going on today society i just would think you guys would have some type of technology (like instacart)  that would be checking to make sure that is the correct driver driving . that was such a scary situation for me . luckily one of my coworkers was willing to take me home after that bc i didn't feel safe ordering another last night . & honestly it just felt so disappointing that all you guys could offer was my money for canceling that ride bc the driver didn't match or a credit . i should get my money back regardless . & i would think you guys would want to accommodate me for something like that . i use lyft everyday& serval times a day  bc i just got in a car accident . but all in all i'm very disappointed with this service  .
title: Not safe & doesn't accommodate customers

review: i never write bad reviews, but lyft in boston is the equivalent of walking. has me requesting a ride for 20 minutes until it cancels because there are no drivers. i paid $20 for lyft plus but it's useless because there are never any drivers. if lyft paid their drivers more than a fraction of the cost of the ride then this wouldn't be an issue. do better. they also increase pricing due to demand and say it goes to drivers, but asking drivers what they make off of a $20 ride can be as low as $5. during the recent new york subway shooting they raised prices to where a 10 minute ride would have been $100+. they try and backtrack but it's useless, literal price gouging off of people in danger is not okay. they say drivers can make $25+ an hour but every driver i've met makes barely minimum wage. this company is a disgrace to their workers and needs to do better. they are slightly better than competition and generally ok customer service, hence the extra star, but still, avoid if you can
title: horrendous

review:
don't you just love it that you scheduled the ride for over 24 hours. then you're happy that there's someone to pick you up a little earlier than the time or on time. but then you check the app and they're finding you another driver who is 30 minutes away. i mean we get penalized for canceling a ride. how is it that we don't get some credit for getting canceled on? just like right now i have gotten cancelled by 3 drivers already and after waiting for more a bit for them to pick us up. the point of me scheduling this ride is so me and my mom can get to church on time. but at this point i don't think we'll get there when the mass is over. thank you drivers!

riders seriously should get some sort of compensation for having to wait especially if it's more than 10 minutes. i get it that you don't want to get the trip because it's not much for since the trump to pick up is longer than trip itself but don't make the person wait you finish your ride to just cancel on them and having to wait for another driver.
title: Drivers

review: no ill will to any of the drivers or the employees, but the app just doesn't do what it says it's going to do. all i want is to request a ride when it says there are rides available, and then have that ride be booked and arrive. i've been in massive cities, when it says it has loads of drivers available, and it will just spin and spin saying it's trying to connect me to a driver and to just wait six more minutes and we'll find you someone and you're next in the queue only to have it endlessly connecting without result or eventually cancel my request altogether. and this has happened at every level of ride from lyft regular all the way up to lux/black. if there aren't drivers, don't promise drivers. especially after literal hours of waiting. pretty simple.
title: Genuinely Bad at Their Job

review: this is not the first time that this happens to me withlyft, but yes the first time i decide to post a review because i see it is a ongoing behavior from the company. i am legally blind but not stupid. my ride was originally $13 by the time my ride ended it was $23 almost, a little over 75% over the price they offer so i will take the ride,i am assuming they're poor excuse is that the poor gps system kept on taking the driver through the wrong street, remind you i am legally blind and i knew my way around better than the gps. i don't think it was the drivers fault but the company the ones to waste customers money in time so they can make an extra buck,i understand the prices are not set in stone but to increase 75%, that means the person that is in charge of guesstimating the cost of the rights is very stupid and definitely didn't pass math well in school. to top it off there is no customer service where we can complain about this so we're stuck as customers. how many of you out there agree with me
title: Business under false promises

review:
the lyft drivers are really great people! i havn't had any problems w/any of the drivers. even if i've made mistakes they've helped me correct them and just been extra super ultra nice/friendly/helpful! it's so refreshing given what passes for customer service these days. 
  nowon the other handi've definitely had problems with the company. i think they'd like to think of themselves as a customer service company, but as an example, i had a confirmed ride. they suggested i add a stop for only 83 more! so i did. & when i got back to the comfort & privacy of my own home the cost of that ride had doubled!!! no warning from them. such poor customer service! has left me sad & angry. i was in a store picking up 1 single item that was waiting @ the register for me should i have left? when was the deadline i was not told now i am angry!
title: Drivers are 5*; BUT the co is 2-3 star!

review:
i didn't know where else to write this because it is actually incredibly difficult to find a way to give feedback on the actually app.  (pressing other for the reason to cancel didn't give me an option to write why.)

i usually have no issues and using lyft is so helpful however this morning i scheduled a ride for 7 am with and estimated driver arrival time of 7 am to 7:10 and instead, i got a notification at 6:45 am that my driver would be here in 1 minute. i was nowhere near ready since this ride time was 15 mins earlier than the window i was given so i had to cancel on the poor driver.

i scheduled the ride for a reason and expected to be picked up in that window. so i am disappointed that i had to cancel on a driver. i do appreciate however that i wasn't charged. please fix the plan ahead feature.
title: Scheduled ride issue

review: scott had the discretion to choose not to or to service my dog alone as a passenger it only took a little bit of convincing after he met her she's a great dog i would hope people wouldn't put bad dogs or dangerous dogs are the stranger but people are lame. off of a very small ride i tipped him well and i'm leaving multiple reviews especially after the first driver speeding away almost hitting my dog and breaking my work phone! and then she screamed i'm calling the police and i was thinking ok that's funny and irrational. luckily we met scott and he knows how it works around here! besides, i don't like people who don't like dogs! the first driver perhaps has been mauled by multiple dogs? i hope not but as she could see my dog is old and friendly thank you scott for noticing
title: Common sense guy Who wants his money and likes dogs

review: i called/ordered a lyft that said the driver was 21 minutes out. i figured i had time for a quick shower rinse, i asked my alexa to play some music. not half way into kendrick lamar's money trees comes a ding that my lyft is only 6 minutes away. i do the mad das,  jewel dry down and skivvy. 1 minute later into the chonies being installed i get another ding that if i don't make it soon the driver is leaving(i have apple watch i stay up to date-i know my heart rate if you're so inclined.) this is where my gripe really is. drivers can show up after incorrect information on the app. then after ten seconds they can ping you and say they are leaving if you don't get out fast enough. bruh your employer said 21 mins. 3 mins later you should up and wanna charge me for being late. you already charge me a cali service fee plus a medical fee plus a tax fee. covid's over. you wanna work drive your car with passengers in it.
title: Time frames.

review: i am currently caring for my disabled uncle who is battling stage 4 cancer which has spread throughout his body and am frequently needing to use local cab services in order to ensure he gets to all of his medical appointments. i am also receiving treatment for stage 3 breast cancer so juggling appointments and transportation can be quite a headache. today was my first time using lyft but after several rude conversations with unwilling and nasty cab companies here in my hometown, i decided to download lyft! why did i wait so long?! i couldn't be happier with not only the prices but also the quick response and the friendliness of the driver! he went above and beyond to help us! i will most definitely be using lyft in the future and will be recommending it to my friends and family! thanks lyft!
title: Amazing prices & great customer experience

review: i've been using the lyft app for about 1 1/2 months in the atlanta metro area. i'm a senior citizen who no longer chooses to drive myself in an area of congested traffic, deal with increasing insurance rates and costs of car maintenance. yes, the fares are expensive but i've learned to use lyft between 10am and 3pm when it's cheaper. most of the drivers have been  polite and friendly. last week my one driver had an issue with putting my pickup info into his gps; not sure why or what happened. he claimed he's driven for lyft for 4 yrs , yet he never got the gps to work and kept grumbling about getting home. i tried to find a customer service phone number to actually speak to someone to report this but when called options are lousy. one can only use the help option by typing a message but no one ever got in touch with me. not a good safety option. why no working phone number?
title: No customer service to call

review: i had thought lyft was the better option after all of the uber scandals but they're just as bad when filing a complaint against a driver! we've used lyft before and have been charged at most $20 for a ride (depending on the distance), but one night one of the drivers charged us $40 (okay whatever, that's high for a short distance but fine) and then accused us for severe damage to his vehicle adding another $80 charge! we freaked out because we had no idea what he was talking about. we saw the photos he posted of the severe damage and it was some spilt soda in his cup holder. my husband had offered to grabs some paper towels for him but he declined and said it was no problem. so to see the next day he claimed it was severe damage was insane and a scam. we reached out to lyft to fight the $80 charge because it was outrageous and lyft told us the driver was allowed to charge us whatever he felt. so be very careful when you use lyft! drivers can scam you and add unnecessary charges and lyft will not verify if it's legitimate or not!
title: Be careful!

review:
i use to have problems with people in general. i seemed to get every snarky driver, salesperson, doctor's assistant, etc., and even in my own family!!
 i realised that i was getting back exactly what i put out there, in various forms but it was still all me. 
work, in general, is hard no matter what it is and usually done when the worker would rather not do it. i guess what i'm saying is that it doesn't add anything to my groceries, wendymy ride or any exchange of any type to give or show a little kindness to a person, another human being just trying to get through their day. a smile, a subtle compliment, or even blessed silence when it seems necessary.
sometimes just thank you' means so much because you'll never know what someone else is going through. if you've ever been on the receiving end you know how it can help.
so, if you don't like the treatment you get, just maybe you should step back and take inventory of your own moods. even when you do try you might still get the occasional snark', so wish them well anyway, seriously!
it's one of the very few things that's absolutely beautifully free, and well worth the price no matter how much!
go figure, simple human kindness.
title: Kindness

review:
for a while i was using lyft (majority of the time and uber on a rare occasion). now i use lyft from time to time if i need to. 

the issue i encounter with lyft (uber too sometimes) is it takes ages to find a driver if you lucky. it takes a good 15+ minutes of searching before exiting out each time. how is there no drivers in a big city? i can kinda understand during a holiday or maybe a weekend/night but not middle of the day. at that point i have to switch ride sharing apps for it to work. 

what i can see as a solution to fix this issue is to have a timer for 2 minutes or so and if no one accepts it within that time, the app will automatically accept it for the closest driver and they can't decline it without paying a $10 fee. if the driver does those $10 fee twice in a year then they will be terminated. doing this will help balance the system and make it a smoother process for both the driver and passengers.
title: Long wait times

review: i placed a ride the driver didn't pick me up and then headed to my house and then said the ride was completed . which it wasn't i was still at the same place so i placed another lyft in the mist of that i was trying to dispute the transaction lyft then said it looks like everything was completed and that they seen nothing wrong with the ride .. if there was nothing wrong i wouldnt have to place another lyft to get home i wouldnt be in the same spot i was at  i've been with lyft for about 2 years now and never had this happen but this is ridiculous my phone was dying i had no charger and i was just glad i was able to place another lyft and get home with only 3 percent on my phone it's the drivers fault for not making sure i was in the car but lyft needs to send me back my money for the ride i was never in !
title: Lyft

review: i was overcharged my last 2 rides and there's no way to dispute it or even talk to anyone. when i requested the ride yesterday, they wouldn't take my debit card on file but there was definitely money in my account so i didn't understand what the problem was. i then had to add my credit card which i didn't want to and then i request the ride to the  warriors game at the chase center and they changed drivers on me 3 times so of course i was very late to the game. i started to just drive myself but i don't drink and drive. my driver ramesh was very nice and he didn't do anything wrong but it took 4 drivers to finally get me there. both of my last 2 rides to the chase center mysteriously went up. the first time it $20 more and last night was $4 more. i am not a happy customer and i'm probably going to close my account. i'm hearing this same complaint from other people as well. you're not treating your customers well and i don't spend my money where i'm not appreciated!!!
title: Not a happy customer

review: it's seemingly always something with lyft. last night a friend ordered a ride for me, we were rerouted with a different driver twice, so when we finally did get one that didn't cancel on us, we considered ourselves lucky, even though the driver spoke limited english. and though it seemed the driver had a left foot, i got to where i was going lickity-split, but my main complaint lies with the fact that my wallet with $125 cash in it, was never returned to me, nor was our message to the driver ever acknowledged. i could see the driver at the traffic light when he was messaged about it, that's how close he was still from dropping me off. it is now the next day, and i guess i have to cancel and get all new cards because he obviously has no intention of returning my change purse/wallet. i will be fighting lyft until i'm blue in the face, i'm sure. what should've been a cheap and inexpensive ride is costing me everything i have. there should be better policies in place for when these things happen.
title: Foreign drivers

review: i used to like lyft a lot. there was more available drivers and it was just a little cheaper. then this whole mask thing started. i'm fine with wearing a mask but when you don't have a mask for me to wear and you don't even bring a mask up then give me a bad review, just tell me you can't drive me i'll understand but no. they want the money so they drive you and give you a bad review. some of them not even wearing masks themselves! then this morning i set up a lyft for work it showed up and i missed the phone call but i seen the call as it missed so i literally called back immediately and the driver canceled the ride and charged me $10 and not i'm going to be 20 minutes late for work! they didn't wait outside for at least 5 minutes like they were supposed to the called once then immediately canceled and cost me $10 and possibly my job making me late. i'm done with this app and it's disgustingly inconsiderate drivers.
title: Ridiculous

review: i was a big fan this over uber until today. been without a car and relied on lyft for a few weeks now and had no problem til now. two rides i got today and both drivers decided to take longer routes for no reason and i get charged for that, i think that's kinda absurd. the first one just missed all the exits and the second one tried to take me somewhere that was 30 mins away from where needed to go and i got charged $73 for an hour ride that should've only taken 20 mins at most. when i tried to dispute the charges you guys say there's nothing you can do since he dropped me off where i needed to go at the end, but do you think that's realistic? cause the driver didn't go where he needed to go i have to pay and he profits? and the fact there's no number i can call or anyway to talk to a representative to try and rectify this is just insane. poor business practice in my opinion.
title: No Customer Service???

review: i do not think it's fair that these drivers give low ratings for no reason at all or give low ratings when they are in the wrong. for example, i pay for door to door service. on several occasions i had to walk across the street with bags and a baby at times because they are across the street at someone else's address then when i say something about it i get a bad rating. another issue is not only do i have to cross the street all the time versus them being in front of my address they will say they are here and the driver departs in 5min but really be down the street at the light. when i say something about that it's a bad rating. it's not fair what you guys drivers to do to ppl like myself and others. the drivers need to be more professional because i've been in a car where a driver was speeding as well. i believe if there were cameras the customer would not be penalized and you can see for yourself that your drivers are very unprofessional.
title: I wish I can give ZERO STARS

review: lyft has instituted an automatic tip policy that is not legal and unfair to riders so be careful and make sure you review the final fair before it goes into the system. i recently requested a ride and neglected to review the final price of the ride before it went into their system. they had tacked on a $5 tip charge that i did not approve. when i requested a refund on that tip, they refused to refund my money. i did not request an automatic tip and feel that thus policy should be eliminated from the service. i feel that i alone should be able to determine how much of a tip that i decide to give to the driver. this policy is not legal and i plan to go to the attorney general and file a complaint if i don't get my money refunded. this policy should not be a part of this service. i am totally disgusted by this lyft and their refusal to refund my money. this has nothing to do with the driver who picked me up that day because he did nothing wrong and i would have tipped him appropriately. but it should be my decision how much to tip him, not lyft's.
title: Tipping

review: don't talk nasty to the driver, don't scream in the car, don't smoke in the car , don't bring animals out of their cage into the cars, don't eat in the car, don't do anything that would make the driver uncomfortable, don't let your kids step on the seats , put your seat belt on and be quiet. in a few words just don't disrespect the driver. because this is not your car. cause the driver is only receiving 5 or 7$$ for a 2 or 3 mile ride from a stupid customer that believe because they got charged 20 bucks that car is theirs just don't do it and shut up when you riding.. also do not tell the drivers to go faster cause you're not paying for their tickets . best thing you should do is buy your own car.
title: Tips to ride a Lyft

review: i've only used it twice and each time i couldn't put a message to the driver very easily and your app is kind of cumbersome when i'm trying to schedule a ride since i was at my last destination, i arrived early it would've been really nice to have been able to have been able to tell him to please come early, if you can, because i was waiting at the airport and i had no way to let you know what flight i was on. i can't make a comment so that he would know i was waiting or been able to give my flight number. i had that as an uber driver and a uber user and it was so nice to be able to communicate directly with my driver. even though the phone number was blocked and it was a central number through uber it still was nice to have that communication
title: Communicating with driver

review: i ordered a scheduled ride and lyft couldn't find a driver. the app prompted me to request the same ride now so i did  fortunately a driver came but then there was no way to cancel the scheduled ride once i was in an active ride! that was bad enough, but then i tried to quickly call support to prevent them from charging me for two rides and wasting other drivers' time coming for the scheduled ride but it's literally impossible to talk to a human anymore. after navigating a byzantine support menu i finally found a node in the tree that allowed me to contact them via messageand that menu just says check back soon. it's the type of customer experience that makes your blood boil and should make everyone in lyft leadership feel deeply ashamed. if lyft charges me for the scheduled ride, despite it being completely preventable with even a modicum of thoughtful design or support investment, i will delete my account. really sad given how much i used to prefer them to uber.
title: How the mighty have fallen

review: i asked for a refund because i wasn't able to cancel a ride on my end so i asked the driver to. the driver chose to ignore all my messages and i could see that they were reading them. they got to the pickup spot and said they'd cancel it, but didn't. i was charged for the ride! it took me hours to figure out how to speak to someone about my issue and i still wasn't able to talk to anyone. i had to email them. they refused to give me a refund and gave me a freaking $5 credit. i told them i didn't want that because i wouldn't be using their crappy app anymore after this. i never have these issues with uber and they have way better customer service. the guy soon stopped responding to my emails, which is highly unprofessional. the issue was never resolved. you guys threw $5 at me only after i sent more emails. nothing was done at all before or after the credit was issued. i just want a full refund because who pays for a service they didn't receive?!!
title: WHERES MY REFUND

review:
missed an important event after scheduling a ride a day in advance because it canceled 15 minutes before it was supposed to show up, asked me to put in the "correct" billing information which i pentuple checked was correct while combining dozens of possible zip codes, and i was never able to figure out how to get it to accept my card. never had an issue on any service before with a "correct" billing address and i've always used the same one i used on lyft with no issues.

also was not able to change from my verified phone number to a different one because of some anomalous "uh oh!" error that required me to go to customer support, which was buggy to access in the app and i never found a solution on there outside of just calling their support team, which i didn't do. overall absolutely garbage first day user experience, though obviously this is just my experience and yours will vary. done using the service myself, though.
title: Not great experience

review: marcia, an exceptionally kind,  compassionate, great listener helped me with calming my feelings about a very dangerous situation that happened just less than an hour before she picked me up. during our ride she really paid a concerted amount of effort to let me hysterically tell her about a possibility of me loosing my life because of an incident i'd rather not get into details about because it's now a police investigation. ultimately, by the end of the ride she had so lovingly left me home safe and back to a reasonable state of mind, a calmed soul, and feelings of immense gratitude for my healing interaction with her. marcia you are an unbelievably wonderful person who i'm so grateful to have had the honor of crossing paths in a time when i really needed someone as special as you. god bless
title: Inspirational

review: i scheduled a lyft for 4am because i had a flight at 5:25. five minutes before pickup, my driver called and said that it automatically accepted the ride for him and that he would not be picking me up (five minutes before). whether it was his fault or lyft's, there is no way to contact the company about this. no way to call and talk to someone, and no help prompts on the app/website(because you can't type for help, you need to choose from their menu of help options). because of this, i had to drive to the airport, costing me $152 in parking fees (on top of gas and tollway charges), as opposed to maybe $100 in lyft rides to & from. i am livid. i have a severe heart condition and had to run through the parking garage and almost missed my flight (no breakfast or coffee before my flight across the country for a work presentation). if i could contact the company about this i wouldn't be leaving this review, but i can't. will be using uber and paying their higher prices from here on out.
title: AWFUL, CHOOSING UBER

review: app malfunction took my money! and i can't get to an actual human to speak to! left me waiting forever in the below freezing weather unable to find a driver until a relative went out of their way to get me. it wouldn't allow me to cancel until after it magically found a driver after my relative went to the trouble, and i suddenly got stuck with a $5 cancellation fee for the driver's time. i tried to dispute it, but there was no option to explain my issue (just generic multiple questions), and i was denied. i can't drive due to a disability and half my paycheck goes to getting rides, so for me that money matters. it's potentially half of another ride to work. the number i found online just told me to go to the app support. i am actually crying. this is horrendous and you should be ashamed. pay your driver for their time for your mistake because that is incredibly messed up. in the mean time after groceries i now lack my ability to get to my next shift. disgusting.
title: STOLE MY MONEY!!!

review: very frustrating because lyft won't accept my payment method. i contacted support and there wasn't any way to fix my problem my card always worked before and i never changed it. what did i do? -contacted my bank (they said there were no problems with my card) they told me to contact lyft.  -re entered my card details -submitted a screenshot to support (will not accept my apple pay either) the response of lyft is to enter another card or to contact my bank. is there really no other answer to try and fix the problem other than what i have already done? i'm not entering another card because this is my payment method i need to use. lyft don't reply to this with a pre written message telling me to do the exact same thing it will only be more frustrating. as a company it would be great to actually speak with someone because the customer service is lacking. to everyone be careful using lyft. you might get stranded somewhere.
title: Won't accept my payment method.

review: you really need to work on making sure the driver drops the ride off at the correct location. our first ride from airport (on a layover) dropped us at the wrong hotel and left us. my friend who paid for the ride will be commenting on the ride. we were 4 women with 1 wheelchair and a ton of luggage. he was friendly during the ride but i believe the problem began when we added a stop. he dropped us at the incorrect address and left us. we then ended up calling uber because the rate difference was upwards of $60. after a 30 minute wait outside of the wrong hotel we finally made it to our destination. the following morning we called lyft and had a great experience.  handicap option is definitely needed as well. as my first time traveling with someone in a wheelchair, handicapped accessible options would be heaven sent.
title: Address

review: i keep my card lock, sometime i for get to unlock the card. so i make an lyft buy, & it don't go through, the app reject my card, when i put the card in again and money is on the card why decline the card get that payment. if the card declined the second time i can see the app asking for another payment system,  before the app decline the card see can lyft get paid. the app miss out on so much money rejecting cards the first time. i would always give the card two try's now that's coming in the world backward  not seeing what's happening with the payment. with that little statement i know your loyalty base will go up. because your rider will see it as you lyft is working with us not against us.
title: Just saying

review: i have had a few strange app occurrences that were inconvenient. it placed my gps location .5 miles away and the edit locationfeature wasn't working. i didn't have time to wait for any changes to a ride so i had to run. another time i tapped on the driver to see and it canceled that perfectly fine driver right before a long awaited pickup and i had to get a new one and lose an additional 40 mins of travel time.i ended up being late to my appointment and wasn't able to get my full physical therapy that i paid $45 to get to and from. now i have learned to not touch anything once i order a ride. however i have had great rides across the board. every single driver i met was very friendly! so i support the people but not the app!
title: Satisfied overall

review: i ordered a lyft at 6:20 am, i normely like to look between uber and lyft to see witch one is closer and cheaper witch is normely lyft (cost wise) but i don't know if i would use it again. i needed to be somewhere, and because uber had no available rides i waited for a lyft. they said 10-25 min wait, okay under stable. what i got mad about is i waited longer and they paired me with 3 different drivers saying they would be here within 10 minutes. after the 3rd driver didn't show lyft cancelled my ride, and tried making me pay another $5 extra to book a ride. this was after a hour and 10 minutes of waiting for a lyft! now after waiting over a hour you want to make me pay extra and be at the end of the wait list? no! luckily uber had some cars available by then and i got there on time and for way less then what lyft was trying to charge. if i need to be somewhere i couldn't trust lyft honestly to get me there in time.
title: Lyft Can't be Trusted

review: today my lyft driver david picked me up and then my daughter from school then took us home. i walked to my apartment forgetting $67 in groceries in the trunk. obviously he forgot as well until 30 mins later when i tried to reach him. lyft support said they were assisting someone else so they would be in touch within 24 hours. if bourse david responded to a text i sent him and delivered my groceries. his demeanor and professionalism was second to none. the company should know the asset he is to them. i wish i could request him directly. abs he was a gentleman through the entire process. thanks david and continue to be the example many others need to follow. there are still good people out there and you epitomizes that!
title: David is a hero

review: i have had perfect service from lyft for 4 years. i called a rude using my currently location. i waited outside when it said my ride arrived. i looked down, it said my starting destination and ending destination were the same. i checked the address before i hit confirm. why would someone call a ride to be at the east spot they need to be dropped off at. i got charged the cancellation fee. customer service didn't even read my message before replying that their hands were tied. i asked to speak to their supervisor and was told that their supervisor has the same resources as them. i'm not sure how the address i was at got changed to my ending destination. in 4 years i've never had any issues. so not only would they not allow me to speak to a supervisor so i could figure out how my starting and ending destination became the same but they were rude and had no desire to even make an effort to use their resources.
title: Rudest customer service ever.

review:
today i arranged a ride for a disabled friend with lots of luggage and a difficult pick up around noon. 
     she got the personalized service she needed and jose graciously took on the multiple steps to complete the job. at the end i learned that jose knew he was going to be dinged by management in the basis of the total time required to complete the ride, all of which was related to the complexity of the rider's needs. 
     i looked to find a way to signal to management about the nature of the delay but only found avenues to lodge complaints. 
     i have no idea if this review will be visible to or noticed by management but it is all i can do beyond the message i left on the lyft facebook page. thank you jose.
title: A recognition of effort of Jose in Pasadena

review: lyft makes it very easy to leave negative feedback on drivers, but doesn't hold itself accountable for poor performance of its algorithms at lax, with respect to driver etas at airport pickup location. tonight, and on several earlier occasions, the app has provided a driver eta which is wildly inaccurate. tonight the driver eta when i ordered the ride was 2 minutes at 8:13pm, the eta remained at 2-3 minutes for the next quarter of an hour, until he finally arrived at 8:28.  is it possible that the app provides a false early eta that is tailored to a dawdling average customer riding a stop and go shuttle on a circuitous route, rather than an efficient speed walker? i am willing to be held to my commitment to arrive at a certain time, but lyft appears unwilling to accept a symmetrical commitment and appears to use its technology to deceive customers. please prove me wrong.
title: Manipulation or deception at LAX

review: i used to prefer lyft over uber given uber's prior leadership and reputation, particularly how they treated their drivers. however, the quality of service at lyft has dropped to an all time low. no matter how poor the experience, don't expect an apology. the attitude lately is more like hey, we got you there, right? what's the problem? recently i found myself chasing a driver down the street in winter weather while simultaneously calling him to say he picked up the wrong passenger. unfortunately this took a while to explain because the driver did not speak english. i paid for the extra time and distance it took for the driver to realize the mistake and come back to get me. lyft couldn't care less that their procedures to verify passenger identity were not followed and that the passenger lost time and money. no refund, no apology. this brings up concerns of overall passenger safety.
title: Lost me as a customer

review: i need to be picked up from work today monday and tuesday and friday from work at kohl's at 10:30pm these days i want to know if someone will be able to come to get me the address to kohl's is 7990 hardwood avenue college grove minnesota going to 6123 carmen ave invergrove heights. hello this is zenovia harper and i need to be picked up from work today monday and tuesday and friday from work at kohls at 10:30 pm these days i want to know if someone will be able to car to come and get me from work the address to kohl's is 7990 hardwood hardwood ave., college grove minnesota i am going to 6123 carmen ave. and eva grove heights minnesota and i just need to know is if anyone will be able to come and pick me up and i will be able and i really appreciate it thank you very much goodbye
title: I

review:
i was looking at my wife's app to get her signed up with a lyft pink which i was paying $20 for.
lo and behold they offered it to her for $10. and it had all the same great features that i was paying 24. so as i just paid the day before for my renewal of my lyft pink, i canceled it oh i never kind enough to give me a prorated amount back, and then i never album salad to me for $10 cheaper.
be careful, they care about making profit, on your back.
another incident happened the other day when i scheduled my wife a trip, and on that trip, she was involved in a rear end accident where the left driver had someone hit them from behind
lo and behold my godson destination after a half hour delay, she had an extra 50% more charge on her left fee as they countered the time that they were waiting an understanding information for driver and the other driver has extra time on her stuff.
title: Watch out they will price gouge you, and not even tell you.

review: i requested a ride at 238 atlantic ave, going to 360 furman street. it said my driver was at my destination, i looked out and did not see the driver. i called the driver to find out where he was, he told me he was at the td bank at 90 boreum. i never gave that address. i told the driver that i was up the street from that location, he was nasty and refused to turn around. then suddenly i got a bill for $5.39 because this driver refused to pick me up at the destination i submitted to lyft. this is not the first time this has happened to me, and i'm sure it's not going to be the last. but if these drivers are lazy and don't want to do their jobs properly, why should we be giving them tips? the second driver didn't have a problem locating me, and i submitted the same pick up address. i would like to be reimburse. this is easy tips for lazy drivers. ms. francis
title: Bad Driver

review:
prices have become too high. 
i am extremely dissatisfied with lyft not paying their drivers what is compensatory to their work/driving! 
lyft's excuse for price influx again is currently "gas surcharge", but lyft drivers are not compensated for their fuel costs nor are they provided a per diem stipend for mileage; so lyft is pocketing over 78% of what they charge customers/riders. utterly disgraceful! in conjunction, i've had lyft cancel several rides, only 1 minute before driver's scheduled arrival  w/out explanation and placing me at an inconvenience by missing prior business obligations and appointments. it's pretty inconsiderate & selfish how lyft which grosses nearly 1 billion usd, intentionally sabotages it's drivers' company -bonus goals by inducing them to ride/service deterrents which are obviously out of their way frivolously; consuming much of their time that could potentially be a utilized advantage for their financial bonus incentive completion.
title: Mrs. Stewart

review: terrible terrible terrible app. they will rob you!! no way this app has 4.9 star rating with all these 1 star reviews. this app is a scam. my girlfriend and i scheduled a lyft while in miami on vacation to go to a club. our driver was pulling up and we were walking outside the hotel. by time we got outside, no lyft driver was present and on the app it shows he picked us up and was going towards the appointed destination. we weren't sure if he picked up the wrong people or if he just drove off with no one in the car with him. we called and texted him multiple times to which he did not respond to anything and i know you clearly have your phone sitting right in front of you. we ended up still paying around $7 for a ride we did not get and lyft customer service is nonexistent. said they were open monday through friday and this happened on saturday so we waited on monday and still nothing . save yourself the time, energy, and stress if you can .
title: DO NOT USE LYFT IF YOU DO NOT HAVE TO

review: i flew from ga to michigan via missouri and didn't want to go through the car rental hassle, so i decided to lyft instead. as a baby boomer, i thought that the process would be difficult but was pleased to find that it was so easy. the app also has built in safety features so that passengers receive the make, model and license plate number of the car to expect, as well as a facial picture of the driver. i appreciated the alerts about where to wait for pickup, as well as when the driver was on the way. further, if i wanted to use uber instead at any point i could switch over to it from the lyft app.  i will definitely use lyft again when the need arises!
title: Very satisfied first time Lyft User July 2022

review: it's physically impossible to proved feedback about the app. you can't do it from the app, and trying to find a way on the website is impossible. so when you find a bug like the app continuously changes the pickup location you selected to a completely different and unrelated location, or when the app incorrectly identifies the location (i.e. the floor of a parking garage), there is no way to provide that feedback. i finally had to abandon trying to schedule a ride and switch to uber. overall, the app is great, but when there is a problem with the app unrelated to a specific ride, lyft needs to make it possible for users to provide feedback so that lyft can correct bugs and fix errors.
title: Literally impossible to proved app feedback

review:
have enjoyed lyft so far - until tonight's ride. booked from home to miami airport - straight road, did many times, especially on uber. 
asked driver why he was taking backroads route but given his inability to speak english, i understood it was for the rain or traffic. once i realized his phone lyft app had programmed miami airport aa cargo location instead of aa departures, we had been going in circles for more than half an hour. i barely made it to the airport and plane, and frankly it was not so much the driver fault but the app fault, directing him to cargo instead of passengers departures. had he spoken english, i might have been able to solve the issues earlier. what i however realized is that the app has no emergency phone contact , no email for assistance or complaints,  no customer service, only comments for certain limited issues.  and it scared me for future use. and that's a huge safety concern
title: Nightmare ride and impossible to contact customer service

review: so, i map out my ride from campus to my doctor office. i had just enough to get me there and back. so everything is all good on the way there. but on the way back my lyft driver goes to the wrong address and he is ignoring my message. so he ended up leaving me and lyft charged my card. so now i don't have enough to get back to campus. so i messaged customer support asking to get credit on my account instead of having to wait 3-5 days for a refund because i was stranded. support said no and then go on to make it seem like it's my fault i missed my lyft even after i provided screenshots of him being in the wrong location. then support leaves chat in my face and someone else pick up the chat and say give them a few minutes to assist me only to have me wait for over an hour. i was forced to walk to my dorm feeling weak because i was fasting for my doctors appointment. i would stay away from this company. they have no regards for their customers.
title: Worst services ever!

review: ebriham picked up 2 senior citizens that are 86 years old from courtyard marriott in arlington, virginia. he was a little early (4:30 am) he even offered to go up to their rooms and help them with their luggage. however they were they were down in the lobby at 4:30. he put their luggage in the back of his car and offered pleasant conversation. overall he was very personable professional and we had an excellent experience. i will always take lyft take from now on.  my family suggested i take uber but the hotel said lyft is always on time,  more dependable and more reasonably priced so i downloaded the app and everything exceeded my expectations today is july 7, 2022. jennifer
title: Excellent Experience with Lyft driver Ebriham

review: i don't use lyft entirely too often, however when i do the most i spend to/from will be around 15-20$ which is completely fine. where i live is pretty suburban and at times there will be limited availability which is understandable, but lyft drivers are still able to come through and i've never had hassle with time stamps. though, my main concern is their inaccuracies with confirmation. sometimes, when a lyft driver cancels, or maybe when i have to cancel for any reason i would receive a notification affirming that i will not be charged.. but they proceeded to charge me regardless. this has happened only once until i decided to stop using it. my mutuals have actually complained about the same occurrence and that's what takes me over to address this in the reviews.
title: Unfair fee

review:
i enjoy using lyft obviously because i don't use any other ride share services, but i'm really tired of being charged cancellation fees for services never received!  this is the third time this has happened to me in the last two years e last two times i canceled my ride as soon as i requested it, it said driver was finishing up another ride and i was charged when you could clearly see that the drivers hadn't even started moving to come get me. 

tonight i sent for a ride and stood outside on my daughter's porch a car came down and then pulled off and on my phone it was canceled so i requested another but i was charged a $7 cancellation fee when i wasn't the one who canceled and if the driver comes to my house but then decided not to take the passenger why would i get charged that's not fare or right!  and you have no way of speaking to anyone at the company at that moment to explain you just get charged.
title: Dissatisfied

review: after literally a full day of traveling internationally, i requested a driver and received a message they would be arriving outside of door 6 in 2 minutes. my family and i immediately walked outside and walked to door 6 and i did not see the driver. when i noticed the driver was at door 8 i ran, leaving my family and luggage at door 6 (where he was supposed to pick us up) to make sure he did not leave. i assured him i would go back to get my family and he told me he would circle around to pick us up. well, the boy never showed up!!! leaving us out there with no response to my calls or text messages!!! in the cold for apx 20 i decided to order another driver. super disappointed!!! i never experienced anything like this!
title: Driver abandoned us at airport after he was at the wrong door to pick us up

review:
signed up for lyft connected to my hilton account 
the other company driver with the u name sat in his seat and i was struggling to put my suitcase in his trunk. the other company also charged more for their estimate. the other driver said the car was just picked up and didn't know how clean the trunk was and it wasn't. this happened twice. 
lyft drivers have been great during my stay in philadelphia suburbs. they have an estimate snd stick to it.  drivers have been very courteous and helpful with my baggage. as a senior who travels, this was great for my needs.  also when there were 2 accidents on the way to phila airport, my driver was quick to get his gps to divert to an accident free drive. amazing.
title: Compared to one with U name.

review:
i've always loved lyft, it's always been a great alternative to uber, but i've been robbed twice now in the city of portland, oregon, and lyft customer service is never available, there's never a phone number to call, and every time i open a ticket they close it before helping me with my issue. i cannot stand the lack of accountability that lyft holds its drivers to, i cannot stand the amount of times i have been told it was my fault for losing an item rather than lyft admitting that a driver took something from me. i cannot stand the amount of drivers that think it is appropriate to harass me during my ride, because they assume i'm not driving because i may be drinking. i cannot continue having both drivers and customer service reps treat me as though i'm inebriated beyond comprehension when i am sober and clear minded. 

i wish i could include screenshots of my customer service conversation with lyft
title: Robbed by multiple drivers

review: driver took cash for payment when he knew he wasn't supposed to. then, lyft charged my paypal. if you don't leave a review within two hours after the ride (my ride was 1am and i went to bed, plus i didn't know there was a problem until later), lyft gives them a five star rating, which you can't revise. lyft would not respond to the issue, except to repeat that they don't accept cash. so, basically robots repeating policy, ignoring that their driver had, in fact, accepted cash and taken advantage of an unaware customer. not just ignoring, but complicit, because lyft knew i had been charged twice, but would not refund their take on the ride and also made it impossible for me to review the driver to warn others when he essentially robbed me. check out better business bureau ratings before using lyft. one star, mostly complaints about cheating customers out of money in various ways. not a reputable company.
title: Lyft is a scam

review: please give him the acknowledgment he deserves my driver for my lyft ride spoke with me on my way to aa my driver has been sober over 20 years i have been struggling with a lot he took the time and the caring to speak to me about my problem and my disease i don't know if i had not been paired up with that you're over what might happen today he quite possibly save my life and i i use lyft every day especially the scooters i am a retired navy combat medic and a air force flight medic thank you for your time and please let this gentleman get some sort of accolade or whatever you can do he is truly a wonderful person working for you sincerely justin p conway
title: Driver just possibly has saved my life

review: driver was very cool im mean was totally awsome and chill driving is and was one of the most polite drivers ive took with lyft as well as him being a way more then cool was willing to let me add a stop at the last minute and was willing to let me stop and get my wifey her hot chocolate without complaing or saying no due to me not haven time or forgetting to add the stop before leaving and or adding the stop. threw the app was just way cool all the way around and. people sometimes get super bitter about not adding it earlyer in all so he was just totally cool about it all the way around and would definitely recommend him to anyone whom is looking for a tttly legit driver all the way around and would totally recommend him to anyone in the future whoms looking for a legit and cool driver!!!!
title: Very very great driving

review: i've been riding with lyft since 2016 but they make it to hard to report a problem. it's never the driver fault. it's always lyft fault but there is no opt to email lyft about lyft. the last straw was when lyft kept canceling and booking a new driver that was further and further. i had to cancel and book again and they charged me $20 more. huh?? i driver was still far but i had no choice but to take the ride because lyft made me late for work smh. i reported the problem and the first 3 reps kept saying they would be back. the 4th rep said the amount was justifiable and it was unfortunate. why did it take up to 4 reps to tell me that i will not be getting the difference back. the 4th rep was also rude. that person would have been better off saying they'll be back like the rest of them.
title: Bad Problem Solver

review: so i had a medical procedure and my bf couldn't be there to pick me up after the procedure. he decided that lyft would be a convenient choice so he bought a gift  card last night and send me they the info to me. when i tap on the redeem icon, it keep saying gift card error: we can't verify your gift card at this time, try again later. i keep try and same response. i tried again this morning and still nothing. customer service told him that the card was already redeemed. like what?????  their customer service is the worse. you'd be waiting forever, no answer and they ignore you while you contact them via messaging. this company is the worse, never again gonna use their riding services. horrible scammers and terrible customer service. our money for the gift card was just stolen by their company just like that. i guess this is why they don't have over the phone customer service.
title: SCAMMERS

review: i have been using lyft for about 2years now and all i can say is. i hate it. over the past two years i have experienced some amazing drivers but the app is so broken and bogus. i will look at a rides price 30mins to an hour before my ride and it will be about $18-$22. i'll come back to schedule my ride and the prices will sky rocket to $60-$100+. i live 20 minutes away from my job. and also why in the world did the prices just all over a sudden rise that high?! i try to reload and re download the app multiple times and it still doesn't work. my drivers also tend to not find me or when trying to cancel a ride, the app will freeze or tell me it canceled then all of a sudden i receive that my driver is 2 mins away when it confirmed i cancelled. then i am getting charged for a ride that was supposed to be canceled. safe to say this is the worst app and company i have ever dealt with.  i'll stick to uber.
title: Literally the worst.

review: a couple weeks ago i needed a ride to the airport. i scheduled two days in advance with lyft. 5 minutes before my driver was supposed to pick me up he called me and told me to cancel the ride because he was too far away and he told me he would not charge me the fee. i frantically canceled the ride and scheduled a new lyft as i did not want to miss my plane. the driver never refunded my ride and i had to pay a surcharged rate for my new lyft. it was $140 for me to go to the airport that is 15 minutes away from me. i complained to lyft about this. they never gave me anytime type of refund or credit. they said because i had canceled the ride they wouldn't do anything. personally i think that i should not have been punished because the driver accepted the ride and did not plan accordingly. also lyft has no phone number you can call. the customer service was absolutely not helpful at all via email.
title: Driver cancels rider gets punished

review: i've been a loyal lyft customer for 12 years and recently i've been trying to work with customer support to resolve a technical issue in the app that's preventing me from redeeming an offer providing three free months of free lyft pink (i'm a chase cardholder who just finished a complementary one year subscription). i've spent hours talking to what feels like a robot over the in-app messaging support offered, and over the past couple of weeks each time a support agent realizes the problem they close the support window saying somebody will reach out to you by email to resolve this. three tickets and three weeks later, i've not received any outreach from said support. i am essentially stuck without service with nobody to help resolve lyft's own technical issues. a bit disappointing because i love the service itself, and will not be using it anymore until my problems are resolved.
title: Nonexistent customer support

review: this was my first use in a long time. i accidentally put the wrong address down. i didn't find out even after i checked with budget rent a car. they confirmed my address. after talking back and forth with the driver, i google searched the place and found a new address. upon admitting this and willing to correct the address, he canceled my reservation costing me two trips to the airport because i have to compensate the canceled one and the new one. heck the new one was cheaper than the scheduled one. what a scam there! they way lyft works it favors the driver not a tourist in a strange area. heck i talked to the driver on the phone. it wasn't a no show if i can tell you his number. i am glad that i don't have to use lyft anytime soon. it took me forever to request a refund and i couldn't say what happened. lyft will have to do something to change this rating. horrible for the customer, good for the driver.
title: Horrible policies

review: i have used this app for quite sometime. i am genuinely irritated by the schedule ahead feature. what is the point? several times i have scheduled a ride, and there has been no issue for years. i'm not sure what happened in the recent update but a number of drivers said they were too far away and requested that i cancel my ride?? firstly that's unprofessional. how is that possible, i have seen through the app that drivers can see rides before accepting them. if i need to be somewhere by a specific time. i cannot afford to cancel my scheduled ride?! god i hate this app. after 2 drivers requested i cancel my ride. the app cancelled it, and the new prices were triple the price of my pre-scheduled ride. oh and i missed my appointment. why offer the service if it can be cancelled without warning and without second thought? i scheduled my ride the night prior. either fix the service or don't offer it.
title: I am tired of this app

review:
i have been a 4.9+ driver for over 5 years.  lyft has recently been using misleading bonus structures/rules to influence what rides they take and times they work.  when these unclear rules are not followed, they can avoid paying out the bonuses, while the driver has already done the work for the bonus.  

other manipulations of the rules create an environment that exceeds what should be considered independent contractorship. rides will be advertised as one thing (location, length of ride) and on the way to the pickup be substituted for another ride, the details of which are kept from the driver.  would any independent contractor accept a job without knowing any details?  would they accept a job without knowing if it would take 1 day or 1 year?  

this policy is a knowing bait and switch, and no way to treat your drivers, as a company that depends on drivers.
title: Does not take care of drivers, not independent contractors
