review: i enjoy using lyft. if i had the finances i would use them more than i already do. i have depended on lyft for some very important and urgent times in my life and i can only recall one time i ever had an issue plus today. today was my son's surgery and after booking in advance drivers canceled on us this morning back to back. we were late for his surgery. my complaint is when multiple drivers can cancel on you back to back after having you wait 15-20 minutes for each of them. especially when it says they are 3 minutes away  it definitely causes me to fill a bit hesitant when booking a ride with you. aside from that
title: Honest review

review: it makes me happy that lyft drivers don't need a second job to make ends meet and they don't rip off their workers. i choose lyft because treating people with dignity is more important than getting a cheap ride. great work with the dark mode, being a developer i really appreciate the design and colors. i would recommend not being so particular and possibly reviewing the location permissions. i gave permissions to lyft for permissions, but it still told me i hadn't given sufficient permissions. possibly new changes to ios 15 sdks for the location apis -saamer mansoor. ps: how is this #2 when it has 9 million more ratings than *ber and 0.7 stars higher too!
title: Worth the extra money I pay

review: starting to have issues with lyft now since i been dealing with lyft and when i call a lyft the picture don't match the drivers when i called a lyft the pic was of a female and the person that  picked me up was a man and i'm like that's  not u in the pro file pic and then i had the same issue when a called a lyft the the driver was a man in the pro file picture and when it came and it was a lady so i'm trying to figure out why the picture not matching these lyft drivers same issue i had in 2021 the picture was a lady and a the driver was a man lyft need to do a better job at making sure them drivers match they pictures
title: Pics don't match half the Lyft drivers

review: my leg was broken so i can't walk quickly. i matched a driver around 4:00 pm march 11. the lyft driver parked the car 20 feet away from me. i am struggling to slowly walk to the car. the driver saw that and doesn't want to wait so he canceled the ride when i am still walking to the car. i feel very uncomfortable that later i received email from lyft (4:20 pm march 11) warn me to wear mask. i wear mask all the time even i am still approaching to the car on the street. apparently, this driver cancel my ride by using rider doesn't wear mask as an excuse. he is abusing the wear mask policy and push responsibility of canceling ride to riders. i report this to lyft and they don't give me any corresponded response. they gust said they will remove the violation from my account but keep ask me to wear mask. seriously, let driver did something likes physical disability discrimination and blame not true thing to riders?
title: Driver abuses mask policy to cancel a ride

review:
so i ordered a lyft to my friends house for about 8-9 dollars my friend sent me the money for it, but the lyft got canceled and a new lyft was on it's way.
the lyft shows up and it's fine but straight off the bat he goes the opposite way than the direction.
but at this point i'm 15 minutes away when my friends house is a 7 minute drive.  i brush it off because the lyft guy seemed new but the driving was so horrible i kept bumping my head on the window and the top of the car because of how hard and crazy he was swerving.
but i kept shrugging it off because it was a 7-8 dollar ride (so i thought) long story short after the ride (2 days later) lyft charges me 12 dollar after being charged 8 dollars.  which is absolutely ridiculous and i'm trying to get my money back but there's no option for this situation i'm very confused and upset.
title: Charged a additional fee 2 days after a ride

review: i use this app to commute to my jobs as a 10 minute ride usually beats a 40 minute walk and usually its only 10 dollars though due to corona and recent events with gas the prices kinda spiked a couple dollars 12-15 and thats fine those are the times i guess... but the last couple of trips i definately feel like ive been getting gouged for money with the prices going as high as 20 dollars for my usual trips i understand if the drivers are far but today for example i tried to order a lift it cost a little over 12 dollars for a person 12 minutes away, they canceled and lyft was taking too long to find a replacement as i had to be at work so i canceled the request but i rerequested another one due to me being in a crunch for time but this one came out to be 20 dollars for a person 7 minutes away. similar occurances have happened a few times though i wasnt in as much of disadvantage timewise as today so each time it happened i opted to walk. today however was important and it was nessesary for me to accept the price but i refuse to accept lyft's continued extortions so i will be deleting this app and begin walking for now on or relying on my local cab company to get me to places hopfully others will read and learn from my example and if not so be it.
title: very unfortunate

review: our reservation with payless didn't work out well due to poor customer care. avis was suppose to process our reservation, but none of the employees were willing to assist us. we got stack at the airport rental care services without a means to go to our hotel since all other rental services said sold out. decided to try uber it didn't work, leyft the first drink accepted out request but did show up for hours, didn't reply for our message or phone call. we had to cancel it after multiple attempts. our second attempt and choice was the best and all worked out great. we are great full to drive with berehanu. thank you!
title: Great customer service

review: sometimes scheduling a ride is the hardest thing to do, especially if you have somewhere to be!! i always try to schedule my rides about 20 minutes from the time i have to be at work because i know that's more than enough time to get there on time on my the days i need a lyft. the problem is whenever i schedule a ride it says there's no one around but on the map there seems to be more than enough drivers near by, and i'm left waiting for over 30 minutes for a ride that's like 20 minutes away... and this happens quite a bit which is quite frustrating really!! not only for myself, but also for the drivers who are being assigned someone who is like 25 minutes away or sometimes in the next state over...
title: Iffy

review: i had repeatedly poor service with a local taxi and heard lyft was available and avery glad i switched.  lyft is a lower cost service, very clean vehicles and non-smokers.  i say 5 stars  because i've used lyft probably 5 times and service has been outstanding consistently.  polite, prompt and very clean. honorable mention: clark was my recent and an amazing 72 year young driver and he deserves recognition for his above and beyond delivery obvious enjoyment representing our local lyft. useful local info as well as positive attitude made my poorly started day (missed my shuttle) into a good and getting better day and o time to my appointment.  lyft, thank you for your presence in sierra vista.
title: Lyft in Sierra Vista 5

review:
i'm really disappointed in lyft. and there is no way to contact lyft other than lost items, etc. 
     i have had drivers call me to ask if i'm going to manhattan (i was traveling to another location on li) the next thing, i see a notification by the driver that i had canceled the call (which i had not done). and then there were no other vehicles available in my area. 
      today, i received notifications that a driver will be there in 14 minutes 10 minutes later, i received a notification that another driver would pick me up in 11 minutes.  this has happened repeatedly. my pick up time turns into me waiting on the street for 30-40 minutes rather than 15 minutes. 
        enough lyft!  do something about this.  if you want my continued business.
title: The Drivers Cancel Shorter Rides

review: please bring back the previous ride calling ux! as a lyft power user, i've been extremely annoyed with the wait and save options, specifically the wait 20 mins option. i select it because i might have a few things to do before i expect my ride to get here. however, when it comes in 3 mins, i get into a mad scramble to make it out to my ride! this seems to happen way more than i want it to. the time estimates are rarely correct for the each option, and even when i'm in a hurry, the first option takes just as long as the other options! it almost feels like a dark ux pattern to make you select the most expensive option - even though nothing about the algorithm has changed. if it is, it's such an unethical way to make more money. lyft was perfect before this release - please bring it back!!
title: New Waiting Options are Painful etc

review: i've been using lyft for over ten months now. many times, i'll order a ride to arrive in 5 minutes(ish) - not the cheapest option of waiting a long time, but not the speedy option either. often, my driver will be just a couple of minutes out when a new driver is selected, much farther out than the previous driver. time wise, i end up waiting longer than the cheapest option, but i have to pay the amount i would pay for a short wait. it's frustrating that i have to pay a higher rate for waiting over 30 minutes for what should have been a five minute wait. i take lyfts to doctors appointments, and i always try to leave super early or else i'm late!! drivers need to be held more accountable, and i shouldn't be charged a price for a service i didn't receive.
title: Be prepared to be late

review: i order a ride to get to work within a certain time frame so that i'm not late because i have no car. i order a wait and save and it never arrives on time the wait times are never accurate the drivers have no clue where they are going it's ridiculous. last time i went on a ride the guy went down the wrong street had to turn around caught a train and i was late to work these drivers have to be some of the worst to request a ride for i have never gotten a ride on time it's either canceled and someone who is way farther away comes to pick me up and they are usually dropping someone else off. this app is horrible i have never had such a bad experience with uber like i should get some reimbursement for making me late every single time i use the app can't get a ride within a time frame then why even post a timeframe
title: Never get a ride on time
userName: Why did this happen to me

review: the lyft application has provided me with rides for fair prices. my only complaint at this point in time is that i was wrongfully charged an $80 fee. the fee was claimed by the driver, which he stated i had spilled fluid of some kind on his rear seats and door panels. the claims were false, yet i was still charged. when i asked the lyft representative how i could protect myself from false claims to prevent being charge again. the lyft representative didn't provide a solution, but only stated that the driver provided photos. but there is not a way the user can provide photos after the ride. it's a great way to protect the driver's property, but allows the driver to place blame wrongly. beware of this situation, but unfortunately i do not believe there is a way to protect yourself as a user.
title: No protection for user

review: i've been using lyft for over a year and overall it's been okay, however more recent i've been having trouble with constant changing of my driver when my lyft is already close by. today my driver was only about 5 minutes away or less and i was given a new driver that was even further away , 11 minutes to exact, then i was given one that was 9 minutes away , again i was switched for the final time and it was to a driver that was 7 minutes away . i take lyft to work and this could've made me late and i'm very heatedly upset about that. i usually have nice drivers but still that is unacceptable not to mention how early i requested my lyft to avoid this and i still didn't get one on time.
title: Constant ride changes

review:
driver decided to drive right past me and then proceeded to complete the entire ride, without me. 
during this fiasco there is literally no way to alert lyft. i couldn't even request a new ride until the fake ride was over. then when i tried to dispute the ride, the app says that the pickup and drop off were correct. yet there i was still not picked up. the app somehow can know exactly where i am, yet thinks i'm with the driver even though i'm not. how is it possible that at no point this app could figure out that my location was vastly different from the driver? 
went in circles on the app trying to resolve it. the only way to fix it was to report the driver for discrimination, which is likely. 
only then did a real person reach out to me. 
impossible to resolve it until i escalated it into a hate crime.
title: Bad app

review: to not show up. they drop my pickup request after the app has told me it will be a 7 minute wait. this happed 4 times today so a 7 minute wait became a 23 minute. one driver was 3 minutes away when they decided to drop me and pick up someone closer. maybe you should change the app and let me pay a few bucks more for a driver who will actually show up. the 5 stars is for the times they actually show up as initially promised. if you're not in a densely populated area, the service is more of a 2-star affair since you have to wait so long for a driver who actually shows up.
title: Sometimes, the drivers decide

review: as always, the ride came quickly with no hassles. the driver was friendly and very responsive. while others waited for other services to show up i was doing the two-step right on out of the cold and into the warmth of my 7 minute wait time ride. beautiful. the vehicle was clean and the driver friendly. he didn't speed and i noticed he was very aware of his surroundings while driving. a definite plus. he gave me tips about the area and local things to watch out for (good and bad) which was more than he had to do. i really appreciated that. it set the tone for what i do hope will be a wonderful time here in new orleans..
title: Superstars

review: i've been using lyft for the past 2 days while my car is being serviced. i had ordered a lyft this evening and unfortunately misplaced my phone for 10 minutes or so. when i found it, the app said the driver was there. i couldn't find him, nor was he answering his phone or messages. i ended being charged full price and i am, needless to say, not too happy about the fraudulent charge. i get a fee for missing the ride, but being charged full price for a service that didn't occur is illegal. supposedly i will receive a refund in 5-7 days.  the driver, however, tried to pretend he drove me there when my gps clearly noted i wasn't in his car. i'm not very happy about the pending charge and think that lyft needs to have customer service reps ready to talk, instead of messaging.
title: Slight glitch in the system

review: i'm currently in las vegas and constantly needing a ride on the strip. i've experienced the cab drivers and the large suvs at the airport and on the strip in nasty cars while over charging by taking longer routes. my experience with lyft has been wonderful!!!! there cars are clean the drivers are super nice and the prices are great! this is my first experience with ride sharing and i'm super happy with lyft. continue the great work you and your staff are doing. sincerely, very happy customer and by the way i never write reviews but i had to due the experience i've had with the terrible cab drivers here big difference for sure if i can help anyone in vegas dont take a cab. use lyft
title: Experience

review: i usually drive myself however when taking trains or such instead bothering family or friends at odd hours i use lyft . they will always beat ubers  price by about 50 cents or more. they get to me faster and they have never just canceled and left me stranded . that's how i actually started using lyft on my own. i've always used them but my daughter always paid so i was usually in an uber . now i my daughter sends me lyfts since they rescued me and got me to my destination on time even after uber canceled and said they send another but it couldn't get to me in time so my daughter did a lyft . we both use lyft
title: Always a great experience

review: i rate jeffery as five star..your company as a three star..and the reason for this is when i order a ride and try to put the time to be picked up it will not let me..why is that?like the other day i was charge and extra $5 because when i put the time in instead of coming at that time..the driver came in 3 minutes and i wasn't ready which cause me to re-order a driver..now today i order a driver and ya'll put in an exclusive driver.. i couldn't put in for a regular driver.. i wish y'all will stop that and allow me to put the correct time and choose the prices.. i wouldn't mind tipping every now and again..if it continues to happen with lift company.. and not the drivers fault at all..i have no choice but to stop my service with lift..
title: Lift

review: i am sooo sick of using lyft. if it weren't for the credit i get through work to use your cheap app i would never use it, heck, i'd rather take public transit, at least that's on a set and reliable schedule!! i have had so many times where my drivers were dangerous, awful, or when they'd cancel on me when they were 4mins away. best part is, i still get charged the premium price even though my next driver doesn't come to pick me up until 14+ minutes later, wth!? not to mention their dispute system gets you nowhere!!! no responses, no money back, no consideration whatsoever. dude, lyft is just a another huge corporation that has stopped caring about its consumers and clearly about its employees. the screening process seems to have dwindled in quality ever since covid happened. someone in this company has got to care about the product still, right?
title: TOO MANY CANCELLATIONS!!!

review:
i had to report a list phone that was left in a recent lyft car. i had to use the app to get in touch with the driver. this has to be done from the help menu, there's no message menu or anything for communication. it took the driver a few hours to respond but i had no idea he had tried to respond because the conversation was buried within the help section and there were no app notifications. i got a text message from an unknown number simply saying check your inbox it said nothing about it being a message from lyft so i thought it was a spam text.

this is a very poor way to communicate through an app. it took a few days before i could get the phone back from the driver. mostly because i had no idea he'd tried to reach out.
title: Lost and found process is not good

review: just received an email from lyft warning me that i was not wearing a mask or not wearing a mask properly during one of my rides. received it immediately after a ride when i was wearing an n95 mask securely from the time i entered and exited the vehicle. not sure if it was that ride the message was referring to or any of the several rides that week all of which i was property masked. i admit that about a month ago i entered a vehicle when the driver arrived so quickly that i forgot to put it on. i caught my mistake and apologized to the driver and immediately put on my mask. don't want to be reviewed as a poor customer since i value this service.
title: Health Safety Feedback

review: i used to use lyft a lot and it always worked but the past few months, this app has been a hit or miss. my app is updated everything is up to date, and yet lyft still doesn't work more than half the time for me. i got stuck in the lax airport the other day because the app wouldn't work even though my internet was fast when i googled and my other apps that rely on data or wifi worked as well. just not lyft or uber. luckily after an hour my friend was finally able to order one for me from where they were at. i don't understand why lyft is so unreliable. fix it please, it's dangerous. now i 100% can't rely on lyft or uber and will need to figure out other ways to get around when traveling, maybe resort back to taxis. anywho, yeah, this app is unreliable for no reason.
title: Very unreliable

review: first time user of lyft. i set the app up ahead of time. i got to my final destination, ordered the ride and the app said my credit card was not valid. i could not find a phone number so had to find the help and contact section. after getting someone on chat thing, i was told i had to put a second credit card in and i did but i still got the same issue. i had my daughter download the app and set up an account and she experienced the same issue. the only help i got was to put in a second credit card with the same address. i finally gave up after 2 hours and had to take a taxi which ran double the cost because neither the app or web site worked and the help people didn't. i had heard good things about this company but my experience said no.
title: No helpful support

review: i don't know what is going on with lyft anymore. use to be my number 1 transportation/mobility app. i arrive at caltrain in san francisco and have consistently had to wait 30 min for a ride each time. drivers are paired with me several times and then they cancel. some even drop me off not where i designated on the map. leaving me blocks from where i dropped a pin. this app and has become my least favorite experience. and what is with the varying price points for just getting a standard ride now. really trying to get different price points for poor options? ridiculous. score: 1/10
title: progressively failing

review: i called my lyft driver at 2:20 and i had 5 cancelation so far. also i'm still waiting for them and it's 3:15, the drivers isn't going to be here for another 16 minutes. this isn't the first time something like this has happened, but i've been lenient and thought maybe this won't happen again like i stated earlier i was wrong. the worst part is is the destination i need to be is 10 minutes away, and even if there was traffic the longest it'll take would be 15mins. i know this because i've been in the traffic before multiple times and the longest i was there was 15 min, even with accidents. the people that have came after me have already left and i'm really disappointed in this app, i usually rate drivers 5 stars but that's gonna start changing from here on out because this is ridiculous.
title: Really bad wait time and cancellation

review:
we are on the final days of repairs to our new home. last quick trip to lowe's fill up some gas and go home. that was the plan. battery died it 34we became stranded at 7 pm in a very shady neighborhood and all stores close at 8.  make a quick decision to call left to give me a ride to buy a new battery. not only did joshua show up quick, he gave me a ride to my destination -waited for me to purchase my battery -then brought me back to my truck -waited more to make sure my truck turned on.. wow.- 
 it's very rare to find this kind of kindness this is why i think it's best that people should know that kindness does exist.
title: Saved

review:
the app autocorrected my address, dropping the number and leaving only the street name. i was then dropped off miles away from my location and any time i tried to correct the dropoff out kept dropping the numbers. i told the driver who told me to get out.

i tried contacting customer service but their online help only lets you report user errors or driver errors, not app errors. after i finally got through to someone she completely ignored my issue and simply responded that i was charged the correct amount. when i reiterated my problem to her she provided me with a generic "we're always trying to improve." this was a dangerous situation created by the app and ignored by the company and the customer service was really poor in response. i guess i'm gonna have to try uber from here on out.
title: App error - incorrect dropoff and poor customer service

review: after reading some of the reviews on here; i'm thinking the lyft developers made them too. there's no way anyone 5 stars this app. the gps is designed to take your money. both the drivers and the riders. never does the app send me on a straight line to my destination. there is absolutely zero customer service for lyft. as a rider, i have been abandoned, threatened, treated like a joke, (one lady thought it was funny to pull away from me as i got closer), and the one time i was allowed to text a customer support, (it no longer exists), they basically told me to deal with it. (i was abandoned by the driver. it took me close to an hour to get back home.) but the person dealing with me offered nothing. not even a sorry. my ride wasn't comped. nothing at all was done about that. so download it all you want. you will find frustration. nothing more.
title: Worst app ever

review:
although i preferred the ride experience of lyft over others, i am removing the app because lyft can't be trusted with your credit card info and won't even investigate scams with their drivers and fraudulent credit cards.

i discovered 3 dozen unauthorized charges from a completely different state with someone using my hacked debit card.  the rides where so numerous it was an obvious scam.  contacted lyft 3 times and they tried to deflect any responsibility even though they could identify the account and user initiating the fake charges for >$1.8k

refused to let me even contact or exchange emails with any corporate security which appears to be either irresponsible denial or cover-up.    having an account and the app is just an invitation for lyft or some affiliate/associate to scam you.
title: Your credit card info not safe

review: nothing really negative to say other than the hold on funds that takes forever to get back after a cancelled ride. other than that zero complaints . this firm set out to offer a service plus give  jobs to the community and they do a great job at doing it.  i don't let an app messing up once in a blue moon deter me from the bigger focus.  that is getting me from point a to point b efficiently and safely.  they do an excellent job of it.  they should however pay for their drivers auto insurance but other than that great job great side gig and an excellent green way of providing a transportation service.
title: Standards set standards

review:
my issue isn't with anything other than the glitches that give the drivers wrong location spots. dfw airport specifically but it has happened randomly on more than one account! i used to drive for lyft so i've seen it happen on both sides as a passenger and as a driver. they should really find a feature improvement to help coordinate airport pickups and drop offs, i get that location issues can be tricky but it'd be great if they find a way to overcome that. 

at least throw a disclaimer so the passenger is aware that there may be location confusion and to confirm the gate with the driver. after a rough day of travel it's easy to be cranky and i've been treated like complete garbage over this as a driver.
title: Location issues at pick ups

review:
i have tried pre-scheduling a ride the day before i needed it on uber. one time no one showed up and i almost missed my flight. the other time they showed up late. yesterday i could not get the app to work on three different attempts. 
*****.  so i tried lyft. *******. the app was much easier to navigate than uber's app and it worked right away! i received a reassuring text message reminding me of my pre-scheduled ride prior to the scheduled time and my ride showed up exactly on time at 8:15 am, when the scheduled time was between 8:15 am and 8:25 am. 
the driver was excellent and very personable. thank you!
title: Pre-scheduling ride works perfectly!

review: early on in my use of lyft i used it nearly on the daily. never an issue. sure you have your different personality types of drivers but all were courteous if not efficient and safe drivers. in the last 3-4yrs i've used the service sporadically, going to the airport and it's cheaper to leave my car at home, car at the shop and have to get to and from work etc. never has the ride service disappointed or made me consider using the other ride share service. thank you to the lyft drivers that make this review what it is and for all that you put up with. staying with lyft.
title: 6 yrs and counting

review: i have rode 1000 times with lyft i rode today and they charged me an extra $20 because they blamed me and said i damaged their car mind u it was crumbs and the crumbs were in the car before i even sat down when i told them they blamed me and took the money from me when i didn't make any mess in the car considering i was on my phone the whole time and sniffling do to allergies and i don't eat anything in the morning they would not refund me the money they kept making excuses including apparently they don't have tools to refund me when they've refunded me before for messed up rides they did not help me so i had to go through my bank to get my money back dont ride with lyft they just steal your money and say u damaged their car when u didnt they are frauds who like stealing from people who are trying already to make ends me!!!!! dont use lyft or trust them they are rude and treat everyone like garbage just so they can steal from you
title: They steal your money

review: i have never written a review for an app before but felt i needed to share my experience for others to learn. i have been using lyft for over five years and have done hundreds of rides according my lyft profile. i have not had even a minor issue until i used the dc bike renting service this year. apparently the bike i used was stolen and i was charged $250 for its disappearance. no investigation followed and despite numerous emails explaining how i had returned the bike successfully and have a pristine history with lyft, customer support was rude through email exchanges and refused to accommodate or listen in any way. do not expect this company to act rationally or value you as a customer. i would recommend others to avoid this application completely or be extremely cautious if you absolutely must use it. highly questionable business practices.
title: Terrible Experience

review: it doesn't matter if it's a half of a mile or even a quarter the price barely changes. i was used to taking taxis and they charge you for time and mileage. if your destination is a few block away from you they'll charge an arm and a leg. if you even select something a bit closer to your pickup to knock some money offnothing changes if anything it gets more expensive. i ain't rich sospending $10 for a ride blocks away it much to me. maybe i'm just broke lol. it should just be more reasonable. i know y'all gotta pay y'all drivers and y'all selves but some of us struggling too. only positive thing is the wait time and tracking the car. if taxis were that way i'll stick to them.
title: Taking your money & Unreasonable

review:
lyft, you need to do better! tonight i was reminded why i deleted your app in the first place. if i go into the app and am quoted $38 for a ride from lax to home in 15 minutes, i should have a ride within that timeframe with that quoted price. instead i was left outside late at night for over 30 minutes continuously watching the screen say searching for driver. 

it wasn't until i canceled the ride and refreshed the request did the price surge to a whopping $61 and magically a driver was available. 

my baggage and i were outside by 10:51pm. i didn't get home until 12:42am wasting time on lyft. i would've done better with uber seeing as how they offered pickup at the terminal i exited. i only went with lyft because the price offered was better than what uber had. if i had known i'd have to have jumped through hoops and hurdles, i would've stuck with uber, especially since they would've been $4 less and i wouldn't have been sitting outside for well over an hour. 

even though i finally got home, as a single woman, it is not safe to be left out late at night waiting for transportation. my lyft experience was nothing short of frustrating and anxiety inducing. my future business will be going to uber.
title: Stranded on purpose

review: i got into seattle on a redeye flight and had forgotten the key for my car (which was parked at an offsite parking lot), so i had to call for an uber driver or a lyft driver. the lyft driver got to me faster. i was trying login to the uber app and it wouldn't let me so i was trying to change my password and uber never sent the email to change my password, (even though the app was saying it had sent). the lyft app download right away and i really appreciated that at 1:30 am when i just wanted to get home. a lyft driver came to pick me up immediately and got me home earlier than i thought i would get home.
title: Fast transportation

review: every single ride (i use lyft twice a day) starts out with a notice that a driver is on the way, often 10 to 25 minutes away, which is fine. but almost always, after 5 or 7 minutes later? the app chimes and says  we have a new driver for you. the driver will arrive in 10 minutes. 6 or 7 minutes later, i get another chime saying  we have found you a new driver. the driver will arrive in 12 minutes. yesterday, the driver was 2 minutes away, the 3 minute buzzer was going off, he was on my street, and the chime went off, we have found you a new driver. the driver will arrive in 9 minutes. it takes me an hour for a 10 minute ride. frustrating.
title: We found a new driver for you

review: rarely had this issue with uber. but lyft constantly changes drivers on you even though some are drivers are nearly there to pick you up. we had an early early flight and needed a lyft to arrive at a precise time or we'd miss it. we scheduled it 12hrs in advance and didn't receive confirmation of an assigned driver until 10 mins prior. then that driver was replaced with another driver while the map showed him en route to get us. then it switched five more times. our estimated pickup wait time ranged from 2 minutes to 18 minutes, changing every time our driver changed. this was horribly stressful and unnecessary. made no sense. i'll likely never use it again. finally, a driver arrived on time and we made our flight but the drama prior was not worth it.
title: Stressful- Constantly Switching Drivers

review: i appreciate that i can get rides from this app, but i have experienced issues with picking the time that i need the ride to arrive. there have been instances in which i've selected for a car to arrive in 15 minutes, for example, and initially been told that my driver will come within that window, only for it to be switched to a different driver who will take longer to arrive. today my driver was switched three times. so i was told i had four different drivers, all expected to arrive at different times. it was ridiculously confusing as i never knew for sure who my driver was or when they would arrive until they actually did. since they arrived later than the time that i paid for, i ended up getting to work late.
title: Please fix this

review: do they think that we don't talk to our passengers about what they pay for rides? on numerous occasions riders have told me they're paying $60 for their ride that i'm being paid $17 to execute they're always trying to rob the driver we put so much on the line we risk our lives destroy our vehicles and work long hours to make ends meet. you guys can't even be bothered to make sure we have adequate support. you're taking high percentages of our earnings and you don't even have the decency to provide american support just offshore indian call centers and automated text robots with no resolution. if i didn't need this to survive i wouldn't use it ever lyft is not a good company the ceo should be ashamed. there are so many simple solutions to driver problems that are not being met. they do not see us as human beings they do not care.
title: Lyft is disgusting

review:
as convenient as lyft is and how great so many of my drivers have been, i am fed up with their absolutely shameful lack of accountability for drivers that have repeatedly screwed me over.

most recently, a driver refused to pick me up at the airport after i had been waiting for 15 minutes for him (i had to hunt his car down because he refused to answer in the chat), and forced me to cancel the request myself because pricing had surged since i booked the ride. and then lyft had the audacity to charge me a canceled ride fee. 

when i attempted to report this shady driver to lyft, their automated system just said sorry and gave me a $5 credit for my next ride (no plans to ever use this app again, so fat lot of good that does me), but did *nothing* to allow me to report the incident. this is the third time in the last two months that a similar issue has happened with different drivers and i'm done being jerked around by a faceless company that's supposed to be the good guy rideshare app.

i don't care how convenient it is, i'm done with this crap. we are not customers with lives and priorities that depend on their services - we are a commodity, and i refuse to give them any more of my money.
title: Unaccountable and unacceptable

review: i've used lyft since the early days, always preferring it to uber. i've had no issue with the app or understanding the charge structure. however, today i selected a standard ride and was immediately given an offer to upgrade to lux at no extra charge if i agreed to wait an extra minute. i agreed and got move to the lux ride. when i checked my receipt, i'd been charged the full lux rate! $25 more than my ride was supposed to cost! even more frustrating, the support options are all automated, just tell me there's nothing to do because my ride went fine, and offering no way to speak to someone to explain what happened. so, bait and switch pricing, then no customer support to speak of when an issue is raised.  terrible, terrible work from lyft and enough to send me over to uber now.
title: Misleading promos and no customer support

review: i order a ride and the rider told me to cancel and i would not be charged, i was charge a cancellation fee. the rider that came behind after i was charged cancel my ride. after i reorder my ride the same driver that cancel picked me up. after he helped take my things out i asked him was the truck empty and i think he could not understand english he looked at me like something was wrong with me instead of answering he told me i can come looki shook my head and close my door. they put $21 and some change on hold and i have not received my moneyi tried to dispute the $4.50 multiple times. i can not find where to dispute the money they put on hold. this is the first driver i had this kind of issue with. i have not ever had problems with them keeping their word.
title: Thief

review:
drivers are great when you actually get one. but it seems the algorithms optimize for revenue-paying miles, not passenger wait times. this means of you are starting from or going to an out-of-the way location, you may get assigned a driver who then gets reassigned in their way to you because there is a closer pickup. today even though i booked 2 days ago, i had 5 different drivers assigned, before one finally stuck and picked me up an hour and a half after my booked time. uber would not even let me book this ride in advance, which turned out to be more honest.  
bottom line: in town it's great; off-the-beaten path, get an old-school car service instead.
title: Imperfect but good alternative to uber

review: i have a really annoying problem where the lyft gps constantly takes my drivers down routes that either have locked entrances or aren't feasible. i try to communicate with the driver as soon as i can when i see the route the app is going to tell them but many times they don't see my messages or accept my calls, and then end up wasting more time because they're lost or canceling my ride altogether. this could be fixed if i was allowed to choose the route that a driver was coming on instead of just changing my pick up location. it's just really frustrating when i'm trying to go to work and i have to try and explain where to go and the app or the driver isn't cooperating.
title: Allow Riders to Choose The Route

review: i've normally had very good experiences with lyft, but my driver in portland, maine was horrible. after putting my luggage in the car and getting in, he told me that he couldn't take me to my destination for the price lyft quoted, that it was too far. after an overnight flight and being awake for 24 hours, i was too tired to start again so i asked him how much extra it would take, he just kind of looked at me. i asked if an extra $20 would be enough and he said yes. at the end of the ride he took the $20 cash and i had already paid the lyft charge. to add insult to injury, i received a communication the next day from lyft saying my trip was shorter than anticipated and they refunded me a couple of dollars. i don't think lyft was aware of my driver's actions, but do not believe this type of manipulation by drivers is acceptable.
title: Driver Cheated Me

review: adds 30-50 minutes every ride for the last year. very irresponsible of you guys to leave someone 40 to 50 minutes when you say it's gonna be five or 10 and it's consistent you can look at all my previous requests for a ride and how many have been canceled how many try and charge me five dollars for when it's your fault not mine why do you always and it's only me because people next to me grant open their lifts and get a car in five minutes at the same location going to the same location so it's definitely you guys and i think it's discrimination and i think that you i'm going to turn you into the ftc and the fcc and anything else that will listen to the fact that you're discriminating against me as a woman and as a senior
title: Diversity and did discrimination,potential gender and senior abuse

review:
finding how to reserve a ride was not immediate like on the uber app. 
also it was a bit confusing how to pay. it showed the apple pay icon i thought i had to select it and no response so it takes me to add payment and shows paypal. i selected that to see if that was the issue and if it would revert back to show apple pay but it didn't. it did mot leave me the option to use my apple pay and i had to use paypal which i had not wanted to use. apparently once the icon is showing where the submit to lyft field is displayed on the ratings tab - suppose that's what makes the final collection. i wish i new that as it throws my tracking for transactions off.
title: Travel/payment select tweaks needed

review: the drivers are allowed to do whatever they please, lie about the ride, saying you were a bad customer or anything. lyft won't even communicate with you on behalf of what's going on. they take up for the drivers when they are in the wrong, suspend your account or do an overcharge. not taking into consideration that a lot of these drivers just don't get their way and write something bad about you. some people don't have cars and for lyft to not even resolve the issue, just listen to everything a driver has to say and not include the rider is preposterous. not everyone has a car to be suspended like that , taking money away from people all because your drivers are unprofessional isn't okay and the customer service is terrible.
title: Unfair treatment

review: sometimes this app makes a mistake like getting your current location completely wrong by many miles. if you don't catch their mistake within 30 seconds, which is very hard to do if you are operating with an injury that is causing you to use this app in the first place, they will charge you. at the very most they might credit that charge to a future ride, but considering they change their mind about what rides cost every few minutes anyway, that is meaningless. if you try to talk to them on a customer service chat (and good luck actually finding a chat; they bury it), they will ghost you instead of taking responsibility. i will never use them again. it's not worth the ridiculous cost or the inhuman customer service.
title: Bad for disabilities, no responsibility for errors

review:
have their been more complaints about drivers since the rates have increased? 
are more passengers trying to get free rides? 
yesterday as a driver i did 21 rides, got 9 tips, 1 new service complaint and 1 new safety complaint. i'm a safe driver. i have a beautifully clean car. i play enya. i'm also nice person. 
a couple passengers do not understand that drivers get paid about 1/3 of their rate and are paying twice as much in fuel and higher rates on other vehicle related expenses and complaint at the slightest tiniest thing they can imagine. 
this is a low paying job for me. i do it because my life is busy and i don't want to do massage therapy at this time. i have a few other options in my career life and because drivers can't even dispute safety and service flags i'm planning on leaving this app soon. 
i would consider treating your drivers better. 
if you feel unsafe; end the ride, don't make drivers drive you the whole ride just to flag them. otherwise you're lying.
title: Price increase equals more complaints?

review:
frequent work travel (app marketing) and up until recently, used lyft exclusively since, i don't agree with uber business practices and culture, however, i've had to switch recently. here is what changed:

- pickup / drop off coordinates have been consistently wrong including, when the app helps me choose airport options (airline, domestic, etc) and the driver insists on a different drop off

- app support is buried in the app and also, completely useless. on a recent ny trip, i left my airpods in the car and realized 30 seconds after exiting. to attempt to contact the driver immediately , i first had to rate the driver, and then go on a journey to find out how to contact (was a single link buried in text 5-6 pages deep). 

of course the driver did not answer my multiple msgs and calls and actually, hadn't even set up voicemail (huge red flag). app support's only contribution was to remind me that lyft was not responsible for lost items thanks

both lyft and uber require that riders give drivers 5 stars (out of 5). remember, ratings are different than reviews. it artificially skews driver scores and could pose a significant safety and reliability problem.
title: Unreliable, horrible app support, forced driver ratings

review: i live in florida and when i order a lyft to simply get to work 5 minutes away,i will wait 20-30 minutes to get a car,if i get one at all it's usually 20 minutes away,and more often then not the driver will cancel on me and i will be left waiting for the money to go back in my account,i'm scolding heat most of the time trying to get home from work,and not only have to wait to try again to attempt to order a car,but to as well wait another 20 minutes just to get my money back in my account,i use this service (when i'm actually able to) cause i would have thought a simple 5 minute car ride would be so much simpler then a scorching hot 1 hour walk,but clearly the cons outweighs the pros of affordable convince
title: Constantly taking money when service isn't provided

review:
i had a bad experience with uber last year with a driver lying that he was on his way & couldn't find me-i needed to get to the airport. i even got charged a cancellation fee 
panicking & reaching out to a friend she recommended i try lyft so i could get there. 
i have never gone back!!!
i'm welcomed, treated like precious cargo & loved on-who doesn't want that? especially getting into a stranger's car? lyft-keep up the great work your drivers & us (the passengers) appreciate the good stuff being poured into us. it's an ecosystem of a great adventure & experience with gratitude at the forefront
title: My GENIUS decision-LYFT, my one & only ride share

review:
lyft used to be a great and reliable company. now they are just money hungry. this review is for the company and not the drivers.  
a ride from my home to jfk airport has normally averaged about $75-85 one way. this has been the price for years. all of a sudden today it is $225. this is for a regular lyft ridenot the lyft black or luxe or anything like that. 
i used lyft in atlanta to go from the hotel to the venue location. my friends used uber to go from the same hotel to the same venue. we left within 5 minutes of each other. their charge for the ride was $10 and the lyft charge for the same ride was $22 (before any tip was added)again this was the regular lyft and u we rides.  
i am not sure what happened with lyft in the last few months they have gone downhill as a company. i am very disappointed in lyft.
title: Used to great.

review: this goes for lyft and uber. both are generally unreliable. on several occasions i had rides that were within 1-3 minutes and then cancelled/drivers changed and wait goes up to 20 minutes. this was while waiting outside in chilly weather. clearly drivers find a more profitable or convenient ride and cancel which should not be allowed when people are relying on them. i even got into a car that was supposed to pick up and had to get out because the driver changed. definitely makes me want to go back to rental cars while traveling. some drivers are great but the system as a whole is not good and needs better regulation
title: Ride share is a shady business

review:
lyft suspended my account for absolutely no reason. i have never been a disrespectful rider, and have a 4.9 rating. lyft never allowed any dispute or appealing process for their customers who are wrongfully suspended, and only took the driver's words for it. even if it means some drivers may have made complaints on the wrong ride/ passenger, lyft doesn't allow an appeal. so essentially, if you get wrongfully reported for something you didn't do, then too bad, lyft isn't going to value or trust their customers. 

it also said that my account was only going to be suspended for 1 day, but so far, it has been 3 days and i can't even get in touch with a customer rep. shame on you lyft for wrongfully suspending accounts and driving your customers away to uber and curb who already have a giant market share.
title: Unreasonable Suspension

review: dude i remember when it was like 10 bucks to go 10 miles away and you would basically be guaranteed a ride, and now they want 70, because they don't have drivers. like a 600% increase because of demand. that is a scam. i could easily pay a friend to take me there for way less. find some people jeez. like it is near impossible to find a ride. but honestly at this point this app has no use anymore. all the uber drivers have quit and you can't find anyone when you need a ride. you can sometimes wait 30 minutes or more while searching for a driver. sometimes hours or none at all. like with ubers there should be ubers available 24/7 and guaranteed when you need one. so yeah delete this app people, and start walking i guess
title: Find some people please and quit with the prices.

review:
a friend of mind that i know recently paid for a lyft driver to pick her up ! when she got in the car the car smelled horrible! the lyft driver wasn't even taking her to her destination she was trying to sex traffic her and take her some where else ! my friend opened that car door and ran as fast as she could we scars  and bruises ! in fear for her life ! i have some words for the people that are in control of lyft . why are you guys not taking people safety as a concern?  if the lyft driver isn't taking the rider to the destination why don't you guys try your very best to make sure the rider is okay ? we are spending to much money with lyft just to be infear for our lives ! this unacceptable! the lyft driver that tried to sex traffic my friend drivers plates is nwt9747! 

if y'all not gone take your customers safety serious i say shut down this app
title: Sex traffic

review: lyft for the past few months has started making a habit of taking my money for 3 minutes or a similar short wait rather than wait and save (which i use too, when i can wait longer) and then repeatedly saying 5 minutes away for 15+ minutes and then coming later than even that. they cannot do this and then charge the more expensive price. last week i even had the app cancel my ride completely after me waiting for 30 minutes. i would rather be told the truth and then figure out an alternate plan than be lied to and fleeced. also it's gotten ridiculously expensive. this company is not ethical in how they treat customers and probably not ethical toward drivers either.
title: Unethical piece of crap

review: it's literally pick your poison because you never know who your driver is and on top of that most of drivers are lazy they don't like taking at least $15-$25 rides that want the bread winner rides they want $30-$50 rides for short distances. don't get me wrong everyone got to make their money and i respect that but not everyone takes public transportation or has a car so this sometimes is someone's only option including myself especially when people like me use it for work and basically everywhere i go. 4 driver's canceled on me because i took a $20 ride. -.-
title: Needs better drivers everything else is good.

review: i've been a lyft customer for several years now, and i've always fluctuate between a four and five star rider rating. i was even sent a notification recently congratulating me on my five star status. lately, if the weather people are even suggesting rain or bad weather, the rates are jacked up even sometimes doubling. today i tried to book a ride at 3:55 to get to work, and for the next 30 minutes the app was telling me they were searching for a driver. then the app suggested that i try again later, which i did immediately and the price was three dollars higher, but told me that for $6.97 more they can have me a driver there within 10 minutes. this is not a very good way to keep customers and i will be using uber more often because of this
title: Opportunistic money grabbers

review: our driver extended unexpected, personal service to us. we arrived at our destination after midnight. we had not flown for 16 months. we did not know where to pick up our lyft ride. no one was available in the airport to assist. i got a text that the ride would leave in 5 minutes. he called me and directed me where to go. he said he would wait as we were on our way. he probably exceeded the 5 minutes window but he did wait until we connected. we were relieved and appreciative. personal care is increasingly rare these days.
title: Extraordinary service

review: the cars are always clean and the drivers drive safely and are always friendly. the only problem is the rating system for the users. i've always given tips and my profile number for the top tipper badge isn't accurate. my wish for the app is for them to eventually add at least 2 stops for a ride in the future or a 2 way payment option. other than that the app is worth it for me and i really appreciate not having a booking fee like uber and that the costs are usually cheaper than uber. a really great alternative with room for future improvements.
title: My Experience with Lyft.

review:
the app isn't user friendly figuring the booking process out for the time and correct day. 

your first driver cancel my ride and picked the other person up. he asked where i was going after i said my name and he said oh no way i'm going there!!  

the second driver i wrote the review for was super nice and confirmed the previous driver within minutes cancelled my ride after he accepted so tthis second driver accepted my ride request and said it's such an easy drive he was surprised the one before him refused after accepting my ride request. check your records april 17 around 8:30 pm. you'll see why i've done the message. that previous guy that refused the ride was extremely rude and had accepted an easier customer for ride distance. yes i'm upset!!
title: Review

review: i usually have an excellent experience but today a driver comes and pulls up and sees me and cancels the ride right in front of me. he never waited or anything! i had to wait like 10-20 minutes for the next car smh. customer service never helped me at all when i reported either. the driver that came eventually was amazing but that driver canceling my ride in front of me really will have me second guess me using this app because i would've been in trouble if it was an emergency!
title: I never do this but I got to let you know my experience today!

review: as much i enjoy the convinces of lyft i always think they need to have a better way in communicating with them and to actually be able to speak with someone about issues right away i stay in a back and my gate be closed i have missed so many rides because they won't take the time to come around the front i thought i would make it better by writing where to come to that did no good because the drivers claim they don't see the note that i wrote in the system saddens me because i have been a customer for about 5 years now and having to wait for your money to come back and pay again to get the right driver is very nerve racking when it happens more then once so annoying
title: Poor drivers

review: to be honest after five years with lyft decided to delete the app. if you ever have an issue you have to message their customer service and they take anywhere from 30 minutes to 90 minutes to resolve your issue. and when you do end up talking back and forth there is zero chance they'll be able to help. had to contact them a few times over the last year and today after waiting for 45 minutes and getting no help decided that it's not worth having lyft and this app because when things go wrong they're not willing to help your or offer good customer service. uber is much more better and they're willing to work things out when you have issues, especially when it comes to safety.
title: Worst Customer Service & Long Waits

review: i was falsely accused of vomiting in a lyft driver's vehicle. i was charged $150. it's a scam. he staged the whole thing. provided pictures that showed chewed up eggs that he spit out. no stomach acid, no liquid, no other foods that would be in my stomach, nothing! the vomit doesn't look real. just chewed up eggs he spit out of his mouth. the driver tried to take advantage of picking me up from a bar populated area. i wasn't drinking. i was completely sober. customer service just took the driver's side without examine the evidence. completely unfairly judged me. i have 4.9 stars. i've been using this service for over 5 years. doesn't count for anything. they didn't listen to my case at all just kept sending me a bunch of generic copy and paste responses. i asked to speak with a supervisor numerous times. my request was never met.
title: Kangaroo Court

review: it's a good app! it tells you what cars are available and how much they will cost from your address to the place you're going. the problem is that when you choose a car and it tells you it's going to be one minute away as soon as you confirm it then it's 11 minutes away or 12 minutes away obviously the part about minutes away doesn't quite work. we always wind up waiting longer for a ride and it says in the beginning; but we've tried scheduling razor head and they come pretty well on time even if it's half an hour ahead. the drivers are awesome!
title: Lyft

review: there have been multiple times in the past few months that drivers will cancel upon pickup and i depended on the driver to get to places on time and i would even request a driver an hour i'm advance from when i need to get to a place because of it and today the driver called me to say he was outside (normally i'm already outside) but today i was getting a mask and when i answered i said okay thank you i'm coming outside and i didn't even take a minute to come out and he was gone and canceled on me and when i tried to request it said wait time for pick up was 40minutes !!! lyft please don't let them go unpunished for canceling on customers this has happened to me three times now or at least if they cancel have a backup for the customer smh horrible service
title: Drivers keep canceling

review:
i orde a lyft ride from my job in pickerington thr driver michael was getting me 

and the app said the driver was their i walk out my work door less then min and he wasn't their just left me outside waiting for a long time and not contract me at all i texted him though the app and it's say i miss my ride even though he had 6 min to wait that so disrespectful an tbe wait time is bad too plus you need to fix the pick up find incass peoples who need. bit mods time getting into the car or coming out 

i bad to pay for a new driver and waited over snd hours just to get one whst a wasted of time and stress i'm ashamed fix this please
title: Angry today

review: i had a ride to my mri appointment today from cesar.  i've been really anxious about my health issues today and totally messed up inputting the destination.  first i put in my pick up point as the destination, then i put in a wrong address, then the app wouldn't let me change it again.  i knew where the place was but not the exact address and cesar patiently took my directions as the app kept telling him to turn and i kept telling him to go straight.  thank you cesar, i got to my appointment on time and less stressed because of your mellow attitude.
title: Thanks Cesar!

review: this seems systematic now that when choosing to pay more for being picked up in the next 2 minutes, when app then select a driver for you it doesn't find one within 2 minutes but find one with a longer wait time that i could have picked for cheaper, but it still charges me the overprice. customer service either doesn't care too much or does not speak english very much, or both. so i am giving up trying to explain and get the priority fees reimburse. i hope the dev can fix the problem, but on my last ride i saw that this was going to happen again, so i cancelled it installed uber app for the first time and that went fine. so you'll be fixing this for other people, i am done.
title: Overpaying for priority pickup but still ending up waiting for slow pickup

review:
i had scheduled a lyft yesterday for this morning at 3:45. looking at the app, it appeared the driver changed after 15 mins. i called the next assigned driver illek to let him know the ride is late and we were going to airport. he did everything right to try and get us there as timely as possible. by no means was this his fault for the delay. i blame lyft for not ensuring i had a ride at my home at the scheduled time. this was most disappointing considering this ride was scheduled yesterday for this morning. 

not happy with lyft and i should be refunded a portion of the cost for your delay.
title: Today's ride

review:
one of the big issues i have these days is the driver feedback for passengers. on multiple occasions i have received driver feedback that i didn't wear a mask. i am a bioethicist, nurse, and massive pro mask individual. i have literally not once since the beginning of covid not worn a mask when recommended let alone required. 

drivers are not required to provide proof of this claim in any way. the claim is usually made after i don't tip, which is rare- but on three occasions this was exactly the case. once when the driver loudly spoke on the phone the entire way home, once when the car smelled terribly of weed, and once when a driver was texting while driving. all three times i suddenly received driver feedback i was not wearing a mask.
title: Driver Feedback

review: i had order a ride for my sixteen year old to go to walmart and back home it was 8.99 she was told by the driver that she had 5 minutes in walmart the walmart on forest lane is always packed no matter what there lines are long and everything she told him well i might be longer he said time is money and your ride isn't worth the wait so you have 5 minutes and than i will cancel the ride and that is what he did and i didn't get a refund nothing and the support says well we can't do nothing about it because you have to make it under 5 minutes so the dude got 8.99 for a 4 minute ride to walmart and that's it never had this happen at all when i took rides to walmart and if you have the lyft driver cruz he is disrespectful and is unprofessional
title: Disrespectful drivers and support team

review:
the feature of scheduling a ride should be made more transparent to the end user that it is not guaranteed and that there is actually no confirmed driver until minutes leading up to your ride.

for instance, you get a confirmation that lyft has received your scheduled ride; at this point it would be helpful if there was also a warning to let the end user know that this is not guaranteed. 

here is my personal experience of what happened:
i scheduled a ride, received a confirmation from lyft shortly afterwards that my ride had been scheduled (for the next morning). about 30 minutes before my scheduled ride i got a notification from lyft saying that they would start looking for drivers. then i got a notification that my ride was confirmed by a driver and that i'd be notified when they were on their way.

they never came, and when it was past the window of when they were scheduled to come, lyft started looking for a new driver and couldn't find one. 

seems like most people would be better off just requesting a ride directly when they need it.
title: Schedule ride is a joke

review: pick a spot on their map and let the app sit there for 30min-1hr. you will see a $15 ride fluctuate all the way up to $70 and back down throughout the hour. it is completely shameful that they would actually take that money from someone simply because that person has to be to a location within a reasonable amount of time. every time i switch to uber they never change their price. they might start at $17 instead of $15. but in a pinch, lyft is not the company you want to trust. i understand they don't have enough drivers at times, however, for a company to take the money for something worth 1/8 of the price should be criminal. can you imagine asking a neighbor for a ride down to the light and back and they ask you for $40? because that's what lyft does.
title: They try to rip you off

review:
the driver was sent to the wrong pick up address for me twice in the last week- once in ny  and once in miami. both of my rides were time sensitive i couldn't wait for long. i connected to the lyft's quickly, but both times the driver tried to pick me up two blocks or so from where i actually was. both times i was at a specific address - a hotel & my house.
luckily i was able to communicate with both drivers to fix the problem, and after some back and forth, both drivers were helpful and found me. until lyft fixes their gps, next time i need to be somewhere on time  the airport, a doctor's appointment, i'll use uber.
there should be some way to report this through the app.
title: GPS problem

review: traveled to california for vacation. over the course of a week probably took close to 20 lyfts and all but a few were perfectly fine. however, the ones that went wrong were horrendous and i don't even mean the drivers. the customer service for this service is abysmal. i mean i've truly never seen anything so bad. i had ordered a lyft which their terms state had a maximum wait time of 15 minutes for a driver. i waited over 75 minutes and while sitting i contacted them to either get credit or just get a ride somehow. they simply told me there was nothing they could do and hung up on me. no cooperation no working things out.  they don't want to help you nor do i think i single rider has ever gotten credit on this godforesaken app. just awful
title: Customer service nonexistent

review: this service used to be something you could count on, now i find an average of 4 cancelled rides, as many as 7(!) before a driver actually shows up.  a given time of a 10 minute wait is usually more than an hour before they actually show up, and now unnecessary and inappropriate  fees combined with an app which takes you in circles so problems are never actually solved. a nightmare. and this from a 5 star rider. this is so disrespectful.  the app should state clearly real times so riders can plan, multiple drivers should not be able to cancel when only 2 minutes from arriving, and problems should actually be solved not ignored through algorithms and app loops. this app has become so disrespectful and a constant stress to deal with.
title: What happened to this service?

review: the worst experience i've had using lyft. my past 4 rides were all okay but this one was by far the worse experience ever. my friends and i spent more than 20+ minutes attempting to get a ride however, each driver that accepted our ride cancelled and we kept getting changed to a new driver every 4-5 minutes. a few other drivers that took our ride request ended up constantly taking on additional rides on the way to pick us up this resulting in a longer pick up time. in the end no one was able to actually pick us up and we wasted our night using lyft. it was a complete waste of our time and money for cancellation fees. lyft was unable to fulfill their promised pick up time and did not even try to rectify the situation.
title: lyft is getting worse

review: i am from joplin missouri, and had never heard of lyft until i arrived in utah. i've had to use lyft a couple of times since i arrived. each time has been an awesome experience. the drivers have been super friendly. they have been very helpful with answering any questions i may have had regarding things to do in the city.  my last driver james, picked me up at walmart. he help me load my groceries. when we arrived at the hotel, he helped me unload. but what i love the best about lyft's, is their prices. they are so much more reasonable than uber!  definitely a 5 star review
title: Awesome Ride

review: i started working for lyft a week ago, after working 5 days and made about 600$ they deactivated me for lower rate 4.5. then they took my whole earnings as deducted and i couldn't cash out even 1$ of my earnings. i talked to them for 3 days non stop, more than 50 agents and many calls and no one solved my problem or told me where did my money go. i have a disabled child and autistic child and these earnings i made for 5 days of hard working were stolen by lyft and mow i'm without any money and can't even pay the rent in 2 days because lyft stole my earnings after working for them as a slave. i advise everyone mot to work with lyft or order rides from them. i'm going to file a lawsuit against those thieves, the multi billionaire company is stealing 600$ from a father of 2 disabled kids! wow!
title: Thieves

review: i was brought to a place in utah by lyft and my driver helped us pre order a ride. however, when it was time to leave there was no lyft. no driver, no car, nothing. so, i used my daughter's phone to download the app and create another account to get another ride. well, the same thing happened. the app told us that we had a rider but when it was going to get the details of the ride we got nothing. lyft left us, stranded in the mountains with out anything. i think lyft can not be reliable and trusted. i do not recommend this app.
title: Left in the Moutains

review: it's so annoying how you get added on to rides for drivers, who are already dropping people off along the way and only for the driver to cancel your ride, after he drops off his previous ride... and then you have to wait all over again, this is something that constantly happens to me, i'll wait for maybe 11 to 20 minutes for a driver to drop someone off and is supposed to pick me up afterwards and then they cancel, and then the app has to look for a new person to take me, and when there's no drivers to be found, you have to search all over again with higher prices... uber might have ridiculous prices, but at least they don't waste your time.. i recommend using lyft when you want to wait an hour!
title: Always waiting

review:
i will order a lyft 1 - 1:30 hr before i need to get to a location that's 20-30 minutes away and i will still be late because the drivers will get within 2-5 minutes of my location and then cancel?  

can lyft make a a policy about this or something because i am sick of being late when i continuously order cars as early as possible. yes, i can schedule them, but even that's isn't consistent. 

the worst part is, we can be cancelled on 5x per ride and receive no compensation except for having to wait for hours and being late to our destination, but we cancel on one ride because it's 30 minutes away and we're charged like $10? how does this make sense?
title: Drivers Cancel Up To 5x For One Scheduled Ride

review: it was wonderful to get a ride home after drinking a few beverages with my best friend. with that said, she was taken home in an uber. i am 3 miles fine my destination. she was 21 miles. my lyft ride arrived at our pickup spot by the time she got home in her uber. maybe boise, id needs to get more acquainted with lyft? the prices are better and the company morals are betterthey reminded me to check the license plate and even checked in with me to make sure i made it to my destination safely. thank you lyft. you took an extra long time to get to me but you drove me to my destination safely and i will always appreciate that!!
title: Thank you

review: this was the first time i have ever used lyft and the first time i put in an address it worked. it showed the location i was at and the location i wanted to go to. when we tried getting back to the hotel the driver called asking where we were and he said i put the wrong address in for where i was at. how is that possible when your app had my location where i was at. i put in the address i wanted to go to and the driver said i put the wrong address in to get picked up at and he said he was going to cancel the trip and i would have to get another lyft. i did it again and the next person found us just fine. the second driver should not get paid when i had the address we were at in my location
title: Driver went to wrong location

review: i'm an old school guy that sticks with taxi's. well, after grabbing a taxi from the cruise port and having a horrible experience.i knew it was time to modernize.  took 3 lyfts since thenawesome!  no more trying to get my credit card to work in a taxi or not having the right cash for proper payment/tip.  once this old guy figured out the app i love it.  payment and tip are all taken care of, all awkwardness at the end of the ride is ancient history.  perfect timing for me, traveling a lot and tired of tipping people that deserve a punch in the mouth!
title: It's a whole new world

review: the gps and maps needs to be updated to the current date. it's difficult for both drivers and passengers when drivers are following old routes, thus delaying the ride/pickup. also, i need to be able to communicate with my driver. this also becomes difficult when the driver speaks 100% no english and needs help finding the destination. we should be able to somehow make that request prior to paring a ride, whether it's on the drivers side to enter what they are fluent in or vice versa.
title: Good, but can be better

review: i love lyft! every single time i've used lyft i have never been disappointed. i have always had friendly drivers, clean cars, good prices and an overall great experience! i've only had one issue that i can remember with the app but the entire situation resolved itself so it didn't matter much anyway. i use lyft when i'm having car issues or in between cars and lyft has always gotten me thru. i will definitely continue using lyft anytime i need to and i always recommend lyft to anyone that needs rides. thank you lyft!
title: Katherine

review:
or least driver preference when getting lyft drivers because they don't do anything when you make a complaint. how often you're checking these people's background here? there are times i get the ones who are creepy, weird or asking to many questions during the that is plain uncomfortable, men who trying to flirt and my list goes on.

i would feel more safe if i had that choice in my hands to say what kind of driver i would like to pick me up and do i feel safe enough to allow them to carry me to my destination.
title: Needs to add more safety features

review: our first time using lyft and now i know why more people are using them.  we were suppose to be picked up by our son and last minute he had to cancel. we got off the plane picked up our bags and requested a driver and he was there waiting for us within minutes.  he was friendly and extremely helpful.  my only concern was with the route the lyft navigation took us, it definitely took us a longer round about way home.  google maps could have definitely done a better job.
title: First time ride

review: i use a cane. yet, instead of your company being a blessing to me, you have fast become a hardship! for some reason, your cars aren't allowed on the same street as my pharmacy,amongst other stores. i always have to walk (meaning , limp quickly) 1-2 blocks in who knows which direction,& be there in less than 2 minutes! i don't know that i can hike for your services,much longer. please, work the problem. i've already had several no-shows because of this policy,which, i have not been reimbursed for!  there's no way to change their arrival spot to a closer place. and yet they have always brought me home,right on the very street they claim to be shunning! what's going on??
title: Serious Connection Issues

review: it's not super obvious where you should park the bike. it looks like the red zone is where you shouldn't park and the blue zone is where you can park, and i parked my bike in a blue zone where there was a public bike rack and i got a text message saying i illegally parked my bike and if i did it again i would get a $10 fine. the map needs a color coded key that indicates what each color actually means instead of leaving the customer to just guess what the red and blue zones mean and make it super obvious where you should park your bike.
title: It's unclear where you should park your bike

review: none of my payment methods are being accepted. reaching out to my credit and debit card companies, they told me it's on the merchant's end. it's not a question of address format, card info being entered incorrectly, or even using venmo. in any case, i keep receiving this message right before submitting payment for a ride that says: there was a problem with confirming your payment info/please enter another card with the same billing address. please fix this issue, i assume i'm not the only one and lyft could be losing a lot of business and gaining popular frustration because of this. no help number on the site since they said they can't sign into the customer support at this time. 1 star because the interface is kinda nice :/
title: Would be great if I could use it
