review: this lyft app is a scam, how is it that i see drivers close by and when i want a ride only people that are 10+ minutes away show up?? and when they cancel a ride i don't get any notifications i'm wondering where's my driver? next thing you know it's a whole different driver that's even further away! crazy thing is if i cancel the ride and try to get another one this lyft app makes it almost twice as expensive!!!! i had a $10 ride and next thing you know my first driver was 9 minutes away and 9 minutes passed then they cancelled. and when that driver cancelled my second driver was 20 minutes away so i cancelled, i tried to get another ride and now it's $19!! what a scam!!!! never ordering a lyft ever in my life, and i'm gonna advocate so you guys stop scamming people
title: If I could give negative stars I would

review: firstly, i would like to mention that this app is really user-friendly. it asked the basic information of mine and then got into action right after that. it took a little while to connected with the rides nearby but apart from that everything went really well. it showed me proper routes how the ride is taking place. it also accurately pointing out the pickup and drop points. i'm very impressed with this application and give it a thumbs up. i highly recommend this app to everyone who are planning to go with lyft.
title: Lyft app review

review:
we ordered a lyft yesterday to pick us up at 11 am to go to slc airport.  the driver came 20 minutes late. when she did arrive, she rolled down the passenger window and asked if we are going to the airport.  when we said yes, she snootily said she's not taking us and not going to the airport.  we were baffled and upset.  it was clear on the app where we were going.  she became insolent and rude and said it's her right.  she can do anything she wants.  we asked if she could get us another driver and she responded with, i sure don't have to do that.  my husband and i were extremely angry and upset.  she got out of her car, got in his face, and said she's reporting us.  
her name was jessica.  she drove a nissan kicks.  
unacceptable!!!
title: Rude, unacceptable driver!!

review:
i found the app not user friendly in one aspect: i couldn't communicate with the driver once i was at my destination: iah.
i set my pickup location to be the airport, but in the app i didn't have the option to let the driver know my  specific location, the terminal i was at. 
the app was telling me, after five minutes that the driver was going to leave and it was stressful to me that at 1:30am, alone, i'd have to find another ride.
thankfully william didn't leave, i really appreciate him fullfilling the agreement to bring me home. he is very nice and respectful.
and another thing, once i scheduled the ride, my departure time was changed by the airline and the app doesn't give the option to edit the reservation, not even to look it up. so, i made a second one but had no certainty that i'd have it once i got to my destination.
i found the ride cost very reasonable after i turned down uber's options. 
i am very glad i found lift.
title: Option to communicate with driver

review:
during this difficult time for everyone there's people like john, who helped like no one else during my riding history. he was very understanding companionable, went above and beyond to help me in very difficult situation in the middle of the night, when my brother without the phone tried to meet the driver. john was our # 5, who did not cancel the ride, didn't leave us, found him and brought him home.
thank you so much, john! have a safe blessed driving, appreciative customers -always
title: Exceptional personality

review: i live in an area without good public transit. the paratransit options here are often late, unreliable, and limited in the general area that is covers. lyft covers a wide range of locations and goes where some other ride sharing companies cannot. lyft offers a door-to-door, on-demand service that allows people with disabilities with busy lives, like me, to feel like they are normal people who just need to get around, just like everyone else. thank you.
title: One of the only reliable options for people with disabilities

review: after flying for hours, we arrived at pdx for our last leg home. we were discouraged that the price for an xl ride had jumped by $20 since our last trip, but we had been told to use xl when we were traveling with golf clubs. robert, in a grey mitsubishi outlander, responded and said he was 16 minutes out. we watched the app as he looped around the pick up lane a couple of times. when he finally arrived, he would not help load the clubs and luggage. with the way he had his seating arrangement, the luggage was not going to fit. if he would have laid the right, smaller seat forward, the luggage would have fit. he got mad, and yelled, if the luggage doesn't fit, i'm leaving. he then jumped in the driver seat and sped away. all the people at the airport lyft stop commented how rude he was.
title: Rude Dude! Lyft driver

review: i needed a ride to the cleveland airport at 4 am from about 30 minutes away. i tried to schedule a ride with uber only to find that they wouldn't pick up from my hotel at that time.  i had never used lyft before.  the app was easy to use and i was able to schedule my ride a few days in advance. my driver was on time and friendly.  this is only my second time using a ride service but i will definitely remember this experience for the next time i need one!
title: Lyft picked up when/where Uber wouldn't

review: i've been using lyft for almost 8 years. i have a 5 star customer rating by my drivers and i tip well. however, i finally had an awful enough experience to never use this app again. i got dropped off at the wrong location; i took a screenshot of the google map where i had selected my lyft ride and my recent ride history in the lyft app and the cs rep is still insistent that i selected the address i got dropped off at. you can see all the addresses i typed in and my drop off today was not one of them. lyft has absolutely atrocious customer service and if you get dropped off at the wrong location they will definitely tell you that you selected that location so don't even try and ask for assistance because they aren't helpful at all
title: I'm done

review: i don't think ill ever take another lyft in the miami area ever again. there is always something wrong like drivers taking off before i can get into the car or just weird smelling cars/crazy driving. the last straw was when i took a lyft with anagilda gutierrez on april 24th 2022. i left my expensive personal item in the car. i contacted her and she said she had it and blew off my polite urgency for it. she just kept blowing everything off and not take the fact that lyft will give her my money if she came by to drop it off. in essence, lyft has a bunch of thieves working for them and support doesn't care. be careful and beware of anagilda. she told me at the end of my ride that i had money and basically stole my belonging. smh
title: Terrible drivers who also steal your belongings

review:
i just had an excellent ride, but had two subsequent problems with the app. first, i wasn't prompted for a tip, and had to go looking in the app to figure out how. but when i did, the dialog box didn't display the amount for my fare, and sure enough i misremembered it and left way too small a tip.

when i tried to leave an additional tip via the link in the app, i was prompted to instead try using the lyft app  which i was already running! unsurprisingly, the subsequent attempt to add to my tip didn't work (even though a success message was displayed).

now the driver thinks i stiffed him on the tip, and i have now way to fix it. and i can't even notify lyft, because their entire help system on both app & website addresses only a limited, canned set of problem scenarios, and appears to be designed to prevent the customer from interacting with any lyft employee (really i'd settle for a chatbot if that could help me).

terrible experience! i'm switching back to uber. also a terrible company, but their software works, at least.
title: Buggy app, no way to contact company

review: i have have switched over form uber to lyft for the last 2 months due to the area that i live in... but i'm switching back. 8/10 of the drivers will cancel on me even if it's scheduled, but they way they do it is harassment. i've been called by them telling me to cancel even though they are the closest and harass me if i notify them that they are the closest. i've been stranded too many times. i also tried the pink membership and it's a scam. it will quote a deal price, but then charge you for the normal amount after the ride has been done. i hate lyft. only 1 driver has made an impression on me and whenever he sees my name he will make sure to let me know he won't cancel due to my experiences.
title: Go use Uber

review: just an overall amazing app. prices are very reasonable and accommodating. some of the best drivers. but i will say sometimes there are language barriers and so sometimes that makes things hard but they are always open to helping you and willing to go above and beyond to make sure that your ride is comfortable and enjoyable. also an amazing app for college students that are living out of state but still want to enjoy the college life. are very understanding especially when it comes to designated drivers.
title: Best app

review: i work at night. i don't drive at night. i take a lyft to and from work every night. i was charged an $80 damage fee that became unable to dispute at 11:59pm.... i'm at work so obviously i could see those messages. apparently this nelson guy either threw some water back there when i got out or has me mixed up with whoever he picked up next. i didn't have any drinks with me period. nothing was wet. yet i get a picture of a huge wet stain on the seat. i'm taking my payment info off of this app and deleting it unless i can get some actual help instead of the crap that's displayed within the app which won't let me contact or even interact with the chat box. even if it's more expensive sometimes, i. about to switch to just uber.
title: Sketchy... even to loyal customers

review: i wish i could rate zero.  customer service is nonexistent. i do not keep money in my checking account for security reasons.  sometimes i forget to transfer money for my lyft ride so apple pay is declined.  i transfer money and ask app to charge again.  decline, decline, decline, no matter how many times i retry. i have even tried uninstalling and reinstalling app. they have some kind of block once apple pay is declined. i refuse to put my actual debit card on my lyft account. major corporations get hacked all the time and i'm not going to be a victim of some gigantic corporation's poor security.  like i said, i don't even keep money in my checking account until i actually need to use it. lyft will never get my debit card.  fix this.
title: Does not work well with Apple Pay

review:
the first driver i was confirmed was sheryl, to pick me up at the lax lot.  i got the text that she arrived, but she was nowhere in the zone i was assigned to by lyft.  i got a second text that she was waiting, but still no sign of her car.  

one like it was two zones away, where no passengers at all we're waiting.  i walked all the way down (at the very end of the empty zone) and confirmed it was her license.  i waved at her, she looked me right in the eye, and then drove away without a backward glance.  

i had never been treated like this before and was pretty stunned that that was my first lyft experience.  i ran after her, and watched her exit the lot.  

lyft ultimately assigned me a second driver who i had to wait additional time for.  other waiting lyft passengers saw what i'd gone through and just shook their heads at the rudeness of sheryl.  

gerardo, the second driver, was excellent, but if it is possible to give a driver who blew me off zero stars (or less), i would very much like to do that.
title: How to complain about a driver who blows you off

review: app is extremely frustrating to try to use. i put $50 in lyft cash but i can't request a ride. i even put multiple credit cards and debit cards as payment methods, but i keep getting told that i need to add an additional card to verify my identity. lyft won't allow me to request a ride, even with $50 of lyft cash, my paypal account and multiple credit cards and debit cards as payment methods. other ride apps work fine but not lyft. i want my $50 refunded to me.
title: App Takes  my Money But won't allow me to request rides

review: i would give four stars except their follow through on a confirmed scheduled ride is terrible. i recently scheduled a car for an early morning flight. when the driver did not show up on time i canceled and had to drive to the airport; it was too late to make other arrangements. about 15 minutes later, the driver was at my gate. who dispatches someone 30 minutes late for an airport run? i was charged and the driver was dispatched unnecessarily- it hosed us both - not cool! i ended up paying for a ride and expensive airport parking for over a week - again- not cool!
title: Scheduling a car

review: i called a car for a very short drive, less than 10 minutes. the driver was very rude and aggressive to my friend and i. i rated him 3 stars and didn't tip him. he then charged me $150 for damage to his vehicle. when i disputed this, the lyft customer service people told me he was claiming that i slammed his car door which broke it. i did not slam his car door and as a 125 lb woman i don't think any single slam would cause damage to this car door. no matter how terrible his evidence was, including the fact that there was no discernible evidence of damage in his photo, the customer service people at lyft refused to refund me this money. it seems that their policy is simply to side with the driver no matter what. i am completely furious and will never use lyft again.
title: Complete incompetence

review: i was in rush to to inari medical, irvine ca for the first time. searched 'inari medical' in lyft app and it gave me an irvine address immediately and no alternatives at all. they popped up their result so quickly and it's an irvine address so i trust it and selected their suggested address without further thought. but the address is totally wrong and i have to spend another $20 and 30mins to take another ride to my destination. i asked lyft for a refund as their address is totally misleading. however, lyft admits the error but blames me for trusting their research result. they simply say it's their fault but will not do refund at all. their email customer service is most terrible too. never carefully read my complaints and answer my questions. most terrible experience!. i am totally out of lyft.
title: Never ever use lyft

review: i used to live in dc and used uber all the time but i hated how uber charges you even if the driver doesn't show up. they obviously take the pending charges off after awhile but typically it takes several business days. so if you select 2-3 ubers because they keep canceling it is several charges on your account. it can add up! once we were staying on a military installation and we got canceled 5 times! lyft does not do that. you only get charged once you get picked up! so only one charge!
title: Lyft is WAAAYYYY better than Uber

review:
when i booked my ride from sfo to my home it said to meet at the departure level gate 4 to 6. 

a few minutes later, after the driver was on his way, it told me to go to the parking lot. i texted the driver and told him i was moving to the garage but he went to the departure level first, then came to the garage. 

i would have much preferred to stay at the departure level since i had several very heavy suitcases,  but i wanted to make sure i got to where the driver was going to be. the app needs to be more concise and not give conflicting information. driver was very nice about it and came to the other location.
title: Conflicting information

review: well you got two choices for car services. go with the other one. i get a free subscription to lyft pink through my credit card. i always get the smallest, most uncomfortable cars with their standard service. i'm a tall guy - how many times can i be shoved into an aveo!? without exception, the home page gives a time estimate for the driver, then when you click it and the ride is booked, the estimated time jumps 2-3x. how can they say 7 minutes on one screen and 18 minutes on the next?! lyft doesn't confirm your driver when you book. you're just left in limbo until a driver accepts the ride. poor programming compared to the competitor.
title: Bad Cars, Poor Algorithm, Lying Time Estimates

review:
driver had flat tire within about a mile from leaving airport.   blinding rainstorm.  on major freeway vim atlanta traffic. sat on side of road trying to get help from lyft.  absolutely zero help. would do nothing.  i tried over and over to get a different lyft.  app would not allow me to.  
semis padding by at 70-75 miles per hour putting up huge mist from blinding rain.  car shaking violently.  we were inches from side of road due to guard rails.  
i begged lyft for help and all they would say is they could do nothing. 
i finally got uber driver to try and find me.  they were wonderful and the driver went around and around the area trying to find me.  i had to carry three large suitcases in the rain snout 150 feet to uber car.  
i will never ever use lyft again
title: Put me in severe danger

review:
this is only a review of the app.  there are other venues for reviewing customer service (or business philosophy.)

installed the app some time ago, but have used lyft only this week.  app has worked flawlessly for me and is very easy to maneuver through.

one niggly little suggestion: there's no notification up front that you will be given the opportunity to tip the driver after the ride when you rate the trip.  would have liked to know that, so i don't have to stock up on change.
title: Love the app

review:
for a big company, the resolutions to driver not picking me up and being charged for it was quite difficult to navigate. c'mon guys, you've been around long enough to know that these issues come up, then, a design should be present for mishaps, like, drivers picking up the wrong person. i shouldn't have to click around to many different tabs just to dispute that i've been charged for a ride i never received nonetheless, clicking around to write this review. 

also,
hello mcfly!
sf has so many events, please uc designers, consider the demographics of the night life!
title: Not so friendly user experience when it comes to glitches

review:
lyft provides excellent service as far as efficient driving is concerned. however, some drivers, especially the women, expect the customer to place and remove their own luggage. they simply pop the trunk and stay in the car. when asked to help, one even told me that i hadn't mentioned that there would be luggage when i ordered the ride! there is no place to mention any such thing on the app. she said that she had recently had an operation and shouldn't lift anything. i am a 72-year-old woman and she was about 25!
others just stand there expecting me to do it. 

although some of the men do this, it has always been the case with women. i am not about to do their job. 

lifting luggage and other parcels in and out of the trunk is part of the job. if they can't do it or don't want to do it, they need to find another professionnot stand idle and expect senior citizens and other customers to struggle.
title: Good drivers but lazy luggage handlers

review: works half the time. i always do the wait and save, meaning i wait 15 minutes and a car can come anytime until then. but lately, i've been getting notified that it's 2 min, and then the driver changes and it becomes 9 minutes. it'll be past the 15 min window, and the change is so close to when the other car was supposed to come. i use lyft when i need it most, so the fact that i'm late despite paying for car is disappointing, to say the least.
title: eh

review:
an example so you know what to expect:

i ordered a ride from newark airport. the first person to respond insisted on knowing where i was going. i told him it was in the app. he repeated his demand. when i told him new york, he stopped responding and waited, trying to milk a cancelation fee from me. lyft does nothing to stop this behavior and offers customers no way to report or rate these scammers.

when the first driver eventually gave up and canceled (after wasting 20 minutes stuck at newark), the second driver came to pick me up. his car was covered in inappropriate bumper stickers, he was playing loud music while talking on the phone, and he took me a route that added 50% to my time, for which lyft charged me more than 2x the initial price. i had not changed the destination or approved another price  they just chose to steal from me. 

when i claimed this as an overcharge, lyft affirmed that it was correct. fixing it took me 20+ minutes talking with their support, which tried to blame it on the individual driver instead of the way that lyft's app and customer service are configured. lyft is just terrible.
title: A constant mess

review:
i have lyft pink pass and even though it gives riders 15% off the resulting total is sometimes much higher than the cost of uber making the annual fee not worth it. i've been rescheduled rides after drivers decide not to pick-up and usually the drivers are double the original pick-up time (13-15min). the frequency of drivers deciding not to pick-up riders and skyrocketed prices makes the app unappealing, definitely will not use lyft pink next year.

constantly drives me to the incorrect location. in chicago there are two levels and the gps on lyft doesn't know the difference between upper and lower levels unlike uber.
title: Infrequent drivers that results in ridiculous wait times

review: is there something to say about women drivers from a man and all i can say about this driver was she was exceptional, professional, clean, the car was clean, knowledge of the area and brought me right to my destination with no hiccups making it a pleasurable ride as if i was maybe in the clouds getting a slice of heaven. it's nice to have real people beautiful people around you still i would recommend her to anyone who needs a ride because i've had some pretty challenging ones of times but eva rocks
title: What a great driver

review: i have a 5.0 rating as a passenger. but consistently drivers cancel when they are one min away from picking me up. it seems like from social media this is a problem many people experience. why do your drivers not just reject before taking the ride? is it something you teach them or incentivize them to do? i literally don't trust this app so much anymore i have to order an uber at the same time if i want to confirm i'll get to a destination in time because the lyft will cancel but the uber will still come because their drivers are actually trustworthy. it's to the point where i have to uninstall because i'll never get picked up if i have use this app.
title: Drivers constantly cancel when they are 1 min away

review: i tried using uber first and it took forever to find a driver matter fact uner never/couldn't find a driver and when i tried to use uber again it didn't even work i selected my destination and my location and they didn't even give me the option of searching for a nearby driver it just showed a blank map with no route or anything so i used downloaded and within 1 minute i found a ride to the airport and for $3 less i may add. so all and all lyft is the better choice versus uber
title: Lyft vs. UBER

review: i figured i save some $$$ by using lyft trying to get picked up on a friday afternoon at lax. had to take the shuttle after plane landed and another shuttle to the pick up area. it was blistering 95 and so my patience was running low. lyft app would not find me a driver until i'm at the pick up area but i am at the pick up area!! i cancel, close the app and try again. same thing!!! screw it, it's a work trip and open up uber and immediately i'm connected to a driver. is it that hard to make your app work like uber?!?! come on now lyft your better than that!! paid the extra $30 and felt like it was well worth it and not going to flinch ever again and stick to what works. deleted the app on my way home.
title: Not worth the savings - LAX pick up experience

review: lyft has got to be the worst rideshare app out there. drivers are constantly cancelling even after they accepted the rides and made it half way to you. there is no penalty when they do this but if you cancel on a ride after 30 seconds you have to pay a fee ?? the wait times are ridiculous and their map is terrible . everytime i try to get a ride to work my driver is taking me the wrong way and i have to direct them . i only use lyft when i really have to , i much rather use uber but sometimes their prices are so too high . if you have somewhere to be in a timely matter don't use lyft or you'll be waiting forever or getting canceled on which leaves you having to wait all over again.
title: Don't bother

review: jose was a nice guy but spoke no english .  so we went to the norwegian headquarters many miles from the miami cruise port in spite of me trying to stop him from driving further and further away from the port.  he said he was supposed to go to norwegian. i wound up giving him $20 tip to prevent him from exhibiting anger and get him to take us to the port. we should have paid $15 or less from our hotel on biscayne blvd. so the whole bill was rediculous.  i already paid him $20 cash. don't feel i should pay more money plus tip. you need to have drivers who speak english.
title: Miami has problems

review: what a wonderful experience!  i needed a ride from church as i didn't feel good after the service and didn't want to make my hubby have to bring me home and miss sunday school and lunch with the pastor!  rashi ((probably spelled his name wrong?sorry ) but he was so quick, pleasant with lots of great conversations that i almost wanted to plan a long trip somewhere with him with my daughters!   i will certainly keep his contact and will suggest him to my family, friends, neighbors, co-workers, and even strangers! he is excellent!
title: So grateful

review: i downloaded the lyft driver & rider apps back in september 2021 & have been lyft riding with the rider app since january 2022. i'm also an aspiring, upcoming new lyft driver come august 2022 when i apply @ age 25. i would like to suggest a new lyft restaurant order delivery app that would/could rival iner's ubereats. i call it lyft delishare'. i'm interested in working together with lyft, inc to develop this new app that i believe has high success potential & will most likely impact the app delivery market landscape to lyft, inc's advantage. i would be happy to hear or read what lyft rider support thinks about my food & beverages delivery app idea soon.
title: Lyft delishare App

review: let's get one thing straight: in post-covid times both uber and lyft are terrible and unreliable. that is just a general statement of fact. what makes lyft worse than uber, in my book, is that at least uber gives you a discount after they can't fine you a ride, or if your driver flakes on you. lyft just shrugs it off and silently says screw you. i've been sitting here being eaten by fire ants while waiting on a ride for an hour and a half and have been canceled on twice already despite my 5 star passenger rating and habit of tipping $5 minimum. i watched one of those rides head to dutch bros instead of picking me up. i got bailed on for coffee and this app won't punish that driver in any way.
title: Unreliable service, no compensation for canceled or unsourced rides

review: i'm currently using uber instead because i always had that problem of scheduling a ride and once the driver accepted it after couple of mins they immediately cancel my ride when i needed it since that's my way to get of work. i believe drivers shouldn't be able to cancel a ride once they accept it even if they're independent contractors, they'll doing a job and it's just so annoying that it happened to me frequently, fortunately it doesn't happen with uber and i would've used lyft again but that will continue going on and on.
title: It's great but drivers shouldn't be allowed to cancel

review:
how do i file a complaint ?
i'm on your app and nowhere does it give me an opportunity to email or call. your app is very frustrating. how do i contact a live person to file a complaint. the driver was on the wrong street and she called me and i explained all she had to do was go to the end of the block, make a right turn, and the next street on the right was buckeye lane, where i live. she made me miss the nutcracker at the schuster center where i had tickets. the next driver wouldn't arrive until after the play started. lyft owes me a refund for my tickets because the driver couldn't follow simple directions. 
if this isn't the correct area to file a complaint tell me how to because the app i'm using doesn't tell me how to do it!
title: Rider

review: not blaming the app itself but some of their drivers are so incompetent, they cant even follow the gps' instructions. ive had to cancel multiple drivers because they failed to meet at the meeting point. and worst of all i dont live in the city so its easier to navigate l, but somehow my driver was confused, thats ok i give him a call to let him know he was at the wrong location and he was in the right location from the beginning but at this point he already marked it as if be was already here and when hes driving to the meeting point i just see him leave again. im never using this app again ive had too many bad experiences with drivers.
title: Drivers are stupid!!!

review: ghazwan is absolutely fabulous! this ride was pre-scheduled two days in advance. unfortunately, lyft confused our pick-up spot with destination spot. they sent messages that driver was there. not! finally, after four driver changes, ghazwan showed up. we were late for our nephew's wedding. plus i was charged $5.55 missed pick-up fee.????? please remove. anyway, ghazwan is the very best! he also took us back after the wedding. he's a truly wonderful man. he is  the only reason i will stay with lyft. i will try to ask for him next time.
title: Ghazwan

review: we scheduled a lyft to the airport. the scheduled ride showed up on the app and if you went to the cancel ride screen, you could see the driver assigned to the trip (i couldn't find any other way to id the driver). there was never any additional information provided.  the scheduled ride appeared in the app prior to and through the scheduled pickup time but the driver never showed and there was no way to track where he was. luckily we could make a new reservation with a wonderful driver who was local and arrived quickly (and at 2/3 of the price of our scheduled ride). i'll never schedule a ride with lyft again unless they provide a better way to ensure your driver is actually on his way
title: No way to track scheduled driver (who never showed)

review: i rode this morning to work it was a normal commute only 9 mins. how i got charged $150 for damages i didn't do is beyond me. the driver submitted photos of vomit all over his car. not only did i reply to the email which by the way i never got a response but costumer service sucked. i tried asking for proof such as a timestamp only for them to say they can't really contact the driver. stay away from this app. i've used uber for 4 years and i've never been accused of such thing. i only recently started using it since its sometimes cheaper but i'm never using this app ever again. a $12 ride turning to a $162 ride. you best believe i disputed it with my bank.
title: Don't do it. Don't use this app. You're better off using Uber.

review:
it took lyft 15 minutes to find me a driver. nowhere was i given the option of cancelling the order. you first charge and then i am your slave regarding when you find me a driver. then, the site said 8 minutes and it took the driver over 15 min to get to me. 
the site said to me to wait between pickup areas 2-5, whereas it told the driver to get to area 5. i waited in the middle between areas 2 and 5. so i missed the driver for a couple of minutes and begun receiving threatening messages from you. very crappy customer service. luckily the driver called and we connected. 
i think it is time for me to start using another service.
title: Erroneous software, bad customer service.

review: my only suggestion is that maybe you should tell people to go to app to retrieve their total and option to tip after texting thank you for riding with lyft. you had sent texts and emails up to that point on type of car, drivers name, time of pick up. so it took me a few emails to you to find out i needed to go back to app for that. for most people it's probably obvious to do that. but for older people that are not used to this, it would be much easier if you included in your thank you text to go to the lyft app to find your total cost and to give tip.
title: Give consistent information

review: lyft works when it wants to work and when your ride ends up getting canceled your money is held for more than a couple business days and it normally doesn't appear back until later after a ride has been canceled and you have been waiting for almost an hour and the prices on lyft are ridiculous there should be no reason why i should be paying almost $35-$40 just to go 10 minutes or even five minutes. i woke up this morning to call my lyft it's not even 8:30 and already my lyft ride is $60 going on to 80 why is lyft double chargingwith very few riders on the road and it keeps rising has more riders appear
title: Scheduling and overpriced

review: i am very disappointed in the customer service that i have received from lyft.  i was charged for an $80 damage fee for spilled soda.  however, there was no soda brought into the ride and i am 100% certain of this. the only evidence lyft needed was a picture of a wet car seat. i believe this driver either did this intentionally to make extra money, or that this happened on a later ride. when reaching out to customer service on this, i received short and insufficient responses with no remorse. basically, they said that they take the drivers word over the customers. so be careful when putting your card into lyft because their little fine print states they can charge you for whatever they want!
title: Damage fee ride scam

review: well, this trip is my first time using lyft regularly.  i have an allergy to the other company based on various corporate practices. the issue we are having is we select the normal service and it says 9 minutes.   but the it sometimes takes over 20 minutes to arrive.   if i knew, i'd pay the extra dollar to have a sooner pick up, or order sooner.   also, at this peak in the pandemic, the drivers should have their masks on already and not just put it on when we approach the car.
title: Service works, with glitches

review: i was a long time customer with no previous issues and recently got a new job in a different area. i bought the annual membership, which is $200, and little did i know this new area has little to no drivers. im a small woman and this area is dangerous and i wait outside in the rain and dark for hours some nights after work. i tried to make it work before i was sick and tired of being rained on every night (i'm in washington). i asked to be refunded for the months i didn't use, which was 10 months, and they refused it. they said their system won't allow it. i wasted $160! probably more because the rides were so expensive! this is so unfair! treat your customers and drivers well. i left a bad review everywhere and went to bbb.
title: HORRIBLE COMPANY

review:
personal car rides is the best thing that's happened since sliced bread.  lyft has been leading the pack ever since, and everyone seems to be happy about it. i personally love it. i've driven taxi-cabs in philadelphia, pa from the mid-eighties to the early nineties, and i'm telling you if the lyft ride car service was out back then, all i would've been able
to do was twiddle my thumbs or join the new and improved way to make a dollar out of fifteen cents !! good job lyft !! keep the american moving !
title: Personal car ride

review: i am very grateful llyft exists because i am now able to get out of my apartment and go more places. i gave up my car some years ago. at that time the santa monica bus system was great. then it changed for the worst. i then stayed in my apartment and didn't go anywhere. i also have copd. then along cane llyft and even better the mode program was started. being isolated is not mentally or physically healthy so i am thankful for llyft. i don't even want to think that llyft might not be around. thank you
title: Thankful for Llyft

review: you have taken money from me when i did not order cars and still have not responded to this grievance! your customer service is horrible and ridiculous and there needs to be something set in place for when multiple drivers cancel on a rider! this has happened to me numerous times in one request therefore making me late! yet you want riders to pay all these service fees but nothing happens when multiple drivers cancel on you with no reason given! if 2 or more drivers cancel on you in the same trip, some kind of credit needs to be given because this is happening way to often!!!
title: Credit needs to be given and have a better system to talk with someone to get money back!

review: myself, two teenagers and two smaller children. went to the fair but not from here and had no idea how hard getting a ride back to our hotel would be. walking was gonna be an hour. we started walking but kept lyft open in case someone picked up our trip request. 20 minutes in and emilio saved the day! said he had just turned on his driver app. funny how things turn out sometimes. so grateful for him and this driving service.
title: Saved us in a pinch

review:
surprised when i clicked confirm and then saw on the confirmation that my pick up location had changed to a location i did not plug in. i believe the drag on map feature moved my pickup location. i'm new to the app so maybe my inadvertent input but the lyft app would not allow me change the location, no matter how hard i tried, even though it was < 1 block away and closer. frustrating and infuriating.  tried to cancel and reduce but that would have coast me to do so. ugh! 
add this drag on map as an option and allow me to confirm the address i typed in.
title: Changed my pickup location on me

review: i have been a lyft customer for several years. at time i am so proud of lyft. they come at a sufficient time. some lyft drivers are great, even to hold conversation with. you can learn a lot of new things from lyft drivers that come from all over the world. but at times lyft rides can be extremely tooo costly. it's no way in the world that a ride that cost $40 regularly should be $80 at one time and then $213 at another time. that's when you feel as though something that you have been relying is no longer reliable. you go from feeling comfortable with something to feeling stuck.
title: Been using Lyft for Yearrrs

review:
33$ for a ride that is less than 6 minutes away because it's busy is absolutely unacceptable. i live in denver where every other person you meet is a lyft or uber driver and you're gonna tell me there aren't enough? these apps really have the audacity to just charge you whatever they want and take no accountability. 0 stars 
oh! and let's not forget that the drivers will make you wait 15 minutes before being picked up and then cancel on you 2 minutes from your pickup & make you late for work, even if you try to schedule a pick up. absolutely a joke of a company. cant wait to see this 1 star review somehow turn to 5 without me touching it either.
title: Absolutely insane prices that make no sense.

review: i know there's no way for lyft to properly vet those who drive for them; however, there needs to be a way you can monitor and fire those who purposely delay a ride trying to make the rider cancel, so they'll still get paid. it's a shady practice and a dangerous one. i'm riding with ride share due to an accident that injured my neck and back. i'm physically unable to stand for even short periods of time. yet on multiple occasions i've watched the driver go in what looks like circles, until i cancel the ride. i'm not in the physical condition to play these kind of games with people using your driver app in bad faith.
title: Bad faith drivers

review: i decided to use lyft when i was able to travel after my surgery. trying to park and get into the terminal seemed burdensome. so, i decided to give the service a try. nothing smoother than being dropped right at the front door of the terminal. i had an early morning flight and the car was at my house at 3:40am. used the service while out of townminimal wait time, cars were all clean and drivers were already respectable, courteous and professional.
title: Easy to Use

review:
pre-pandemic rideshare was my main form of business ground transportation and always used uber because it was always a few dollars cheaper and sooner pick up times. 

but during the pandemic every rideshare company in the us raised their prices $5-10 more except lyft. forced to save money i called lift. the experience has been great. drivers, pick up time and great navigation all has been above and beyond the other companies. now i choose lyft because it's a great company!
title: Cheaper than Uber 5 of 10 trips

review: i usually use lyft and uber to get from home to work. my biggest problem is that the cost of a $10-15 ride gets cranked up nearly 5x the price if there are fewer drivers (with lyft)! how does that make sense? in what world would i pay somebody $50 to pick me up in a usually $10 ride? this sort of thing puts lyft at the bottom of services that i'd consider for personal travel. uber has never cranked up their prices on me unless they had a lot of drivers and a lot of people taking rides with them and even then it wasn't some absurd 5x standard rate increase. shameful.
title: It's a nice experience WHEN THERE ARE DRIVERS!

review: i truly find it kinda funny that lyft says there number one priority is safety but my last two rides i have had with lyft i have been scared the first driver it was pouring down rain and hailing and she is speeding in the rain texting and driving i texted my husband and told him how unsafe i felt. i reached out to support and i got a im sorry you won't have that person again and your safety is number one to us and gave 5 dollar credit. my second ride the guys car i felt was about to break down, serving in both lanes, ran stop sign etc all i got was we took care of it anything else i can do like just rushing you, for a place so big about there customers my experience's haven't been good at all
title: So disappointed

review:
i have always loved lyft for years now it was my go to but after this previous weekend i will be using uber from now on. 

if you aren't using priority pickup then you are likely not going to get picked up any time soon. my driver had changed 4 times before finally being picked up and waiting longer and longer each time. then again the same night for the ride home my driver changed minutes before i was supposed to be picked up, changing my wait to an extra 45 minutes. i cancelled the ride, paid the extra money for priority pickup and was picked up in minutes. the driver said she was just about to pick someone up when she was changed to my ride. 

the drivers have no control if their rides get changed last second and it leaves the riders waiting for extended periods of time without notice. i will be switching to uber because of this since it's the same price after having to pay for priority. 

i don't recommend unless something changes.
title: Switching to Uber

review: james was our lyft !!! he was very sweet and kind . he picked us up from kentucky kingdom today. we were supposed to meet at a ride share location instead of the front gate and we were not aware of this rule . since they would not let him in to pick us up , he waited for us to travel all the way to the drive share location on the other side of the park . i appreciate his patience and his kind demeanor about the whole situation! we need more kind people in this world ! thanks james!!!!
title: James

review: i've had nothing but praise for lyft. have never had a bad experience until now. driver claimed i damaged car-spilt liquid in the seat. i wasn't drinking anything in the car. i tried to dispute with lyft directly but that went nowhere. they didn't seem to care that the time stamp on the pictures of the damage were wrong, the location drop was wrong. didn't realize there was no customer support. i'm a 5-star rider, excellent tipper, multiple badges. disappointing to be treated so poorly by lyft. they've lost my trust and business. i won't kid myself-lyft doesn't care about my experience but i hope it will help a rider think twice before using lyft.
title: 5 yrs loyal to lyft-jokes on me

review:
the app is not as good as a year ago. i haven't used lift for a while. it used to be so easy to use. this new app is cumbersome and doesn't work as easily to enter locations. it tries to think on its own and information is incorrect.

i agree the app used to work much better. it took me  38 minutes to just order a ride. i was in a hurry and frustrated. i've been trying to download app and i can't get it on my phone. not as good as in the past.
title: Drivers excellent App is bad

review:
today i had the wonderful opportunity of being matched with daniel as my lyft driver. 

daniel was extremely polite, professional, and personable. to be honest, he was so sociable, it seemed as though we made the 10 minute trip to my house within a blink of eye. there's nothing like great conversation, right? 

daniel's car was very clean and comfortable. lastly, he was very careful while driving.  needless to say, i recommend this lyft driver without any reservations. i am hopeful we cross paths again in the future.
title: As good as it gets!

review: forget the fact that it took 15 min to load the screen where i typed my destination, (on a solid wifi connection with no other apps taking bandwidth) once i entered the info it just stayed stuck on the screen where you select the ride type and cost. now i remember why i uninstalled this app. serious fix your app, you're a tech company! would be a pretty good app if it was usable, but currently it is not. just checked the app one last time before i uninstall and guess what--it still hasn't loaded the ride options! (yes now i have two apps pulling bandwidth, app store, to write this review,  and lyft. didn't before). i don't need this frustration in my life--uninstalling again.
title: Slow and won't load

review: returning home from san jose airport at 9:40 pm on a normal weekday. lyft searched for 3 minutes for a driver and allowed a driver to accept the ride even before he finished his current ride that was 6 miles away. he had 10 more minutes on his current ride. the driver took a good chunk of 15 minutes to complete his ride and come to pick up. pretty poor app design. does not give estimated time before requesting a ride. liberally charged my card right away even before the driver showed up. that was 15 minutes before the driver even showed up. lyft has lost me as a customer forever. i should have canceled and used uber, which was showing drivers within 3 minutes.
title: Had to wait 20 minutes for a 15 minute ride

review:
send me a reminder 1/2 way through the ride: you're almost there! would you like to tip the driver? because when i get out at my location i'm done thinking about the driver- i'm focused on checking my bags, or finding my friends. 

there is a tip during the ride option but incredibly, it asks again at the end of the ride, which makes it seems like you're tipping twice. just have it go through the first time, don't ask me again that's confusing! 

also, if you're tipping normally at the end of the ride, it should be first option we see. right now it appears at the very bottom, almost off the screen- please change it!
title: Screen Changes To Make Tipping Intuitive

review: for every one who works at and designed the support at lyft enjoy earning that free paycheck , i scheduled my ride in advance like a night before to be somewhere really important and guess what 2 drivers cancelled the trip after making you hang and wait for the ride for 30 minutes this is some horrible and really deceiving service experience they offer plus you can't even report this , there is no support number or link to report this kind of ridiculous service issue after being charged for the ride, the company does nothing to improve from so many complains on the ratings and they clearly don't care as long as it's not big enough .
title: Horrible Ride share Management

review:
many times a driver will be a distance from a pickup location .. i'm waiting in one place and them in another .. eventually leaving g me with a  no show . rating  
also dropped pin' 
after many years of using lyft many times in a day i still don't understand the dropped pin premise and how to move a dropped pin once it's been set so again many times drivers will go to a dropped pin i don't know how i've dropped the pin and i don't know how to remove the dropped pin-so that can be frustrating as well
title: Navigation

review: i was a uber rider until i decided to try out lyft one day and never switched back. lyft has the best drivers and they are always around when you need them! uber doesn't have very many options and it's hard to get a ride in certain places. i've had only a couple issues with uber drivers but no one wants to deal with that when they don't have to! so lyft it will always be for me! 10 out of 10, would recommend!
title: I switched from Uber

review:
this app believes it always knows what you want; and it's mostly wrong. it shoves you went to a corner regardless. 
i can back out mistake and start over it's ridiculously cumbersome. 
it is like some cheesy used car salesman who is afraid to let you off the lot. call i have humorous times just give it up and walk a couple miles instead of dealing with this app. i am doing that that as i write this review. and the service is good, the tracking of a driver while it find a way to you is excellent booking of a trip to change your mind just downright offensive. even killing the the app and restart and you're stuck in the same trick bag.
title: Pompous arrogant

review:
i am being prompted to verify my credit card by providing another credit card with the same billing address. every time i do that, i am getting the error message. i've contacted lyft several occasions with the reps all saying to follow the prompts.

 we couldn't verify your information. please make sure it is entered correctly. 

  i tried explaining that i am but the app isn't accepting it, they just regurgite the same statement that i should follow the prompts. i am so upset at the lack of proper user friendly service. i bought lyft credit and they accepted my card for that though. however, i could not use it since they cannot verify my info as per error message below. go figure. do better. poor service.
title: HORRIBLE SECURITY MEASURES

review: i wake up this morning & get ready for work to find out my account has been deactivated for no apparent reason. i follow community guidelines, i barely talk to drivers, i pay close observation to what they do & on top of it, my account gets banned/deactivated for nothing. you should really look into who you have as "lyft drivers" & listen more to your customers than your so-called drivers. there are a few good ones out there, but alot of bad ones just to collect a paycheck & not care what happens to it's riders. since my account has been deactivated, i have also taken the time to delete your app from my phone as well, as i will use uber from now on. thank you & have a good day
title: Deactivated for Nothing

review: sometimes 5 stars means brand new driver. i guess they had a customer or two with 5 stars. the second last time i had a 5 star driver lga-upper west side. missed the exit, went all the way over to new jersey, then turned around, missed the manhattan exit, back to the bronx. turned around and went down the bronx to the lower east side ?!? the trip was cancelled (he selected arrived) somewhere before the lower east side. he drove me the rest of the way without the app.  i was in the lyft for 1.5 hours and instead of the 50 or 60$ i was quoted. i ended up paying around $130. no refund.
title: Depends who you get. Beware 5 stars

review:
unfortunately my driver decided to cancel and the easiest way to do it was to report i was not wearing a mask. i was still inside my job when he cancelled so it was no accident, plus he was in the wrong pick up spot. it's unfortunate lyft asks to verify if i'm wearing a mask and could potentially suspend my account because a driver makes a false report.

update:
as another rider mentioned, drivers have been writing negative feedback and sending an email right away, but lyft doesn't specify what you are doing wrong i've seen the guidelines and i haven't done anything wrong that mentions on the guidelines. lyft just keeps getting worse, don't know why i bother using this app anymore, its tome to deactivate my account.
title: False Mask Report

review: i'm immunocompromised so you'll never see me leave the house without a mask on so i don't understand why i keep getting alerts about drivers complaining that i'm not wearing a mask. there's no accountability, no verification, any driver who doesn't like you or is annoyed because they didn't get enough tip can just report you. i depend on ride sharing apps for my transportation, but i will no longer be using this app as it seems like their employees lack professionalism.
title: Lying Drivers

review: this app makes it very easy to schedule a trip in advance of the time i need a ride. this feature is very important to me as i don't like having my ride be a last minute stressor.  i have also found the  3 minute vibration alert before the driver arrives another great feature. really removes the stress of watching the clock wondering minute by minute when my driver is pulling up out front. thank you lyft for making a ride convenient and stress free!
title: Easy to schedule

review: lyft promotes background checks and safety of their riders by pre-checking their drivers and now considered employees. my phone was stolen by the driver, and 4 days later the company still has no way to contact their own driver? and the response was that, they are attempting to contact, but there was no response. thankfully this is just a phone. what if it were a person stuck. they still have no way to verify this person or contact them?? this is highly concerning as at the very least knowing the driver is checked let's you feel safe. i thought that's where all the added fees went. either way, this is concerning as a company and a rider that there is a lack of accountability and safety.
title: How safe is it?

review: i've had so many drivers!!! accept the ride only to cancel right when they are halfway here! and it already probably took them about 15 minutes to get to me and as soon as they're 3 minutes away they cancel and then i have to wait for it to find another driver. i had an experience like this last week and i had two drivers cancel back to back and i was late for work because of your drivers!!! there needs to start being a penalty on the drivers for canceling once they're halfway here for wasting our time! we get charged for canceling so why don't they get charged for having us late to where we need to go?! get better rules for your drivers lyft!
title: So sick of these drivers!!!

review: i requested lyft ride to minimize inconvenience of taking the bus with groceries. this driver arrived on time, but was rude and refused to help lift my groceries. he said he just had a surgery. granting his excuse was true, why did he drive today? he could have just waited until he is strong enough to help his passengers. also, at his age, he should consider retiring! i don't recommend this driver if you expect your llyft driver to help you load your groceries. it makes me wonder how he got a rating of 4.9.
title: Rude and too old to help

review: last night in san fransico, seeing geary street blocked off, i requested a lyft ride. i was at # 9 kearny. the app said a driver will be there in 5 minutes, go to stevenson. i was across from a bus stop, not in a no stopping zone, no reason to have to move. i had no idea where stevenson was. the app gave me no directions but i had 5 minutes to find it and given no reason why i had to move my location. it was dark and i had to wander around market street alone at night. if you ever try to contact lyft for information or assistance, good luck. there is no option for reasonable communication with this company. it's use at your own risk.   they will not help you and are not interested in genuine feedback.
title: Lyft Customer Service

review:
while in route to my destination, a car just ahead and to the right of us lost control, and into a sharp left across the interstate . passing directly in front of us, my driver swerved to miss him. the car crashed into the retainer wall and shot back towards us. my driver again swerved to the right and missed the car again! 
i'm grateful for having this young man as my driver today. it was only the grace of the most high that saved us both.
title: Excellent driving!!

review: this platform has been here for me in 3 different business settings over the course of 6 years. i have compared it to other riderhare apps and this is the most consistent to deliver. they're pricing (however high sometimes) gets you a driver and the pricing is relatively consistent between destinations. the drivers don't cancel frequently which i appreciate. overall the only taxi app i use now after trying a bunch.
title: Consistent, Reliable, Up Front

review:
i cannot stress this enough there needs to be a penalty for drivers that accept a ride and then cancel. 
i waited 15 minutes for a driver that accepted my ride only to have him wave his finger at me as he pulled past the pick up location and drove away. the app showed a new driver 15 minutes away a moment later. this can't happen for this ride share app to be taken seriously and be a reliable method of transit. horrible experience.
title: Drivers Cancel Without Notice

review: the driver that i had this morning anthony was amazing. i had to use lyft last week and it was hard to get a driver. i ordered the pickup at 5:15 so i can get to work for 6:00. three of the four driver that pick up the ride but they drop it, finally the fourth one came. i got to work five minutes last. i hope that gets better in the future. so for anthony he was on time picking me up and i had sometime to get myself ready without rushing. thanks anthony !!!
title: Awesome driver Anthony

review: since january 2020 to today i have spent thousands of dollars on lyft rides. at times some were over $50. only to find out i earn more rewards at chick fil a then i do using their services. my wife asked, are you earning any rewards using their service on rides to work? surely you have earned at least 1 discounted or free trip? no points no discounts no rewards. it's awful. they have delta miles you can earn but after all that i have spent it would start the day you sign up moving forward what good does that do.? so over it. looking at alternatives, good service over 6k spent and nothing to show for it.
title: Thousands spent in rides With 0 rewards

review: june 2nd 2022 it took ten minutes for the app not to find a driverit takes five minutes to find a driver then it takes another 10 to 15 minutes for the driver to show up then 7 out of 10 times these drivers are canceling the rides. i have a five star rating it is now june 1, 2022. you're better off catching a bus or walking to your destination..lyft has the most incompetent drivers, you're worth driving drivers with the gps we don't know how to get around the city drivers who don't acknowledge the individuals in the car drivers who are rude who are inconsiderate. but feel the need to charge and i'm absurd amount of money to be in a car with ignorant people/drivers
title: Absolutely trash

review: lyft has this new thing: a driver gets to within 3 minutes of picking you up (literally 2 blocks away), and suddenly lyft announces that we found another driver - but the new driver is 10 minutes away.  and this is after scheduling the ride the night before.  never mind getting picked up within the predicted time window.  thats poor customer service at best, and sneaky and deceptive at worst. no thanks- uber is an option and thats what ive been using. dear lyft , please add a field to the list of cancellation options: lyft screwed me over and im not giving them business.
title: Changing drivers

review: i really enjoy the app it's the thing that gets me around as a teen without a car but please please please stop putting customers in queue for drivers 12 -20 mins away and add fuel to the fire by having the driver currently dropping someone off this has caused me to be to work late several times (causing a very on thin ice relationship with me and my boss) please just find drivers who are en route and not dropping someone off please it's a huge inconvenience but this is the best ride share app in my opinion cheapest and the safest to me.
title: Please Stop

review: tim was especially reassuring that our rider  who has vision & accessibility concerns rode comfortably & arrived safely...with a smile. we appreciate that! excellent experience except for so many challenges with the ap & extreme difficulty getting a non-robot customer service response to questions not on the multiple layers of faqs. ... we did eventually, though, & the convenience of lyft & drivers like tim can prove to be very valuable assets for us. we look forward to that possibility. thank you.
title: Special care appreciated

review: so my experience with lyft so far is that they are ok, however i don't understand why when i need a lyft ride at certain times you start charging $30-$50 for a ride 10 -12 mins up the road, it's nasty how y'all try people like that and when you pay for it your waiting 30 like mins for them to finish up another ride just to come to you like, if im pay that much to go up the road i don't need to wait!  all because fares are busy doesn't you can charge people $30-$50 to go 10-12 mins up the road. that needs to change.
title: Charges rates are stupid

review: we ordered a ride because it was a rainy cold night and one person in our group wasn't feeling well. (inebriated but harmless)as soon as we got in the car the driver was extremely agitated because we didn't need a very long ride. he immediately told he was upset he had came all this way for two dollars.  he immediately began driving very erratically due to the anger!! we knew it was a short trip and we're planning on tipping well to make it worth his while but he didn't even give us a chance before acting out in a very poor behavior. i'm thankful that there are services such as this and appreciate most all drivers but this guy needs to find a new line of work.
title: Angry driver!!!

review: first and foremost that app is great with great service and the people are really nice. but i'm not trying to pay for someone's phone bill or gas i understand that your paying for a service but the prices are outrageous to pay to get to one destination to the next uber is 1000x better with the prices if you want to have 3 stops it'll be less than $20 while lyft wants you to pay almost a phone bill amount for a pickup, add stop and the destination if i could give a rating of 2 1/2 i would do better with the pricing it's just ridiculous.
title: It's great but

review: this app gives good deals but your first ride always cancels on you after you wait at least 10 minutes when uber would have been two minutes. and then your second ride takes 20 minutes and half the time they'll show up half of the time they won't but then you end up sitting on the side of the road, in an area they want you to walk to where you end up sitting all by yourself for at least 30 minutes and maybe you get a ride and maybe you don't. and a ride if you ever get one, it's always the worst ride ever have! half the price as uber but at least 10 times the amount of time, so i guess take your pick!
title: Worst ride share app

review: paid almost $80 (not including tip) for a 10 minute pickup time but had to wait over 30 minutes.  this was after our previously scheduled pickup with another service cancelled on us and informed us that there were no other drivers in our area. we waited almost two hours for a ride back to our hotel after a concert. pretty scary being the only two people (females) on a nearly deserted street in a large city.  once we were finally picked up, our lyft driver, thressa was fantastic. however, we paid more for a one way lyft ride than we paid for a concert ticket.  very disappointed.
title: Over charged.

review: these people will literally pull up to the location where they have to pick you up at and will cancel the ride and ride right past you.. this happens way too often and i just feel that it is very ignorant. you are given an opportunity to drive an make money and they don't even wanna do that. no one picks up rides it's like everyone who drives for this app is too good to pick you up if their in your area. really unfortunate and people who don't wanna drive shouldn't use this app at all it is very inconsiderate for people who legitimately wanna get home safe! lyft is not in anyones best interest.
title: Wouldn't recommend if you really need a ride

review: i scheduled a ride with lyft from my home at 9:00pm to go to pick up food. 20 minutes later i scheduled a ride to go back home and i received notification that my account waa suspended because i was reported 3 times by drivers that i either did not wear a mask during my ride. i was left stranded at the restaurant and had to resort to a restaurant employee taking me home out of the kindness of their heart. i contacted support and they absolutely were no help and told me there was nothing that could be done. i have always worn a mask during all of my rides. i am a black woman wearing a black mask and that was reported. this was a horrible situation that i was put in by lyft's careless actions.
title: My account was disabled which left me stranded

review: me and my boyfriend recently were in a car accident and have been pouring money into ubers and lyft drivers so we can get to and from work. one morning our ride was supposed to be 8 dollars, we work a 5 minute drive down the street. it had updated to 35 dollars when we were at our destination, and that was the last of our money in our bank account, we couldn't even tip our driver. we were in complete shock, contacted customer service and it said nothing was incorrect on their end. this app and their customer service is a joke. they never notified us during the drive of a price change.
title: Stole all the rest of my money in account for 5 minute ride

review:
i have used uber for years and decided to try lyft for the first time. i was in a time sensitive situation and needed to get moving so i used the lyft app. the app gave me a estimated time for the drivers meeting time. i waited about 17 minutes and he showed up. i loaded my bags and was in the process of sitting down when he asked what the destination was. when i told him he cancelled the ride and said he was late for work and my destination was too far. he asked me to get my bags and apologized for the inconvenience. 
  i promptly opened up my uber app and got a ride, i tipped the driver $20. find better drivers lyft, i travel 300 days a year and use transportation services often. this was not a good start.
title: Left hanging

review:
this was our first time using lyft. we needed a ride to the airport to catch a flight. traveling is anxiety provoking enough, and i was looking for a car service that would allow me to reserve a ride a few days in advance instead of an hour or so. once i made the reservation, i got reminders from lyft and updates on when the driver would arrive. it was very reassuring. 
friendly, safe driver, and clean car. a very good experience.
title: First time using Lyft- good experience

review: this app is not reliable. scheduled or unscheduled, drivers are constantly canceling rides to chase higher fares, lyft blatantly lies about how long it will take to get a ride (consistently off by more than 30mins), drivers call me asking where i am going and asking me to cancel if it is not an expensive ride. the airport is the worst, constant surge pricing and loooong wait times. i'm switching back to ordinary taxis. rideshare started out so cool now it's even worse than taxis used to be, and the same price to boot. massive fail. lyft needs to be more honest about wait times, fix its incentives and not let drivers play games with customers.
title: Drivers constantly cancel

review: i ordered a ride yesterday, right? i put the exact amount of money it cost on my cashapp (and lyft took it off without any issue) and i put the tip on there during the ride. why a whole a day later am i being told i didn't have enough funds, yet my money is still gone on cashapp? i just tried to order a new ride, and it took my money twice (the exact amount again) and its still telling me i have insufficient funds. how much money are you trying to take from me? this is why i put money on cashapp as i need it because of instances like these. you're not gonna pull off all of my money for no reason and make me wait to get it back. horrible experience.
title: Horrible experience.

review: lyft app does not allow any account holder to remove any payment options unless account holder provide their credit cards lyft policy is that nothing else matters but the credit cards not your bank account nor paypal lyft just wants to collect all your credit card information keep it for lyft use there's no way to remove payment options from the app unless you send lyft another credit card lyft blocks account holder access and hold all account holder payment options until account holder is able to put new credit card in place
title: Payment

review: i have trouble every time i use the app.  it is not intuitive.  my daughter had to help me three times last night.  each time we thought we had it the app would pop up something and i would click on it and have to ask for help.  i accidentally ordered an immediate pickup when i wanted to schedule it for the next day.  i couldn't see how to cancel that ride so i could reorder my next morning trip. i've worked with pcs for 40 years and apps for 15 without such problems.  i suggest you get some user input. thanks for listening
title: I may be old but

review:
they always put a smile on my face. i'm permanently disabled wearing 6 lbs leg braces in a wheelchair and the drivers are very helpful and compassionate. 
they added a driver's directions for a guard check-in to a gated community before going to my house. i was amazed at how amazingly remarkable for them to do it. i  haven't stopped smiling!!! i posted on next door app that lyft is 110% better than uber in prices and excellent service. i got some replies that they very much agree!!! way to go, lyft
title: Lyft is Outstanding

review: i received lyft pink as a bonus on my chase credit card and am finding it to be a very useful service. used it three times in a recent trip and all three were very positive experiences with excellent drivers and vehicles. the app shows the location of the vehicle that is picking you up along with an image of the vehicle and driver along with a license, etc. easy to tip. one suggestionmake it easier to give a review after the ride.
title: Useful ServiceIntuitive App

review:
i am not sure if lyft is doing it on purpose to hide ride history so you can't dispute a charge but for the last 4 days, i can't view my ride history. i've been a lyft customer for over 3 years and have well over 300 rides.

when contacting tech support, not only were they purposely rude, but each support member put the problem of my ride history having disappeared on some non existent special department that was going to email me regarding my issuewhich in 4 days has not happened and 4 days later i still  don't have access to my ride history and i therefore still can't dispute a $21 ride i never took on lyft.

furthermore, their customer service/tech support is only available through the app by text which is absurd.

needles to say i will be deleting this app after 3 plus loyal years as a customer and moving exclusively to uber. this experience of a simple fix, and the rudeness, and rather indifference to helping me out with the issue of my ride history having disappeared put me over the  edge. bye lyft.
title: Ride History is gone

review: i have been using this app for 7 years and recently it has been a nightmare. getting charged for cancellation fees when the driver decides not to do the ride bc of cargo (not his fault at all, the app is at fault for this). i've also been getting told i wasn't wearing a mask and my account might be suspended? absurd to think i would ever do that during this time. trying to connect with customer support about these concerns and dealing with rude, condescending staff. being completely unable to communicate with anyone at lyft about these issues is just unbelievable as well.  it's like they want people to stop using the app so they can finally shutdown all together. uber it is from now on.
title: Annoyed

review: i was gonna make a comment re not getting my save20 coupon for new users and then couldn't get back to requesting a ride in advance.   please step up your game!!! i entered home as my starting destination and remembered. home as my last arrived ng deatbation and estimated that it would cost $8 to drive me from my front door to my front door.   crazy!  and i was on a time sensitive mission to the airport which just changed its name.
title: Important to make it easier to renavigate site

review: i reserved a ride the night before for a 5:45 am pick up to go to the airport. when morning came, one of the drivers turned on his app in time to pick me up 10 minutes late but got me to the airport in time for my flight. it seems that even if one books the night before, one may not be absolutely guaranteed a pick up, especially if the driver has to travel some distance, as they have the right of refusal.
title: Close call

review:
i had a situation with a damage fee and the operators were very slow to getting back with me and they were not open to refunding a charge that was not authorized by me! 

a driver submitted photos from damage that was done to his car but it was because he ran into a mailbox before i was alerted he was outside the house in which i was being picked up from. and because i was the rider at the time in which the damage was done, they charged my account! what does his poor judgement of driving have to do with me???? 

lyft would not refund me simply because pictures were provided and then they dismissed me by telling me to have a great day. horrible. never riding with them again.
title: CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!

review: i was traveling to seattle and trying to figure out the best way to get to my hotel. lyft app not only showed me i could use the light rail to get within a few blocks of my hotel downtown for only $3, but also navigated the walking path through the airport, the rail path while i was onboard the light rail, and the walking path to my hotel. this type of functionality makes me significantly more likely to start with lyft next time i want to open a ride app.
title: Great Mobility Upgrades

review:
i recently booked a lyft with two stops. during the first stop i told the driver i needed to run into a store to grab something, and he agreed that he would wait, so i left my book bag in the backseat. i came back out 5 mins later and he was gone.

fast forward an hour, he finally came back with my bag. i asked him why he left and he said he got another fare while i was inside the store. it's pretty messed up to tell someone you'll wait and then leave them anyway. 

when i checked my bag i found a random woman's debit card. so either it was the driver or his rider, but either way it would've never happened if the driver didn't lie and leave me stranded. 

lyft then emailed me to say i'm getting charged $15 on top of the $16 (one mile) fare for the drivers inconvenience having to bring my bag back. so i paid $31 for a 1 mile ride and a wasted hour of my time, and lyft refused to do anything about it.

i'm deleting the app and going back to uber, where i've never had any issues like this before.
title: Lack of Support - Bad Experience Not Made Right

review: in the past i used uber.   but lately the app is not working.  can't find location.   even if i entered address info.   i got stuck for hrs figuring the app, restarting and re-installing.   my sister recommended lyft.  i downloaded it.  and right away i was able to sign up.  and in less than 5 minutes a driver was heading my way.   it is easier to use lyft. it has more details. easy to navigate app/site.   i now deleted uber and am using lyft.
title: I recommend Lyft 100%

review:
when lyft driving of passengers day to day becomes hard work, that's when it's tough for the driver and passengers. so what i've noticed in lyft drivers isn't hard work, it's what i call, heart work. there driving is more pleasant than any thing. focusing on safety and having the heart of a lion is just what makes it the best ride from point a the pickup  to point b the drop off . keep up the outstanding heart work lyft. 
kindest regards,
     mitchell
title: From point A to point B nothing but the best

review: it has been a wild 8 years. what's insane is i made more money 8 years ago and the pay has slowly fallen to mere pennies on the dollar. inflation is at all time highs so are gas prices. how do these companies justify such low rates? im not sure who makes these decisions but a child could figure out the problem here. this is what you get when you hire mba grads that don't know anything about the real world of business. why do you companies still hire such people? how am i as a driver supposed to want to even walk from my house to my car for these prices? i'd make more panhandling if i didn't have any self respect for myself like some of your decision makers.
title: Driver of 8 years most likely not coming back.

review: i am blind so i use various transportation means to get around and i use lyft over the other ride share apps almost every time, but there is still a lot of room for improvement and i've also found myself having rides that seem as though they are going to arrive and it gets all the way down to the last one or two minutes left until their estimated arrival, but then it suddenly changes me to a driver who is 15+ minutes away or the app shuffling through various drivers until one is found causing frequent delays
