title: Lyft

review:
lyft as well as their competitor, uber use many algorithms to give the riders a perception of high demand which involves sending ride requests to cars farther away than other cars. they then charge the passenger higher rates because it's busy. the company keeps almost all if not all of the extra fare charged to the passenger in most cases. the passengers feel they are paying enough just for the ride so they do not tip the driver, and tips are a huge part of the drivers income. when driver income goes down while their costs go up, such as massive inflation on fuel and everything else associated with car maintenance, drivers drive less or quit completely thus fulfilling the perceived appearance of it being busy only now it is busy because there aren't enough drivers to accommodate the demand. the pay to drivers is less now than when i started driving for both companies in 2015. i make less money for doing the same ride while it costs me more just to do the ride. their driver turnover has always been massive for many reasons, not only financial but also because of dealing with the entitled passengers who think it's perfectly acceptable to be rude and disrespectful, vomit in a strangers car and pretend nothing happened and many other horrible behaviors. most passengers start off badly by rudely attempting to help themselves into a strangers car without first verifying to the driver that they are the person they are looking for. a rider has zero reason to ever get into the wrong car because they have all the info on their phone including the license plate of the car. there is not another car on the planet with that plate. find that car and let the driver know you are his/her passenger. easy peasy. stop playing the who are you picking up? game with a driver that only wants to know they are picking up the correct person. a person who is trying to scam a free ride will do exactly that and whatever name the driver says, they magically become that person. the driver has no way to verify otherwise. the apps will send the driver to the wrong address and they have basically zero info about the passenger because people make fake profiles, no pics with fake names such as karzilla, rumplestiltskin, scorpio five star and my favorite, . i have met all these people and many more. 
always be nice and respectful to your driver, tip them and if they got you to your destination alive, that's 5

review:
i once thought that uber was the best &
lyft was a mediocre knock-off- boy was i
wrong! i have had such trouble with uber-
problems with rude drivers who actually
left on me while i was in bank during a round trip & i am in a wheelchair!/ problems with
being over-charged/ problems with being double charged! ...& i have been so very
frustrated bcuz there is never a way to contact uber. they say they are there online with a real time chat for support, yet when
i did that the chat 'person' told me "no
problem at all! we can issue you a credit!"
& i was then led to a page online which
was making me pay $ to get my credit-
did you ever hear of such ridiculous nonsense & immorality!! 
the icing on the cake was when i had a 9.99$
charge on my debit card which i knew i did
not make & it was literally from uber to join
their membership- can you imagine?! to actually think you can take a clients $
without their knowledge or approval!
so, of course i stopped my debit card,
deleted my uber app & immediately got
the lyft app.
i could not be happier!!! every lyft driver has
been above & beyond! 
& if you change a destination or cancel a trip
lyft immediately contacts me asking if i have
any problem or trouble!
& lyft gives me the choice to wait a bit longer for a less expensive ride!
lyft rocks! with lyft i actually feel like they
care!
like i am dealing with humans!
like i am a person & not just a $ sign! 
like i have nothing to worry about!
...just the other night my lyft driver was running late in wpb because of detours
downtown & the driver called me &
called again- the person standing next to
me - a policeman said have faith! i had
commented (bcuz of my jaded experience 
w uber) that would probably no- show...
but waiting together we joked about it
& lo & behold- up the one way street i
was on comes my lyft! 
& the driver was so apologetic!
& so kind!
& without me even mentioning uber- she
commented to me..."i once drove for uber
but, i was just a robot driver- they don't care
about their drivers- only about $ ! & they pay
less & i am now so much more comfortable 
driving..."
well, that says it all!
that is the reason behind the excellent service i have received from lyft- it starts
from the top- if you care about your drivers
& treat people well it trickles down & all
are happy!
riding with lyft is a win-win ride!
...& that's something very very important 
especially in the world we live in today.
lyft is a breath of fresh air!
...a welcome indication that all is not lost
in the world we live in!
...there are still thank god, companies like
lyft with moral integrity & the proof is in
every safe & happy ride you take!
thank you lyft!

review: i had a shared ride and after the first person got out i was only 7 minutes from my destination but the driver said that ride ended on the app and needed the address. he didn't speak english well and kept putting in the address wrong. i thought he finally had it right but after 15 minutes or so i pulled up maps and saw he had driven in the opposite direction. i'm just visiting la and had no idea. i tried saying something but he didn't really understand and i saw there was only 5 minutes left until we arrived at whatever address he put in so i figured i'd just wait it out. we pulled up on a pretty bad area, a homeless alley with broken campers and tents along both sides of the street. i got out and had to carry 3 big bags out of a couple blocks before getting to a safer area. then had a call another lyft. my original ride was 40 minutes with dropping off the other person, my new one was 35 with just me. the entire ordeal took over 2.5 hours and there was no customer service help. i called their emergency line but they said they only deal with urgent emergencies and since i had walked out of the relativity bad area i was on my own. no refund for the first lyft or free ride back. down $60 and 2.5 hours and there is no where to report it in the app and only phone number is for emergencies. can't believe this is legal to not have a customer service line for stuff like this. there's no option in the app to say dropped off further from my spot than when i ordered the ride
title: Left Stranded in a homeless camp and customer service does nothing

review:
lyft used to be a great alternative to getting around los angeles on time. however, it's now just a waste of time even trying to use it to schedule your time. the rides never show up within the allotted window because the app continually changes the driver. yesterday, i waited an hour and a half while drivers would almost reach my pick up point and the app would select a different driver. this happened 8 times causing me to be late to work. this happens every time i schedule a ride. if i don't schedule, the standard ride which is the least expensive always shows limited availability, yet the more expensive lux and higher are always available. you gotta be kidding me? just fyi, the taxis in los angeles are now cheaper than lyft, usually by about $10 per ride and they can be scheduled ahead through the ride yellow app. and they are on time. don't bother with lyft and their inefficient scam anymore. they're just a money grab with no respect for their customers' time.

update: here we go again. i stopped using lyft for a while and this morning decided to give it another go. scheduled a ride for 8:30 am and was notified at 8:20 my driver was 14 minutes away. reasonably inside the service window. then at 8:30 when my driver was 5 minutes away, the starts playing musical driver. now 18 minutes away, 12 minutes away, 21 minutes away, 7 minutes away, 15 minutes away. it's now 8:50 and i'm finally in the car i scheduled for 20 minutes ago two hours ahead of time. lyft is the worst. i'm deleting this app again and won't be adding it back this time.
title: Don't bother scheduling

review: it started out great. i had to make the choice of uber or lyft to get to work and to get to my weekly doctor visits. and being the infamous "broke college student i chose lyft. i had decent drivers most were very respectful and professional. i always got to my destination correctly and efficiently. until i rode my lyft with ronalbeht. the ride was very bumpy and he swerved a lot. i had a yedi cup in between my legs and i of course logically would've put it in a cup holder but it was too bulky so i left it in between my legs. as we were taking the last turn he did it really sharply and the water spilled mostly on my pants and some on the seat. a few hours later i had gotten a damage receipt for $80. $80, which is outrageous for a minor water spill. i have talked to multiple people from lyft and no one is budging. they even sent photos of the supposed "damage" but those photos were of a car that did not look like the same car i rode in. but i'm giving them the benefit of the doubt and saying maybe the car cover seats were black and the original car color is what was shown. but even then i still personally believe that charging me $80 for a water spill is ridiculous. there is no way a car seat is going to take $80 to clean up a water spill. lesson definitely learned. sometimes paying more is better so you can have the luxury of not being scammed. and i do see that many people that were also charged for an untrue or over-exaggerated damage fee. so i am glad i can feel validated that i'm not the only one having this awful issue. i unfortunately will no longer be using this platform.
title: Scammers. Uber is more but Uber at least (as far as I know) does not scam!

review: i have never had any problem with lyft for years until my last ride when my driver decided to work the system to make more money. after he drop us off, to a friend and i, at our destination. i received a lyft notification for a damage fee of $80, right after i rated my driver 5 stars even if he would smoke mariguana at every of our 2 stops and that's because he helped with the luggage and we had a nice conversation. so, i along with the notification of the damage fee they sent me a picture of the alleged damage. it was apparently a minor coffee spill. so i thought it was my co rider and friend who had spilled it, but happened that none of us had any kind of drinks or were carrying any liquids with us. so i thought it was our luggage that was spilling something and i went out to check only to find they it was completely dry. at that point, i concluded it was the driver who spilled the coffee himself in order to be able to charge $80 extra for the ride. his car has left her sits so he made sure he spilled something he could easily clean with a napkin. i let lyft customer service about this, but sadly and they don't believe the customer. they believe the driver and the worse part about lyft is that they can charge you damage fee, even if the driver doesn't let you know about the damage right on the spot. that's a big flaw in the lyft damage claims process, because any driver can drop you off, while parked where hi drops you off cause any damage to his car he may feel convenient and then claim that you did it and lyft takes as evidence any picture tue driver send them even if that doesn't prove that you cause the damage. so next time you take lyft, takes pictures of the inside before and after specially if you see fernando on a black honda accord.
title: $80 charge for a self inflicted damage

review: i cannot stress enough to not use this organization as a whole for scooters or rides. this, simply because there is little to no timely access to real' customer support when something happens. the reality is that every program has issues or problems but it's the customer support that bridges the gap between having a negative or positive experience. a frequently asked question list (faq) hurdle is not a good way to handle this sort of service. an example of why? a scooter has a map identifying areas you cannot take the scooter. what happens if your scooter suddenly identifies as being in a red zone when in fact it is not? you guessed it you get to walk the scooter until it can internally rectify the situation. 10 minutes - 30min of this? 11$ to 20$ for use of the scooter during this unusable time? you guessed it you pay for it. this because as long as you are considered in a blocked zone you are unable to park the scooter during this issue which means the meter keeps running until it's fixed which could potentially cost you (if you simply walk away) 100$s of dollars if you aren't careful. during this entire issue you are attempting to run the faq gambit in an attempt to reach someone to fix the issue before having to pay a bill. nope no phone numbers work, yep a supposed chat support is hidden somewhere but if you aren't savvy or in the know: you won't find it. this is by far the most horrendous group i have ever attempted to deal with. my suggestion: don't ever use these people unless you understand the risks of a situation occurs. they are not customer friendly.
title: Horrendous customer support / Srv use Uber.

review: i received an email about a driver that decided to cancel on me. when he showed up he barely stopped then just sped away. i am going to say it was most likely because i had my 1 year old son and 2 teenage daughters with me. or because it was about a 45 min drive. what bothers me about it is that the email i received said i wasn't wearing my mask properly. i take offense to this because i work a professional job where i need to wear a mask up to 16 hours in a day sometimes and this guy never even address me or bothered to stop. it is not fair that he chose he didn't want to take me and my kids then go on and lie about the situation. the weather is cold outside. i really wish i could've got his information to report him because it wasn't right and i really don't appreciate it and i won't be using lyft anymore. the driver who replaced him was very nice but i didn't see the email until after i got to my destination. if i would've seen it before i wouldn't have used lyft. when i reached out to lyft by email because i couldn't find a number anywhere to call they basically told me they were going to remove what he reported on my account but that i should be aware of the policies in other words saying he was right and i was wrong. i've worked in customer service for over 20 years and that is the first time i have seen without hesitation even after explaining the situation they automatically assumed what the driver said was right. i wasn't getting a free ride and i was with my kids in the cold and got left behind not ok at all!
title: I got left behind with my kids in the cold!

review: the title is fairly self explanatory but basically i was in an uber from the airport at roughly 1-2 in the morning, to go and pick up packages that contained $1,000 worth of holiday presents for my sister. there was to be two stops, one to pick up the packages and the other to my apartment. after picking up the packages my sister called me and said to come to my parents house instead, and so i changed my location in the app, the change was accepted, i saw it on the app, however he said he wouldn't drive me to the new destination because in his words he wouldn't make any money from the ride he told me i had to cancel my ride at two in the morning, hastily handed me my bags from the airport (not handing me my packages) slammed the trunk and drove off before i could realize i didn't have my packages. it was 2 am and i had gotten off a plane, as soon as i realized i reached out to the driver and to lyft as many times as i could, the driver never responded to any of my requests/reward offerings, and lyft has offered the most unhelpful horrible customer service, because they've offered me nothing. not even driver information to make a police report for grand larceny. they claim they're not allowed. i am very curious what they would do if i claimed i had been the target of discrimination, or sexual harassment, or if i had a viral video on instagram or tiktok that people were sharing. basically lyft will only help their customers if their backs are pressed against the wall, and i wouldn't recommend this app to my worst enemy. i'm not ubers biggest fan but i'll never drive lyft again after they've allowed me to be robbed to the tune of $1,000 dollars
title: Driver stole $1,000 from me after kicking me out of his car.

review:
i had 2 of the worst experiences. you have to constantly ask the drivers to put their air conditioner on when the heat is over 95 degrees. i was grocery shopping and called lyft. first driver came and i opened the door and he yelled about groceries in his car. then kept on shouting. very poor customer service. i had my child with me and she seen he was very rude and disrespectful. i then started to take my groceries out. shut the door and cancelled the ride. i called another. this ignorant young man came with his windows rolled down (i requested in the note to please have your air conditioner on. it's very hot outside and i have cold items.) and when i walked up to the car started yelling you have groceries. no no. i am not putting groceries in my car. it's not even my car. it's a lyft car. i have to pay $200 to $300 to get it cleaned. i'm going to cancel and order you another. i didn't have to hear his excuses and financial worries. this is pathetic service.  i advised him we have been waiting for a long time. i had no groceries that were leaking or spilling. me and my child had since moved closer to the car while he was yelling. customers and employees were watching. then we noticed he smelled like marijuana. i wondered why he was yelling and talking so fast almost to the point of being incoherent. he rudely drove off. if this is the service customers are going to expect in the hot summer and if your shopping i would not recommend this service. these drivers seem to think they can be as rude and disrespectful to customers. drive while under the influence of an illegal narcotic while servicing guest with a lyft's car. there are taxi services and uber. they damage your companies name and reputation. what made it worst was the store we were shopping in closed. so me and my child were stuck outside in the heat with perishable groceries. we were blessed a manager was watching us the whole time during both lyft drivers rude behavior and told us to come inside because it was very hot and there were a dozen or so unquestionable people lurking at the entrance. they both left us in bad situations but the second was worst because he was high and under the influence from illegal narcotics. they should not drive in the summer if they are concerned about gas. they should not pick guest up from a grocery store if they do not want groceries in their cars. they should never yell at a guest or pick up a guest if they are high on illegal drugs. extremely disappointed lyft.

i have had several very horrific lyft trips with ignorant and rude drivers that's why i don't really use your service. especially since none of those drivers were ever reprimanded due to their ignorance, negligence. some were under the influence of an illegal narcotic. how do i know this. the marijuana smell was so strong once we sat inside. since we had to get home due to having to call 3 times because of the first 2 drivers ignorant and unprofessional behavior and vulgar language and as i stated one was under the influence and the marijuana smell was so strong we could smell it even thought we were several feet from his vehicle. and over this past year and a half your prices have become discouraging, ridiculous and outrageous. you can even call the fares criminal during the past few months. uber is even worse. taking advantage of american consumers when many of us have been inflicted harshly from the spread of covid-19 and the financial devastation we have experience from the negative and harmful impact it has caused our economy. i truly hope your upper management, administration offices and ceo thoroughly read and understand this comment. and make these next two request of the highest priority. please, severely improve your fares, passenger safety and satisfaction and improve your guidelines of your drivers making customer safety and professional treatment number 1. you many contact me.

review: on new year's 2022, wife and i took a ride back from dinner at a steakhouse in vegas. it was a 11 minute ride but a 3 weeks ordeal to resolve a driver's claim that we damaged his car with paint and some other old stain underneath the mat behind the passenger side where i was sitting. i was shock to see a damage charge of $80 on my card. i immediately tried to find ways to get in touch with lyft customer service. only way is by chat. but to get to chat, one would need to answer few questions. the option for me was to resolve a damage charge but this does not lead to customer service. it just leads to a explanation why there was a charge. so i had to choose other random choices before being able to chat with an agent. first agent told to wait a minute, but ended up to more about 10 mins, that he will be back to assist. i understand if their are other customers in front of me but let me know. anyways, after i told the agent what happened, i was told that they can not help me and that it was my fault because the driver sent them the picture after my ride. i told them that how can i prove something we did not do. it was frustrating that they didn't believe me. they sent me an image of what the driver sent. the damage looked like an old stain and also it has yellow and red paint like stain. the ride was from 9:33 pm to 9:45 pm. who carried paint with them to a nice steakhouse?! if the lyft customer service agent reviewed the image more carefully, he would realize the stain is underneath the floor mat because the mat was moved to the side. i told him if i can speak to his manager, but he insisted that the manager agreed with the decision that we caused the damage. few days later, after not being to think about anything else but this fraud, i chatted with another agent. i told him what had happened and he agreed that this damage could not have been caused by us. the damage fee charge will be credited back in account. unfortunately, it was not and i forgot about it until today. i spoke to a third agent, told him what happened and he had to do more research and stated that the credit was not processed and he apologized for the inconvenience. but so far i noticed an immediate ride refund but not the $80 damage charge fee. i quickly got back to the chat and he said it will be in 3-5 days. i've heard this before. let's see if this happens. but the way the lyft agents communicate really is upsetting. the way they respond and the lack of carefully reading the questions and comments i made me feel like they just wanted to move on as quickly as they can because there is not way to hold these agents accountable for their poor understanding of the customers' situation. i can not trust lyft drivers and especially lyft employees and will be doing business with them.

review:
1. i had a scheduled ride for 2:55-3:05pm pickup. a driver arrived at 2:45pm. i texted him that i could get to the pickup spot in 2 minutes (even though he was super early). he immediately wrote me as a no-show, despite him being super early. this canceled my scheduled ride! why didn't they match me with a new driver? the reason i schedule the ride ahead of time is i am in a time crunch and don't have time at 2:50 to be inputting addresses. yet that is what i had to do because the driver canceled before the pickup time and the lyft system decided i didn't need a ride after all. i tried to contact lyft support but i am only allowed to complain if i got charged money or if i am currently in a ride. i resent that my paying for lyft pink covers for that driver being terrible and for the system not getting me a new ride at all. 

2. why am i not allowed to have pronouns? i have gone to that part of the app to add my pronouns and all it does is explain what pronouns are and to add them if i want but the rest is blank! my husband is able to add his pronouns on his account t but i can't. i went to the account section of the help area and it only answers questions about profile name and picture. 

also, the app will tell me only a minute or two before pickup that my driver will be on the other side of the street. not helpful because i am not planning to jay walk and walking down the street to cross and then back down the street to the pickup location (which it no longer is since it's the wrong side of the street) will take longer than the driver doing a u-turn, so thanks for that inconvenience. 

nowhere to go but the app store to make my complaints known.
title: Pronouns and canceled rides

review: i love driving but lyft itself has been a roller coaster experience as far as bonuses and tiers go. they will rate you based on only the bad never the good! for instance you could have 10  trips that you've driven and you deny one or maybe even two after those 10 trips & lyft rips your tier away! they never rate you fairly for all the good that you do! lyft seriously needs to redo this whole app! as a driver that loves what i do, this app is beginning to make me start to hate it, and that for me is depressing because i love meeting new people, making good conversations and just driving in general but i rather stick around in my city which we do not have the option to do. lyft has no call center so you can't reach anyone unless it's through the app. there is soooooo many things that i've learned about this app that i would've never expected, i was a cab driver before switching to lyft so this is nothing new to me outside of the app. i just wish someone would actually take the time out to come to each city and meet with us drivers to hear our thoughts and what we need so we can be better together!!!!! it doesn't make any since that if your acceptance rate falls below 95% your tier is snatched away! this app makes everything so unrealistic it's not even funny especially for the pay! how is it that lyft gets the bigger cut *don't say you don't because customers have even gone the extra mile with me to do the math on whats taken!* for literally doing nothing!? built an app just to basically blind rob people at this point. if the so called ceos would step up & fix their business maybe just maybe this app could be the best rideshare app! but it's not! at least uber knows how to properly treat their drivers
title: THIS COMPANY TREATS THE DRIVERS UNFAIRLY UNFORTUNATELY

review: lyft does not care about riders or fair comments. i shared all this with the lyft customer service and supervisor through the chat. nobody cared or did anything. they charged me in full for an unsafe ride with a driver that made me very uncomfortable. the driver wanted to complain about lyft and uses riders as a therapist. he was saying how he gets only $3 out of a $10 ride. i did not want to talk to him so i pretended i was on a call. i was concerned that he would get mad if i didn't listen to him. he thought i was finished with my call and i told him i'm on a call. then he so rudely raised his hand and sighted out of frustration simply because i did not want to talk to him! he also was not wearing his mask properly at all. his mask was only covering his mouth and when he was talking he brought his mask down to his neck. when i politely brought it up, he showed me his vaccination card instead of fixing his mask! then he me trader joe's told him he doesn't need to wear a mask anymore! i asked him what lyft told him. after an unsafe and harassing ride, he dared to leave an unfair comment that doesn't even make sense. i asked lyft to remove the unfair comment as he left that comment only because i refused to engage in talking to him and because i mentioned his mask. lyft did nothing! wow! what an utterly irresponsible company you just proved to be lyft! you let your drivers make women feel uncomfortable, bully them further with unfair comments and not remove the comment? all because they did not want to play therapist to your drivers? and because a rider politely points to the fact that lyft requires mask? or refund the unsafe and harassing ride? lyft clearly can't be trusted. the driver dared to say that i should be a good rider. haha. clearly his definition of a good rider is to let him cross boundaries and force you into a conversation you don't want to have playing therapist. his utter lack of emotional, mental and social intelligence only exceeds by lyft's lack of care for riders for a safe drive and nonsensical policies where any clown can leave any unfair comments they want. i give both lyft and the driver to god. he will deal with you.
title: Lyft Allowed Harassment & Won't Remove Unfair Comment

review:
i live in a capitol city on the us, but it is small. i have learned that i can't request a ride the same day i need it because there aren't necessarily enough drivers on any given day. (i missed a job interview for this reason, but thankfully my now employer was understanding.) i schedule rides in advance, which can cost up to double what i would be charged if i requested a ride about an hour before i want one. i tell myself that it's alright to pay a premium when i am ordering a human to arrive at my location right when i want. but the app doesn't actually do that. drivers often arrive 15+ minutes before the arrival window and i end up leaving in a panic. (riders must be ready within a certain time window after the driver arrives. failure to do so can result in not only a missed ride but consequences on one's account as well.) 

in this city, the lyft model is not working. i'm sure these issues don't come up in larger cities, but certainly if the company/decision makers wanted to, they could do better. it's a very poor reflection on what is advertised as a service that provides rides on demand. 

i would prefer to contact customer service, but i couldn't find a way to provide policy feedback other than this. 

at the very least, lyft could make these possibilities more clear to riders. i've had the system explained by multiple drivers, otherwise i would have a hard time piecing together the issue. 

unfortunately our mass transit system isn't robust. but at least city buses are required to stay at their scheduled stops if they happen to arrive 10 minutes early.

review:
if/when there's an issue getting a driver for a scheduled ride, lyft doesn't offer customer service. no hotline, chat, nothing.
it costs about $5-10 more for a lyft scheduled in advanceeven when it arrives 40 min late. and it turns out lyft doesn't actually arrange the pre-scheduled ride more than 10 min in advance. that might be fine if you happen to live in an area with plenty of drivers, but i don't.
by the time lyft found me a driver for my ride to work earlier today, the app said the driver was 25 min away. if that had been accurate and there was no local traffic, i would've only just gotten there on time.
it was not accurate. the app eventually found me a closer driver, but they were having connectivity issues; the car froze on the map 2 or 3 min away. i was assigned a third driver, who did show up eventuallywithout a mask over his nose. (i've had other drivers who just wear face shields, which are significantly less effective than masks.) i would've canceled the ride and started a new one, but there would've been even less of a guarantee for that to pan out.
so i was 30 min late for a job where i'm new enough to still be in a probationary periodand charged by lyft what i had agreed to pay if the ride had been on time. no word from my supervisors yet on whether i'm in trouble.
previously, i'd scheduled another ride to work, and the driver justnever showed. not even a notification that they'd found me a driver, but at least i had enough time to cancel and get a new one (who happened to be nearby just out of luck).
i kept using lyft occasionally to get to work because public transit will take an additional 50 minutes. but it'll be worth it to be on time for my job, assuming i haven't already been fired.

review: i booked a lyft ride for monday , august 15, 2022. the arrival time was between 3:10 am and 3:20 am . at 3:30 i was informed a driver was being assigned for my pickup and be arriving in 25 minutes.because of the delay, i had to rebook my transportation to atlanta airport. this was very unprofessional and i will be filing a complaint with the bbb. however, the driver that i did get was present and got to my destination at 4:00 am.
title: Unprofessional

review:
the only reason i gave 3 stars is that i used to have good experiences riding with lyft.

recently, i've had drivers with dirty and smelly cars and even cars that seemed wrecked, picking me up when i pay for the preferred option.

the thing that made me finally decide to delete the lyft app is i was overcharged today. i selected the same destination i always chose. the system estimated around $24 for the preferred option. i selected the preferred, and a few minutes later, a driver showed up (the car was extremely dirty on the inside, by the way). after dropping me off (very smooth and quick trip), the app charges me $35.95 plus the fuel surcharge of $0.55. when i try to get help with the overcharge, the app and the website take me to the same place where it says:
this ride doesn't qualify for a refund or ride credit. it looks like the pickup, drop-off, and total price of this ride were all correct.

anyways, long story short, bye-bye lyft.
title: Stealing my money!!??

review:
i was under the impression lyft was better than uber. but to each their own.
i was out of town visiting in baltimore. needing a ride i use lyft. i scheduled a lyft for 9:05 am in which the driver came early and she called. i informed her she was early but i was headed down from my room. as i'm trying gathering my things she continue to talk. as i get to the elevator i get a text stating sorry you missed your lyft.and was charged! i attempt to request another lyft twice and was declined. so i close the app and reopened which took maybe 3 seconds. the original lyft went from $28.** to $48.** which ended up being successful !! to later find out the 2 decline charges had processed. so being there was no one for me to call or reach out to discuss this matter i had no choice but to write a review in hopes to receive my funds back of $20.17 and $27.86.
title: First and LAST!

review: driver was asking a bunch of personal questions that was very inappropriate! now lyft just tried to take 60.00 out of my account for i don't know what? my ride was 9.00 and some change'
title: Creepy Driver

review: this app is terrible ride prices change every 5 secs literally 5 secs, my scheduled rides continuously get canceled, the app shuts down and logs me out this app is terrible period.
title: F*** Lyft!

review: there is no way that lyft's prices in louisiana should be so high. i downloaded lyft in hopes of having better luck instead of with uber, but uber is cheaper. i use rideshare to get back & forth to work bc i don't drive at the moment. a 15 minute ride from my home to work with lyft is $95-115, why??????? uber is $26. theres absolutely no reason for lyft's prices to be so high! when most of your customers are people who do not have transportation, can't afford transportation, or don't have anyone reliable to help them get back & forth. it is not fair & yall should really do something about it.
title: Price GAUGING

review: lyft is a complete circus , $60 to go 2 miles is outrageous and a scam !!! yellow cab was 13.45
title: What a joke !

review:
lyft markets'itself as safe and affordable.

charged me $70.00 for a ride share, which was ok, but then allowed a non-masked passenger to ride with us. 

i'm young so i don't mind to much but i love with elder people and their health is something i watch out for. 

needless to say they don't seem to care and i'm very disappointed they put $$$ over our safety
title: Put my health at risk to save $$$

review:
the community pass that i've used for years used to be $5 per month with free unlock and .5cents per min. now it's .50cents to unlock and .15cent per min. 

i don't know when this changed as i was never notified or asked to agree to these new terms. i feel that this was a sneaky way to make me pay more money!

i clicked on a promotion in the app for $5.99 flat 30 day pass which allowed me to use it once but then went back to the community rate. i've tried to get them to fix this glitch with no avail. now i'm being told the flat rate program isn't available with no further explanation but it shows as active in the app. they are refusing to issue me a refund for the $5.99 30 day pass but instead give me instructions on how to cancel so it doesn't auto renew however there is no option to cancel because this program does not auto renew. 

i have contacted my credit card company and will be declining all pending and reversing all recent charges.
title: Scooter - Community Program

review: i ordered a ride and the dumb driver let the time elapsed and left. lyft took $56.87 and did not refund my card despite me not even receiving a ride.

review:
when i tried to set up a ride back home, from my eye doctor, (l18426 brookhurst st fountain valley to 5101 tortuga dr.) i kept getting an error message and was left stranded and had to call yellow cab, costing me $40 one way, to get home.  no emergency phone number so a live operator could send a driver to take me home.

i must arrive at my appointments on time.  your app does not guarantee a ride that will get me there on time, because there is no way to reserve a ride in advance, say the day before.

all rides are one way because most of my appointments take an indefinite amount of time.  i need to get back home aftwards, but if your crappy software isn't working you leave me stranded.  no phone number to tell a live operator to take me back home.

your service is unreliable and i will not use it again unless the problems i have stated herein can be resolved.
title: Crappy software.  No rmergency phone.

review: my ride took 35 minutes to arrive. when i chose the ride in the app, the app stated fastest. this was by far not the fastest. there were other lyfts that came to the airport a number of times before my lyft ever showed up. at this point i think i'm just going to switch to uber because i run into this problem too much.however, the driver was really nice and very friendly.

review:
i wanted to say thank you to the drivers are lift and the company for being so kind to me and my dogs. today it's very hard to get a ride with dogs and i really appreciate the kindness & zero negative comments when the drivers arrive. your so appreciated.please know this, and thank you for being here for us during this continuing pandemic .
sincerely kim wilson
title: Thank you to the drivers of lift

review: i ordered a wait & save lyft ride for around $15, latest pickup time was supposed to be 5:24pm. i waited until 5:55 for my driver to show up after watching him sit in the same spot for almost half an hour 8 minutes down the street, ignoring my texts and calls. when he finally showed up, he was sniffing, clearing his throat, grinding his jaw, and seemed overly energetic. i strongly believe he was snorting cocaine for that half hour he was parked. additionally, lyft charged me $19.85 for this ride that i waited over an hour total for, and will not even send so much as a confirmation email when i try to contact them to at least get the money they overcharged back. i should not have to pay extra to wait longer than the latest specified time, so i'm disputing the charge with my bank and contacting the bbb since lyft doesn't want to provide any customer service and steal my money. i'll also be deleting my account.
title: Driver was high on cocaine, half an hour late, and I was overcharged

review: i was quoted one price then charged 20.00 more.  submitted issue form awaiting response.

review: this app just got erased off my phone. first, it's surging for 4 mile distances over $60. so i wait u til it is 10.89, norma rate. get it and book it? tell guy listen need to go to the store first. he tells me i gotta do it in the app but i don't know where one is and my ph is dying. he of course offers a charger but doesn't have an iphone charger. i finally get to update the stop and he wont pull over, he wants to continue to original direction. so after i update and pay more, once i get to wawa, he cancels the stop. stop is now 10.00. lyft hits my account for 10.89 and 10.00. it surged so bad just to finish an addition 2 miles was $33 and rising. lyft said they would credit after i booked but no way! that's way to high. my friend had to get me an uber which was only $8. lyft still has both amounts taken on my card and i got left at the wawa. i reported the driver but my money is still gone. lyft didn't care at all about my safety, nor the fact the drivers do whatever. uber is much better addressing driver difficulties

review: i had a hard time finding a lyft cab service today to my work place. i'm using lyft for past 4 years. today while booking the cab it took about 10 mins for the lyft app to connect me with a driver. my lyft driver was like 15 mins away while on his way to pick me up. then when he was just 3 mins away, his location remained stuck at point for the next 10-15 mins, surprisingly still indicating he was 3 mins away. i tried reaching out to the driver through call and text, but received no reply. later, he canceled the ride. then i got automatically connected to a new driver who was again 16 mins away. thus, for about 40 mins i just stood at the pick up spot waiting for the cab. needless to say, i even missed my office meeting. also, i was overcharged. while booking the ride, i selected the option that showed me the price $30. but, after confirming pickup, it charged me $32.84. my time and money both were wasted. moreover, i'm a member of lyft pink services and yet i have to go through such experience. i'm giving 1 star rating based on above experience. i hope lyft considers this.

i used to use lyft 4+times a week for work. i now use it maybe once a month.

first, the prices have skyrocketed. my work is 3.5 miles from my house and they have the gall to try and charge $27.99. it used to be $8.99 for each ride. 

second, scheduling rides in advance doesn't work at all, the divers just cancel on you after making you wait 10+ minutes for each driver. 

and thirdly, there aren't ever any drivers in portland (where i live). i looked on every option for a ride.. there 1 lyft car within 15 miles of the city.

review: the most i have caught lyft taking from the fair was 77%. 77%!!!! while they sit lazily in a nice safe and cooled office space we slave away in the heat, with sometimes crazy/weird/dangerous passengers and the horrible traffic and lyft is taking more than 50%. absolutely ridiculous. they sent me on a ride 20 minutes away that was 10 mins long and they only paid me $5. after gas and taxes i made $1 in those 30 minutes. fantastic. uber is way better!! more business, better bonuses, consistent bonuses and a better filter system. lyft has treated a long and loyal driver like poop so i'll be driving for uber primarily from now on.

title: Amazing driver!

review: the driver tynan out of the boston to brockton areas is a scam artist. my phone was having trouble updating my ride and he told my fianc that it was no trouble whatsoever and to not worry about it. he would email lyft, and it was no trouble, these things happen. well, boy did he ever. he told them he drove him over 32 miles and the ride was one hour and twenty minutes long, and we were charged a few dollars shy of $70!!!!!!! even the only destination was maximum, if going the long route 9 miles but usually about 7 miles, as we take this route for work at minimum five days a week and sometimes up to seven days with overtime. also, we both have used lyft to take this exact route on at least ten different occasions, and the maximum we have ever been charged was approximately 19 to 24 dollars. then lyft itself is also are scam artists. as i told them to check the gps and they would see where and what time he entered tynan's vehicle and where and what time he exited tynan's vehicle. and to also look at the supposed gps coordinates the driver, tynan put in the enail to lyft, as they were beyond ridiculous, they were laughable. any reputable representative for the company would have seen that the claim he made, that he drove my fiance from our home and then supposedly dropped him off in the next town over, a destination about two to three miles maximum from the pick up location, and a maximum ride of 12 minutes, but it somehow had him drive about 33 miles, and one hour and twenty minutes, in a massive circle. and also, i followed the ride on my phone, as we both always do for one another and i watched as it traveled from our home in boston to the drop off in boston. the ride never left the city of boston. yet again, tynan the driver claimed he drove from our home to the complete opposite side of boston and then back through other cities and towns on the highway just to come back to the town, dedham, which is next to our side of boston. it it very easy to resolve this issue but since lyft ia obviously scam artists they have refused to even check anything or work out with me. especially at a time like thie, when every penny counts they do not care. they will scqm you out of everything if they can. i am filing a complaint with the better business bureau and the attorney generals office.
title: SCAM ARTISTS

review:
great app and great company. could use some work on customer support and corporate contact info. 
i had pre-ordered a late night lyft out of mke airport. my flight departure from newark was running an hour late, so i wanted to adjust my pickup time with lyft.
 i could find no links or helpful help options. i learned how to adjust the time from a youtube video, posted by another lyft rider. it involved cancelling my original ride and creating a second reservation with the new time. this seems inefficient, and wrong for the first driver, who might have adjusted his schedule to provide the ride and might have expected the income from it.
title: Good app. Needs some customer support options

review:
i scheduled a lyft to the airport the night before my flight. jeff was coming to pick me up between 12:15 and 12:30. i sent a message telling him i would not be ready until closer to 12:30pm. he did not respond. several minutes later i called him and he acknowledged. 
i saw he arrived and opened my front door. my small dog ran out into the yard, which should signal i am coming out. i was walking slowly as i just had major surgery. i had my two rolling suitcases ready at the door as i see him leave! 
on top of that, i couldn't call or text him any longer, per lyft systems. i rescheduled and was blessed to get raj, who is amazing! however, i am charged $10.55 for him abandoning me!!! that's absurd.
title: My car left while I was walking out the doorway!

review: lyft says they care for your safety but when you complain that your driver had an extra passenger they tell you that your fee is nonrefundable.they will also schedule and confirm rides and charge you for them at a higher rate than if you booked them at the time you're scheduling. theydan look for a driver at that time you need. that's not scheduling that's it's store soon

review: this app has been giving me issues for months. i bought a $60 lyft gift card for myself for a trip to fund my lyft ride, and the lyft credit got added to my account. i added a credit card as well as it is also needed to order a lyft. i then proceeded to order a lyft and was told i don't have a valid credit card. i have now added all of my current credit cards bank accounts and debit cards to the app trying to get one of them to be valid. the app won't let me order. i tried talking to support and they said they would send this issue to the party needed to fix the issue, and that i'd get an email- this was in november 2021. i've checked in a few times since then and am getting the same answerand now it is may 2022 that i'm writing this review.  not once have i received an email. the issue is still unresolved they won't refund me and they won't let me order a lyft. i am so frustrated. why is it that i can use the same credit cards on uber no problem but on lyft it is  invalid- and why won't they help me!  feeling very frustrated as you can imagine. i've logged out and back in, deleted the app and redownloaded nothing has helped yet.
title: Won't let me order a ride

title: App needs to go on a diet

review:
lyfts help section is horrible. you can't actually report a problem or get anything resolved. you're given a few preselected options to click on which is nothing but survey to find out if issues are resolved. how can issues be resolved without telling them what happened.
i had 1 ride very late at night & driver was angry or annoyed at having a late night rider. he drove like a maniac with his stereo literally at full volume & threw me around back seat because he didn't wait for me to get seatbelt on. it's difficult to report those things with their complaint/report issues set up isn't provided and no customer service number. note: that never happened before or after that. drivers are typically very kind.
today i was charged $9.99 & again charged but that time it was $12.99 & i can't report it or get ahold of anyone. i loathe thieves! i'm an excellent tipper & always personable kind & pleasant.  if i'm running into a quick mart on round trip ride, i always tell the driver if they need anything to please come in with me and do their little shopping and tell them i'd be happy to wait until they're done getting coffee or lunch or anything else. 
i feel like my kindness and generosity is rewarded with over charging me for a 7min 1/4mile round trip!! 
i think lyft has better drivers and are safer and a bit less expensive then uber but i'm very disappointed by what they did and how they make it impossible to get money back and, how they make it impossible report a dangerous driver that i had to pay a lot for due to off hours. i had to pay to get terrorized! i was a nervous wreck for many many hours after that dangerous ride.
if lyft would have it set up with some basic questions to choose from along with a section to write what you need help with or what you need to report, maybe people wouldn't get so frustrated. i know for a fact that many customers feel exactly like i do.
maybe they will change some things in order to ensure customer satisfaction 
thank you

review:
my mom is a loyal customer and spends over 100$ every week on their services. few days ago, my mom dropped her brand new cell phone in a lyft driver named rashud from the bronx's car. we still haven't received any help from lyft or this driver. we tracked the phone and it's clearly in his car. they said they've reached out to the driver and he hasn't responded. i got this response from lyft at 2am in the morning. who will respond at that time? it's been almost a week of this driver not responding.

 i couldn't even log into her account to contact this driver because they keep sending a 2fa code to the phone that's in his car!!! we've been trying to get help from lyft and they are more than useless!! they don't even try to care and just sends us generic templated emails that they send to everyone. i'm so freaking upset my lost mom lost her phone bc this person is not responding. seems like lyft is hiring any and everyone to use their services even thieves!!!
title: WILL NEVER USE LYFT EVER AGAIN

review:
the first driver i requested today did not show up. i waited for him. i stood there in the cold with my 94-year-old mother and the car did not arrive. i went down the line and looked at every car license plate and i did not see the one that was supposed to be for me. then i was charged five dollars for his inconvenience.it was my inconvenience and you should pay me five dollars.
since i had already been charged for the ride it seemed like i had to continue on with my lyft request. in the future i will ride uber.

review: i arrived at lax and got directions to the pickup area for taxis, uber and lyft. it was a short walk from southwest airlines baggage claim. when i got the lyft area: 30-a, i requested a ride to my hotel.the app earned me not to keep my driver waiting. that message should not be given to people that are already at 30-a. then it gives me navigation help to get to the area i'm already at. but lift already knows my exact location. there is a place for me to click i am at the pick up location. but that line was grayed out and unresponsive. was lyft going to wait for me to get to 30-a? to be courteous, i waited until i was that 30-a  before calling a driver. did i need to tell lyft that i had arrived at area 30-a?  i could not tell. it took another five minutes while lyft was searching for a driver. finally lyft assigned me jason in a red car who is three minutes away. i message him that i was waiting at the very end under the 30-a sign. two minutes later lyft assigned me jeff in a black car who was another five minutes away. so i message him my location. at least the ride went smoothly after that.

title: Service

review:
lyft was a good service until my lyft account was hacked and over 15 fraudulent ride was charged to my account, by someone in california, i live in md.

 i immediately calls lyft customer service line and spoke to an individual who told me that their was nothing that he could do considering the charges were still pending in my account, so they had no record of the charges in their system.

so i immediately closed and deleted the account and dealt with the fraudulent charges through my bank. it took over two weeks to get my money back & account back to normal. 
it is now a month later, and i just received four more charges to my bank account, although i closed the lyft account over a month ago. 

and one u close the lyft account it's impossible to get in contact with someone at lyft. now i have to delete my bank card and start fresh thanks to lyft.  please take my advice and be very careful about the services that you attach to your accounts.
title: Account Hackers

title: Over charged

review:
hello,

as a faithful customer of lyft of many  years, always preferring it over uber and other competitors, i amsad to have to report one very very bad experience i had with your company about a month ago.

on 4 january 2022 i ordered lyft services to take me from my house in chicago to the o'hare airport. it was cold, windy night, but i had some extra time so i chose the least expensive option of waiting up to a half an hour. the order was received and i would get an update or two or three about the car being barely minutes away.
however no car no driver arrived for almost an hour.
i was traveling overseas for my mothers funeral, so you understand that i was not amused, nor ready to take any chances of missing my flight.

i would like to know, briefly and to the point please what a reputable company like yours that is fighting for bigger and bigger market share every day is ready to do for me to at least partially compensate me for this experience. 

thanks 

wojciech (voytek) stremel
773-251-4416
title: One seriously BAD experience

the pick up was from 2048 yarmouth c and the drop of was delta terminal in pbi (paim beach international airport). the charge was $48.91 including tip.  i specifically told the driver to please take my brother to the delta terminal in palm beach airport. the driver called me and told me that he was at a private airport and only private planes are there.

i told him that he was to drop my brother at the delta terminal in palm beach airport. it was not my fault that the trip took longer because he went to the wrong airport. please adjust the charges back to the original charge of $48.91 before i call my credit card.

thank you,
delia gallant

title: Complaint.

review: i think the entire idea of lyft is absolutely brilliant! being able to request a ride at the drop of a dime is so convenient, and has come in clutch for myself more times than i can count! the only thing i can say that i don't agree with is the way you all put a hold on my money for rides that i never had. for example last night (the roads here are icy so there wasn't alot of drivers out) i tried to get my daughter a lyft. i tried a few different times (with no prevail) but was unable to get one. but lyft still put a hold on my card for the 25$. also.... her boyfriend tried himself after it didn't work for me after several attempts, and he was able to schedule one with no problems and they picked my daughter up in like 10 mins. so i didn't understand why mine wouldn't work? my only other suggestion would be that the drivers ask their riders what they want to listen to on the radio... because sometimes the drivers are listening to certain podcast and channels that can be offensive to their riders, so maybe just ask because it can make the ride awkward.but for the most part i do appreciate lyft and all the convenience of it!

review: every car ride i have ever requested when utilizing lyft has always resulted in genuine, down-to-earth people that made the car rides more than comfortable. each and every ride treat i have had, including the one tonight (01/29/2022 at 1:30am mst) has been quick and safe. lyft drivers take the best routes, adjust according to real-time scenarios and always make me feel safe and get me to where i need to go safely, quickly and do it all with a friendly smile, conversation and great music. i would recommend using the lyft service to each, every and any of my friends for those reasons alone. once recommended and utilized, my friends have always used the lyft services again and again for the awesome, low and reasonable prices. i would not recommend any other service for getting around town. i feel confident saying that lyft has a happy, grateful and loyal customer in me. thank you for everything you have made possible for me, lyft! i really appreciate it!!! :)

review: i've used lyft two times before my third time today. all three times was from my mechanic to home which is 1.5 miles away. exactly the same each time. the first two times i paid no money than $15.00 which included a 20% tip. today being the third time using them i was charged $32.87 by lyft. i asked the driver what my charge was today and he said $13.00. i tipped him in cash 20% as usual. after many back and forth texts and lyft saying its reviewing this i just received a message a few minutes ago saying they are still charging me 3 times the true amount. i took a regular cab back to my mechanic to pick up my car and was charged $7.50 for the same ride. i've requested a phone number but it seems they can't be reached by phone. i will never use lyft again and i wish tell everyone i can it's cheaper to use a regular cab. lyft should be ashamed of themselves for what they charged a disabled senior citizen.

title: over charging

review: i set up my lyft account and registered my debit/credit card (it was a temporary one you buy at the store), prior to going to work monday. the promo code for new customers  was not working and i was unable to get my discount that i was told all new customers were eligible for. i've sent emails regarding this and was advised to keep trying promo codes until one works, more or less. so that sucked as a first time customer. secondly, i was at work, just finishing my 8 hour shift (that requires me to be on my feet the whole time), i ordered the lyft for my ride home, again i set up my account in advance, right after i sent for the lyft to pick me up,  and it required a copy of my drivers license. i did not have this with me because i was at work and i leave it home so i don't lose it. unfortunately, i was unable to use lyft and was stranded at work for an extra hour. to wait for my coworker to get done. i was never asked for a copy of my id while setting up my account and lyft did not require i scan it to them until after i placed my order for a lyft.  i was stuck at work for an hour or more so i could wait for my co worker to get done and share an uber with her. which i had to pay her back because i already put my credit card in the lyft system, i could not remove it and change to uber, who was much more proficient.
title: Bad first impression

review:
one complaint and it is major. the gps is often wrong. first off, the driver is led to our back locked parking lot instead of the front door where we wait and has the actual address. second gps complaint. often the wrong destination is listed and the driver doesn't usually listen. the other day i waited fo the taxi but the site kept changing the address i was standing at. had to walk a ways to match phone!  the thing i hate most about lyft is the lack of ability to make a call to the main office and talk to a human when i have an issue, problem or even compliment i wish to share!!! thank you. plan to continue to only use lyft!

12/30/21.  error made by lyft.  charge was a certain amount and due to their error i was charged almost double and not a thing i could do about it!!!!
title: Nice drivers, clean cars. Safe!

review: my wife and i scheduled a pickup at lax about 5:30pm on a cold 12/28/21. a driver named karapet (lic 8mqt) took the call for pickup at 31a. after a 45 min delay, during which i messaged him 3 times getting no response,   he showed up, but it was to pick up another party.  then, suddenly, the lyft app changed drivers. the new guy, mike ( 7hst) claimed he was to pick us up at 21a. my app showed 31a. he said he has to drive around the block to get to 31a and it will take 15 min. i believe karapet and mike were playing the system in a way i've heard is common at lax. karapet took the call to clear it from the system, but he didn't want to drive us because the trip was too short. he kept us waiting in the cold until a longer trip showed up for him. when one showed up after 45 min, he took that trip and handed us off to mike. although mike drove us home ok, i refuse to tip or give 5 stars for this discourteous, disrespectful, exploitive behavior. next time, we take uber.
title: Bad Hand-Off Pickup  Lyft Drivers Playing The System

review:
to whom it may concern:
the lyft driver picked me up from louis armstrong airport on december 28, 2021. he was very helpful, very polite, very professional. i appreciated how he conducted himself as a professional driver. of course we need more drivers like him that are working for lyft. no doubt that he is a five star driver and deserves all of his five star ratings. he was an amazing human being and obviously he takes pride in his job being a professional driver. respectfully,
conrad peleras

title: Russian DC friends // visitors// rush to airport

review:
part of me doesn't truly know where to begin with this review. part of me wishes lyft could do a more thoughtful and caring way to help with their customer support. unfortunately, it's a shame lyft's customer support is not only in a desperate need of a revamp of sorts, but how unobtainable they truly can be. 

so i had decided to purchase a $60 gift card for lyft, i hadn't used it in a while, and it was a treat to myself (amazon egift card from my boss, and used some on the lyft gift card. i applied it to my account, and all seemed to be okay.

up until the same error messages kept coming up, saying, sorry, there was a payment issue with your payment info, and it wanted me to add a new card with the same billing address as the card that is on file has.

not only have i attempted to do this process, but there are only 3 cards that i and have added to my account and for some reason, lyft's terrible and awful application seems to think that i entered my address in correctly. i've lived in nyc for 10 years, i'm pretty sure if uber isn't having these issues, then you should either, and something likes this need to be brought up and addressed immediately. 

customer service is an absolute joke. especially when my account is locked and it seems that i have a lingering $60 gift card balance, that i can't even use because of these errors. 

it's nice to see from reading other reviews that i'm not alone in this issue. but thankfully, i dug up the courage to write this very long review, and i can only help for changes to occur within lyft's team and customer support.
title: A honest true review of Lyft.

review:
since i don't drive, i typically use uber. i started using lyft since it gives me points for delta. 

today, it was pouring rain as the driver dropped me off. a little bit of water got into the cars door and where you step off. this happens to every car during the rain. i was charged $30 because i opened the door at the end of my ride while it was raining. 

what was i supposed to do, lyft? wait until it stopped raining to come out? ridiculous. careful out there friends, these companies are willing to take your money without logic.
title: Charge $30 Damage for opening the door when raining

review:
took a 20 minute trip and got to my destination, 20 minutes pass and i get a poorly worded text from the support in the app saying the driver claims i caused damage and they are charging me $80!! didn't even ask, just ran my credit card. 

i emailed lyft support and within 20 minutes i got a reply back saying how they looked into the case and there isn't anything they could do.

i didn't touch anything in that car, just sat there. i don't have $80 to give to some scammer, im trying to pay my own bills. absolutely horrible service. do not trust lyft!

and even afterwards, you can't change the rating you give your driver - so i'm guessing this driver does this all the time and no body can warn or report him because lyft does nothing. 

do not use.
